2017-12-09.abstract: Connected devices come with risks. Prioritize children’s privacy.
2017-12-09.snippet: Connected devices come with risks. Prioritize children’s privacy.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — During the holiday season, my husband and I tend to offer suggestions to those who are generous enough to insist on buying presents for our kids. Things like “Don’t spend more than $50” and “No guns.” Or, for those with whom we can be comfortably blunt, “Just cash, please.”
2017-12-09.headline_main: Don’t Give Kids Holiday Gifts That Can Spy on Them

2017-12-09.abstract: In the early days of creating the social network, we were at the mercy of internet providers. They could easily have killed the company.
2017-12-09.snippet: In the early days of creating the social network, we were at the mercy of internet providers. They could easily have killed the company.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: My first glimpse of a world without strong protections for net neutrality was in 2004, when I was part of the team that created Facebook. Though it’s hard to imagine now, TheFacebook (as it was called at the time) was just a fledgling college social network, growing school by school. Some colleges didn’t like Facebook, and because they functioned as their students’ internet providers, they would simply block the site.
2017-12-09.headline_main: What Facebook Taught Me About Net Neutrality

2017-12-09.abstract: Seven major league teams made the final round in the bidding, and then the 23-year-old Ohtani made his decision. The losers included the Mariners, Dodgers and Cubs.
2017-12-09.snippet: Seven major league teams made the final round in the bidding, and then the 23-year-old Ohtani made his decision. The losers included the Mariners, Dodgers and Cubs.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: What could be a new era in baseball now appears ready for a tryout next year in Anaheim, Calif.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Shohei Ohtani Could Be an Angel in the Outfield, and on the Mound

2017-12-09.abstract: The Trump administration’s threats of war will not make Kim Jong-un back down.
2017-12-09.snippet: The Trump administration’s threats of war will not make Kim Jong-un back down.

2017-12-09.abstract: Shutting down the M.T.A. trains on weeknights could provide much-needed relief.

2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: Politicians often shun the suggestion that they should avoid clichés like the plague, and officeholders in New York are no exception. Some of them have leaned extra hard lately on one of their more shopworn banalities: how theirs is the city that never sleeps.

2017-12-09.abstract: The idea that a candidate’s character doesn’t matter is pervasive and pernicious.
2017-12-09.snippet: The idea that a candidate’s character doesn’t matter is pervasive and pernicious.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: THERE have always been and always will be scoundrels in political life, especially one particular genus — the hypocrite — whose private behavior diverges from his public actions. But there is also a novel and ominous concept of the statesman emerging in American politics, most clearly in the gymnastic contortions being accomplished to justify support for the Senate campaign of Roy Moore, the former chief justice of Alabama: the politician as a disembodied policy array.
2017-12-09.headline_main: The Scoundrel Theory of American Politics

2017-12-09.abstract: The police seized Mr. Saakashvili in Kiev for a second time in a week amid a mounting feud with the Ukrainian president. This time they manage to hold on to him.
2017-12-09.snippet: The police seized Mr. Saakashvili in Kiev for a second time in a week amid a mounting feud with the Ukrainian president. This time they manage to hold on to him.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Mikheil Saakashvili, the former president of Georgia, was arrested on Friday in Ukraine during a late-night police raid on an apartment where he had been hiding after his escape from custody following a rooftop struggle with security agents this week.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Mikheil Saakashvili, Ex-President of Georgia, Arrested in Ukraine, Again

2017-12-09.abstract: The Marlins slugger used his no-trade clause to block potential deals with the Giants and Cardinals but is said to be willing to play for the Dodgers, Cubs, Astros or Yankees.
2017-12-09.snippet: The Marlins slugger used his no-trade clause to block potential deals with the Giants and Cardinals but is said to be willing to play for the Dodgers, Cubs, Astros or Yankees.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: With 59 home runs and a National League Most Valuable Player Award last season, Giancarlo Stanton gave a precious gift to Derek Jeter, the new chief executive of the Miami Marlins. Stanton, in full bloom as baseball’s pre-eminent slugger, would be a commodity on the trade market.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Two Teams Are Out on Giancarlo Stanton; Could the Yankees Be In?

2017-12-09.abstract: Horst Faas defined a new breed of war photographer.
2017-12-09.snippet: Horst Faas defined a new breed of war photographer.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: On Dec. 6, 1967, Horst Faas, the chief photographer of The Associated Press in Vietnam, was pinned down in a slim trench among the rubber trees lining the American air base at Bu Dop, just a few miles from the Cambodian border. It was less than two months before the launch of the Tet offensive and the area was teeming with Viet Cong activity.
2017-12-09.headline_main: The Man Who Shot Vietnam

2017-12-09.abstract: Fires burned here even before there was a city.
2017-12-09.snippet: Fires burned here even before there was a city.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Before the fires came, our skin turned dry and the winds cleared the smog from the air. November passed with barely any rain, and on Thanksgiving the high was 92 degrees. We Angelenos had been blessed with a beautiful autumn. But all the while, we felt a sense of doom.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Doom Season in Los Angeles

2017-12-09.abstract: From Mali to Afghanistan, jihadists promised to retaliate over the decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israel’s capital. But ISIS took aim, instead, at them.
2017-12-09.snippet: From Mali to Afghanistan, jihadists promised to retaliate over the decision to recognize Jerusalem as Israel’s capital. But ISIS took aim, instead, at them.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: Osama bin Laden was just 14 when his mother noticed that he had stopped watching his favorite Westerns. She found him fixated instead on news reports about Palestinians, tears streaming down his face as he watched TV in their home in Saudi Arabia.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Terrorist Groups Vow Bloodshed over Jerusalem Decision. ISIS? Less So.

2017-12-09.abstract: Take that excitement down a notch, Stu Ockman.
2017-12-09.snippet: Take that excitement down a notch, Stu Ockman.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — As Deb and her intrepid cruciverbal Argonauts embark, so I arise from the depths of the Atlantic, rubbing the salt from my eyes and brushing the mermaid’s purses out of my hair, for there can be but one of us at a time at sea, and only one ruling the land.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Giggle

2017-12-09.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, December 9, 2017.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: “I played the game I learned in seventh grade when a boy likes you. You make up some reason so that you protect their feelings, so that they don’t get angry with you, and you still manage to escape. It’s a skill a 12-year-old girl learns that she needs for the rest of her life.”
2017-12-09.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: At Columbia, Three Women, 30 Years and a Pattern of Harassment

2017-12-09.abstract: The enduring hotel has a lively history — and now, a more modern style from the designer Adam Tihany. The rooms are larger too.
2017-12-09.snippet: The enduring hotel has a lively history — and now, a more modern style from the designer Adam Tihany. The rooms are larger too.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: New Delhi’s Oberoi hotel has a dear place in my heart, as it does for many city natives. On special occasions, including my sixth birthday, my parents and grandmother would take my sister and me to the property’s restaurant, the Café, for afternoon tea and pastries — the flaky chocolate cake was a favorite. But my family’s affiliation with the property predated me: my mother, Kiran, and my father, Vikesh, used to frequent the Oberoi’s lobby in the early 1970s with their college friends; the hotel was the epicenter for India’s glitterati, and they were always on the lookout for a boldface sighting.
2017-12-09.headline_main: The Oberoi Hotel in New Delhi Got a Major Makeover. Here Is a First Look.

2017-12-09.abstract: Alabama struggles with health care, education and infrastructure. But such issues have often been forgotten during the race between Doug Jones and Roy S. Moore.
2017-12-09.snippet: Alabama struggles with health care, education and infrastructure. But such issues have often been forgotten during the race between Doug Jones and Roy S. Moore.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: HALEYVILLE, Ala. — The hospital here, the only one in the county, is planning to close this month.
2017-12-09.headline_main: With Alabama Senate Race Defined by Scandal, Policy Issues Are Overlooked

2017-12-09.abstract: Hot toys are often like comets, lighting up the sky and fading quickly from view. But some have been more enduring. Here are some of the biggest hits.
2017-12-09.snippet: Hot toys are often like comets, lighting up the sky and fading quickly from view. But some have been more enduring. Here are some of the biggest hits.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: The Fingerling Monkey may be this year’s hottest toy, but its popularity is far from unparalleled. A new must-have toy seems to arrive every holiday season. Richard Gottlieb, the chief executive of Global Toy Experts and publisher of Global Toy News, discussed some of the Fingerling’s craze-making predecessors over the last generation.
2017-12-09.headline_main: 10 Hot Toys That Changed the Way People Play

2017-12-09.snippet: The motorized plastic monkey that grasps your finger is the must-have gift of the holiday season, thanks to marketing, pricing and, well, scarcity.

2017-12-09.headline_main: How the Fingerling Caught On (Robot Grip and All) as 2017’s Hot Toy

2017-12-09.abstract: After #MeToo, families discuss sexual assault.
2017-12-09.snippet: After #MeToo, families discuss sexual assault.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: After millions of #MeToo tweets and an onslaught of media exposés of sexual misconduct accusations against public figures, some readers are broaching the topic of sexual assault with their families, revealing experiences they once felt too ashamed to discuss.

2017-12-09.abstract: Rising incomes allow China’s growing numbers of aging people to become snowbirds in the south — enjoying life post-retirement in a way previous generations never imagined.
2017-12-09.snippet: Rising incomes allow China’s growing numbers of aging people to become snowbirds in the south — enjoying life post-retirement in a way previous generations never imagined.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: SANYA, China — While the white-sand beaches and five-star international resorts are meant to be the main attraction, for the hundreds of thousands of Chinese retirees who descend upon this tropical city every winter, dancing on the seaside promenade is often the real draw.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Welcome to China’s Florida: Sun, Sand and Retired Snowbirds

2017-12-09.abstract: On today’s episode we hear from letter writers who have something to confess but are afraid to hurt others with the power of their words.

2017-12-09.abstract: Sensuality circles! High teas! Expensive vape pens! Who says there’s no intellectual life in this fine city?
2017-12-09.snippet: Sensuality circles! High teas! Expensive vape pens! Who says there’s no intellectual life in this fine city?
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Carli Jo Bidlingmaier was talking to a group of 20-somethings in a living room in the Bel-Air neighborhood here, weeks before the wildfires. She was explaining that consuming marijuana allows a woman to awaken her “yoni,” a Sanskrit term for vagina favored by Hollywood bohemians.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Hey, ‘Budtender’: Los Angeles’s Power Brokers of Pot Crank Up the Kook

2017-12-09.abstract: Many retirees are “looking to achieve more of their potential,” but that can be a lot of pressure. Instead, some are taking a leisurely cue from their parents’ generation.
2017-12-09.snippet: Many retirees are “looking to achieve more of their potential,” but that can be a lot of pressure. Instead, some are taking a leisurely cue from their parents’ generation.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: Before Art Lerner retired, he could not imagine how he would fill the days. He had few hobbies — come to think of it, only one: fishing. But at his firm’s urging, Mr. Lerner, a money manager, had already stayed on the job for three more years than he intended, and “I’d had enough,” he said.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Leave the Bucket Lists to Those Ambitious Boomers. It’s Tee Time.

2017-12-09.abstract: Andre Wagner captured the brief window when kids run New York.
2017-12-09.snippet: Andre Wagner captured the brief window when kids run New York.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: It really started around my fifth year in New York — both friends and strangers telling me that I needed to accept the harsh reality of becoming a “New Yorker.” This conversation was always awkward, less because of the premise and more the tone: It was consistently less congratulatory and more gotcha. But that made sense: New York City is the great collector of souls, eternally capable in the art of lengthening stays and erasing plans of ever leaving.
2017-12-09.headline_main: After-School Special

2017-12-09.abstract: Our reporters used body language, histories, documents and more to discover who paid $450 million for the da Vinci.
2017-12-09.snippet: Our reporters used body language, histories, documents and more to discover who paid $450 million for the da Vinci.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: Perhaps the most challenging — often maddening — aspect of covering auctions is trying to figure out who bought what. Indeed, the competitive current coursing through the press corps at any auction is largely fueled by the desire to match the dealers or art advisers bidding in the room (or the auction specialists taking bids on the phone) with the buyers they represent.
2017-12-09.headline_main: The Long Search to Ferret Out the ‘Salvator Mundi’ Buyer

2017-12-09.abstract: The bold portrait of Mr. Weinstein that ran on the front page this week led to some strong reader reactions. We explain the selection process.
2017-12-09.snippet: The bold portrait of Mr. Weinstein that ran on the front page this week led to some strong reader reactions. We explain the selection process.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: The Reader Center is one way we in the newsroom are trying to connect with you, by highlighting your perspectives and experiences and offering insight into how we work.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Readers and The Times Respond to Harvey Weinstein’s Page One Portrait

2017-12-09.abstract: The Federal Reserve chair (don’t call her “chairwoman”) quietly achieved rock-star status. Now that she’s leaving, her many fans are sad to see her go.
2017-12-09.snippet: The Federal Reserve chair (don’t call her “chairwoman”) quietly achieved rock-star status. Now that she’s leaving, her many fans are sad to see her go.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: She has been called “a small lady with a large I.Q.” She has been mocked for wearing the same outfit to both her official White House nomination and her confirmation hearing. (“At least we know her mind won’t be preoccupied with haute couture,” a Washington gossip columnist wrote.) And when President Barack Obama once referred to Janet L. Yellen as “Mr. Yellen,” she didn’t bother correcting him.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Janet Yellen Didn’t Set Out to Be a Feminist Hero

2017-12-09.abstract: A tenant wonders how to get the landlord to improve security after packages are taken.
2017-12-09.snippet: A tenant wonders how to get the landlord to improve security after packages are taken.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: Q. Packages, including mine, have been taken from the mailroom of my rental apartment building in Hudson Heights. I filed a police report and alerted building management. Someone was arrested. But I am still concerned about security in our non-doorman building. For example, I saw a deliveryman using a credit card to pop open the lock to the entrance door to make a delivery. I have spoken with neighbors about circulating a petition demanding that the landlord improve security. But what are our rights? With the holidays coming, deliveries will only increase.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Can the Landlord Do Anything to Help Prevent Package Theft?

2017-12-09.abstract: A dental practice for children on Long Island has created a space that is designed to calm, and even entertain, its patients.

2017-12-09.abstract: Remember when U.S. workers supposedly couldn’t be employed?
2017-12-09.snippet: Remember when U.S. workers supposedly couldn’t be employed?
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: The latest job report was very good, except for one thing: wage growth is still much lower than it was before the financial crisis. And this reminds me of a controversy that raged around four or five years ago, during what now seems like a golden age – an era when it seemed as if facts and reasoned debate might actually matter for policy.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Pessimism and Paralysis in the Aftermath of the Financial Crisis

2017-12-09.abstract: “The world doesn’t stop just because I got sober,” said Michael McGarry, who has been clean for almost three years after a judge ruled that he be sent to a residential drug rehabilitation center.
2017-12-09.snippet: “The world doesn’t stop just because I got sober,” said Michael McGarry, who has been clean for almost three years after a judge ruled that he be sent to a residential drug rehabilitation center.

2017-12-09.abstract: With Twitter as his Excalibur, the president takes on his doubters, powered by long spells of cable news and a dozen Diet Cokes. But if Mr. Trump has yet to bend the presidency to his will, he is at least wrestling it to a draw.
2017-12-09.snippet: With Twitter as his Excalibur, the president takes on his doubters, powered by long spells of cable news and a dozen Diet Cokes. But if Mr. Trump has yet to bend the presidency to his will, he is at least wrestling it to a draw.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Around 5:30 each morning, President Trump wakes and tunes into the television in the White House’s master bedroom. He flips to CNN for news, moves to “Fox & Friends” for comfort and messaging ideas, and sometimes watches MSNBC’s “Morning Joe” because, friends suspect, it fires him up for the day.
2017-12-09.headline_main: Inside Trump’s Hour-by-Hour Battle for Self-Preservation

2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — I have a big soft spot in my heart for Ann Patchett, the author quoted in today’s Cox and Rathvon acrostic. At one point in my life, I (along with a lot of other people, I’m sure) recommended the “Patron Saint of Liars” to anyone and everyone I met.

2017-12-09.abstract: The Somalis boarded a flight to the war-torn country on Thursday, but the plane only made it as far as Senegal. Immigration officials cited logistical issues.
2017-12-09.snippet: The Somalis boarded a flight to the war-torn country on Thursday, but the plane only made it as far as Senegal. Immigration officials cited logistical issues.
2017-12-09.lead_paragraph: Ninety-two Somali citizens were flown out of the United States under orders of deportation on Thursday, but their plane never made it to Somalia. Nemtsov, was gunned down in 2015.

2017-12-10.abstract: Lebanese security forces fired tear gas and water cannons to disperse thousands of protesters outside the embassy near Beirut.
2017-12-10.snippet: Lebanese security forces fired tear gas and water cannons to disperse thousands of protesters outside the embassy near Beirut.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — Lebanese security forces on Sunday fired tear gas and water cannons into crowds that had gathered near the United States Embassy, in a sign that protests against President Trump’s decision to recognize Jerusalem as the capital of Israel may be escalating.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Protests in Lebanon Near U.S. Embassy After Trump’s Jerusalem Decision

2017-12-10.abstract: The risk can’t be ignored but isn’t as great as it may seem from a recent study.
2017-12-10.snippet: The risk can’t be ignored but isn’t as great as it may seem from a recent study.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: I have a severe intestinal condition known as ulcerative colitis. For some time, I’ve taken an immunosuppressant to control the flare-ups. Like all drugs, this one comes with side effects. While I’m on it, I have an increased risk of developing myelosuppression, a condition in which my bone marrow might stop producing blood cells and platelets. I also have an increased risk of developing skin cancer.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Birth Control and Breast Cancer: Putting the Risk in Perspective

2017-12-10.abstract: Andrew gave his mother, Regina Hensley, a reason to live. We follow the pair as she fights a history of addiction and he fights an aggressive form of cancer.

2017-12-10.abstract: Mr. Clifford, once Britain’s highest-profile publicity agent, was serving an eight-year sentence for assaulting women and girls as young as 15.
2017-12-10.snippet: Mr. Clifford, once Britain’s highest-profile publicity agent, was serving an eight-year sentence for assaulting women and girls as young as 15.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: Max Clifford, once the highest-profile public relations agent in Britain, died on Sunday after collapsing in the prison in which he was serving an eight-year sentence for sexual offenses against victims as young as 15. He was 74.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Max Clifford, Celebrity Publicist and Sex Offender, Dies After Collapsing in Prison

2017-12-10.abstract: A case study of the slow progress being made by the Trump administration in wrapping up an investigation into an industrial accident in East Liverpool, Ohio, that generated protests from area residents.
2017-12-10.snippet: A case study of the slow progress being made by the Trump administration in wrapping up an investigation into an industrial accident in East Liverpool, Ohio, that generated protests from area residents.

2017-12-10.abstract: An analysis of enforcement data at the E.P.A. shows a substantial drop in activity against polluters when compared with the Obama and Bush administrations.
2017-12-10.snippet: An analysis of enforcement data at the E.P.A. shows a substantial drop in activity against polluters when compared with the Obama and Bush administrations.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: EAST LIVERPOOL, Ohio — The highway billboard at the entrance to town still displays a giant campaign photograph of President Trump, who handily won the election across industrial Ohio. But a revolt is brewing here in East Liverpool over Mr. Trump’s move to slow down the federal government’s policing of air and water pollution.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Under Trump, E.P.A. Has Slowed Actions Against Polluters, and Put Limits on Enforcement Officers

2017-12-10.abstract: Using information from a public database, the analysis covered activity during the first 266 days of E.P.A. leaders in the Trump, Obama and Bush administrations.
2017-12-10.snippet: Using information from a public database, the analysis covered activity during the first 266 days of E.P.A. leaders in the Trump, Obama and Bush administrations.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: The analysis by The New York Times of the Trump administration’s record in enforcing environmental regulations was based on data compiled by the Environmental Protection Agency and publicly available in its Enforcement and Compliance History Online database.
2017-12-10.headline_main: How The Times Compared E.P.A. Enforcement Across Three Administrations

2017-12-10.abstract: After a hard life as a single mother in the Bronx, Rosa Iris Vega retired to her childhood home in Puerto Rico. Hurricane Maria sent her back to northern exile.
2017-12-10.snippet: After a hard life as a single mother in the Bronx, Rosa Iris Vega retired to her childhood home in Puerto Rico. Hurricane Maria sent her back to northern exile.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: There really ought to be a law about playing “En Mi Viejo San Juan” these days. Even in the best of times, the song’s melancholy lyrics about a native son longing to return to Puerto Rico before dying is guaranteed to make listeners cry. This season — with tens of thousands forced to flee the island after the devastation of Hurricane Maria — the tear-jerker takes on a special meaning as a new generation of reluctant migrants is forced to find shelter with relatives in New York, Florida and elsewhere.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Gone With the Wind, a Puerto Rican Dream

2017-12-10.abstract: The annual concert of hitmakers at Madison Square Garden slighted pop’s diversity, offering a narrow definition of what “hit radio” looked like in 2017.
2017-12-10.snippet: The annual concert of hitmakers at Madison Square Garden slighted pop’s diversity, offering a narrow definition of what “hit radio” looked like in 2017.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: A seismic rumble. Lightning-flash strobes. A walloping kick-drum beat topped by a buzzing bass tone and hissing pink noise. Video screens pulsating in black, white and red. And at center stage of what looked like a Nine Inch Nails concert was Taylor Swift.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Review: Taylor Swift Leads a Jingle Ball Full of Hardheaded Women and Nice Guys

2017-12-10.abstract: In a proposal, the Defense Department is also seeking looser oversight of its operations in Somalia, where it doubled the number of airstrikes it carried out this year.
2017-12-10.snippet: In a proposal, the Defense Department is also seeking looser oversight of its operations in Somalia, where it doubled the number of airstrikes it carried out this year.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Amid its escalating campaign of drone strikes in Somalia, the Pentagon has presented the White House with an operational plan that envisions at least two more years of combat against Islamist militants there, according to American officials familiar with internal deliberations.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Pentagon Foresees at Least Two More Years of Combat in Somalia

2017-12-10.abstract: Two Syrian refugees scraped to get by with their daughter in Lebanon. But when they took out a loan that they couldn’t repay after the blaze, their situation worsened.
2017-12-10.snippet: Two Syrian refugees scraped to get by with their daughter in Lebanon. But when they took out a loan that they couldn’t repay after the blaze, their situation worsened.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: HALBA, Lebanon — In her three-room apartment here, Fatima al-Ewy yearned for her old life in Syria.
2017-12-10.headline_main: They Lost Their Country. Then a Fire Robbed Them of Even More.

2017-12-10.abstract: The president said the reporter, Dave Weigel, should be fired for a photo he posted on Twitter of a sparsely filled arena before a rally for the president in Florida.

2017-12-10.abstract: With only hours until the polls open in the unlikeliest of battleground states, Democrats are deploying a multimillion-dollar get-out-the-vote operation in an effort to steal away a Senate seat.
2017-12-10.snippet: With only hours until the polls open in the unlikeliest of battleground states, Democrats are deploying a multimillion-dollar get-out-the-vote operation in an effort to steal away a Senate seat.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: SELMA, Ala. — In the poinsettia-trimmed pulpit of Ebenezer Missionary Baptist Church on Sunday morning, the Rev. James Perkins Jr., the first black mayor of a city where the right to vote was won in blood, announced his support for the Democrat Doug Jones in Alabama’s special Senate election. He reminded his Selma congregants, without telling them how to vote, that sheep are to follow their shepherd.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Liberal Outsiders Pour Into Alabama Senate Race, Treading Lightly

2017-12-10.abstract: No one was injured after a masked gang tossed Molotov cocktails at the building in Gothenburg, but three men were held on suspicion of arson.
2017-12-10.snippet: No one was injured after a masked gang tossed Molotov cocktails at the building in Gothenburg, but three men were held on suspicion of arson.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: GOTHENBURG, Sweden — The Swedish police arrested three people on Sunday after a masked gang hurled Molotov cocktails at a synagogue in the port city of Gothenburg as it hosted an event on Saturday night.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Three Arrested After Firebomb Attack on Swedish Synagogue

2017-12-10.abstract: Christie’s had planned to sell the map this week, for possibly $1.2 million, but withdrew it from an auction when questions arose about its authenticity.
2017-12-10.snippet: Christie’s had planned to sell the map this week, for possibly $1.2 million, but withdrew it from an auction when questions arose about its authenticity.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: The map seemed to be an unbelievable find, an unknown fifth original of the rarest of documents, a vision of the world, circa 1507, by the famed German cartographer Martin Waldseemüller. It features 12 so-called globe gores — like a world map drawn on an orange peel that has been sectioned and squashed flat.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Why Experts Don’t Believe This Is a Rare First Map of America

2017-12-10.abstract: Watching the “Me, Too” campaign, some Afghan women are more willing to talk about assaults. But the danger to their lives if they do has not diminished.
2017-12-10.snippet: Watching the “Me, Too” campaign, some Afghan women are more willing to talk about assaults. But the danger to their lives if they do has not diminished.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — “You’re ugly, Maryam, everyone says so, but I guess you’re a virgin so when you’re ready to have sex, let me know and I will be glad to …” Her male co-worker, writing on her Facebook account, finished the sentence obscenely.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Harassment All Around, Afghan Women Weigh Risks of Speaking Out

2017-12-10.abstract: After the British foreign minister met with President Hassan Rouhani and expressed concern about the detained British-Iranian national, her husband said he felt renewed hope.
2017-12-10.snippet: After the British foreign minister met with President Hassan Rouhani and expressed concern about the detained British-Iranian national, her husband said he felt renewed hope.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — Britain’s foreign secretary, Boris Johnson, left Tehran on Sunday without a clear public resolution on the fate of Nazanin Zaghari-Ratcliffe, the imprisoned British-Iranian dual citizen whose plight he had been accused of worsening.

2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: Recently, I was on a morning peak hour train in Melbourne, and there was a tall, middle-aged woman sitting down on one of the disabled seats, with a young man in front of her standing up (they didn’t know each other).

2017-12-10.abstract: Susan Soon He Stanton’s new play uses only audio interactions, from voice mail to intercom, to tell a story about the breakdown of intimacy.
2017-12-10.snippet: Susan Soon He Stanton’s new play uses only audio interactions, from voice mail to intercom, to tell a story about the breakdown of intimacy.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: Like sadomasochists, playwrights sometimes seek freedom through peculiar restraints. Beckett’s experiments in deprivation — his monodrama “Not I” stars a pair of lips — explore how much can be removed from the theatrical experience and still leave theater. Other recent one-arm-tied challenges have included epistolary plays, plays performed in darkness and plays spoken in invented languages. Bess Wohl’s marvelous “Small Mouth Sounds” is set at a silent retreat.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Review: In ‘Today Is My Birthday,’ Love Is a Butt Dial

2017-12-10.abstract: Melissa Mark-Viverito, who must leave her post as City Council speaker because of term limits, is weighing her next political move.
2017-12-10.snippet: Melissa Mark-Viverito, who must leave her post as City Council speaker because of term limits, is weighing her next political move.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: When Melissa Mark-Viverito was elected as City Council speaker, some feared that her loyalty to Mayor Bill de Blasio would curtail her independence and influence.
2017-12-10.headline_main: No Longer at the Mayor’s Flank, Mark-Viverito Charts a New Path

2017-12-10.abstract: In another quiet weekend at multiplexes, “Coco” was No. 1, “Justice League” continued to disappoint and “Wonder” crossed the $100 million mark.
2017-12-10.snippet: In another quiet weekend at multiplexes, “Coco” was No. 1, “Justice League” continued to disappoint and “Wonder” crossed the $100 million mark.

2017-12-10.abstract: Hoping to woo companies that will move employees from London, leaders in Paris are trying to replace red tape with a red carpet.
2017-12-10.snippet: Hoping to woo companies that will move employees from London, leaders in Paris are trying to replace red tape with a red carpet.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: PARIS — The phone rings a lot at Paris Region Entreprises, a one-stop shop for companies deciding whether to move employees to the City of Light. Typically, callers ask about visas and minutiae of employment law. But not long ago, an executive from Japan called with a stumper: Where, he asked, are the dancing clubs?
2017-12-10.headline_main: As Brexit Looms, Paris Tries a Business Makeover

2017-12-10.abstract: The comments by Ms. Haley, the United Nations ambassador, broke from the administration’s assertion that the allegations are false and voters rightly dismissed them.
2017-12-10.snippet: The comments by Ms. Haley, the United Nations ambassador, broke from the administration’s assertion that the allegations are false and voters rightly dismissed them.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Nikki R. Haley, the American ambassador to the United Nations, said on Sunday that women who have accused President Trump of sexual misconduct “should be heard,” a surprising break from the administration’s longstanding assertion that the allegations are false and that voters rightly dismissed them when they elected Mr. Trump.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Nikki Haley Says Women Who Accuse Trump of Misconduct ‘Should Be Heard’

2017-12-10.abstract: The ballet had its premiere on Saturday in front of a starry crowd that didn’t include its director, who’s under house arrest.
2017-12-10.snippet: The ballet had its premiere on Saturday in front of a starry crowd that didn’t include its director, who’s under house arrest.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — “A country that does not value its heroes is such a shame.” That’s a line spoken late in the Bolshoi Ballet’s “Nureyev,” the much anticipated, gossiped about, postponed and rescheduled new ballet about the great Russian dancer Rudolf Nureyev that opened at the Bolshoi Theater amid intense speculation and rumor here on Saturday.
2017-12-10.headline_main: ‘Nureyev’ Opens at Bolshoi After Delay and Much Speculation

2017-12-10.abstract: In a major turnaround, Matthias Müller said that Germany should consider phasing out tax breaks that have encouraged diesel’s popularity in Europe.
2017-12-10.snippet: In a major turnaround, Matthias Müller said that Germany should consider phasing out tax breaks that have encouraged diesel’s popularity in Europe.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: The chief executive of Volkswagen said on Sunday that the German government should consider phasing out the subsidies that encourage Europeans to buy diesel cars, a startling change of position by the company largely responsible for diesel’s popularity in Europe.
2017-12-10.headline_main: VW Chief Breaks Ranks on Diesel, Suggesting End to Subsidies

2017-12-10.abstract: The battle to drive the Islamic State out of Mosul left much of the city in ruins. Now, residents are pulling together to rebuild.
2017-12-10.snippet: The battle to drive the Islamic State out of Mosul left much of the city in ruins. Now, residents are pulling together to rebuild.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: MOSUL, Iraq — In the heat of the late summer sun, weeks after the end of one of the largest urban battles since World War II, a high school principal trekked from his home in east Mosul to the west bank of the Tigris River to confront the ruins of his life’s work.
2017-12-10.headline_main: After Fall of ISIS, Iraq’s Second-Largest City Picks Up the Pieces

2017-12-10.abstract: China scolded Australia for its fears of foreign influence in politics.
2017-12-10.snippet: China scolded Australia for its fears of foreign influence in politics.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull of Australia revealed proposed laws to curb foreign influence in Australian politics, following reports of Chinese influence in Australian politics. The legislation is modeled on American laws that ban foreign campaign donations and require registration of foreign agents. The Chinese Embassy in Australia scolded Australian officials.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Heng on Chinese Influence in Australian Politics

2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: Several times in Steven Spielberg’s prolific career, he’s released two films within a few months, like “Jurassic Park” in June 1993 and “Schindler’s List” that December. Up to this point, the less weighty movie (“War of the Worlds,” “The Adventures of Tintin”) has always come out first, followed by a more serious Oscar contender (“Munich,” “War Horse”).
2017-12-10.headline_main: New Trailer: ‘Ready Player One,’ From Steven Spielberg

2017-12-10.abstract: Pep Guardiola’s Manchester City won by 2-1 at Manchester United, the surest sign yet that, even with half the season to go, the Premier League title is City’s to lose.
2017-12-10.snippet: Pep Guardiola’s Manchester City won by 2-1 at Manchester United, the surest sign yet that, even with half the season to go, the Premier League title is City’s to lose.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: MANCHESTER, England — Pep Guardiola conceded long ago that those few minutes after a game, when the news media extracts its pound of flesh, are José Mourinho’s domain.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Three Points and Six Words: ‘We Won Because We Were Better’

2017-12-10.abstract: The Trump administration isn’t alone in criticizing the World Trade Organization. But it may be the only country trying to subvert it.
2017-12-10.snippet: The Trump administration isn’t alone in criticizing the World Trade Organization. But it may be the only country trying to subvert it.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As officials from the 164 countries in the World Trade Organization gather in Buenos Aires this week for their first major meeting in two years, they will be watching to see whether the United States, once the group’s biggest advocate, is seeking to subvert it.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Once the W.T.O.’s Biggest Supporter, U.S. Is Its Biggest Skeptic

2017-12-10.abstract: The Federal Reserve has signaled its move this week. Investors, though, want to know whether the central bank will continue with its patient approach to rates.
2017-12-10.snippet: The Federal Reserve has signaled its move this week. Investors, though, want to know whether the central bank will continue with its patient approach to rates.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Reserve is expected to end the year by raising its benchmark interest rate for just the fifth time since the financial crisis, as it continues to slowly unwind its post-crisis stimulus campaign. But pressures are building that could prompt the Fed to start moving a little more quickly.
2017-12-10.headline_main: A Fed Rate Increase Is Expected. But What Comes Next?

2017-12-10.headline_main: How Much for That Tree? $35 in Harlem, or $135 in SoHo

2017-12-10.abstract: President Nicolás Maduro hailed victories in municipal elections that many voters deemed a foregone conclusion.
2017-12-10.snippet: President Nicolás Maduro hailed victories in municipal elections that many voters deemed a foregone conclusion.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: CARACAS, Venezuela — The governing party of President Nicólas Maduro was dominating municipal elections across Venezuela late Sunday, winning nearly all major cities, according to early results, and further consolidating Mr. Maduro’s power as the country enters a presidential election year.
2017-12-10.headline_main: As Venezuela Opposition Shuns Vote, Leader’s Party Tightens Grip on Power

2017-12-10.abstract: Jamar Roberts’s new “Members Don’t Get Weary” was emotional and virtuosic. And Twyla Tharp’s 1983 “Golden Section,” set to David Byrne, returned.
2017-12-10.snippet: Jamar Roberts’s new “Members Don’t Get Weary” was emotional and virtuosic. And Twyla Tharp’s 1983 “Golden Section,” set to David Byrne, returned.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: John Coltrane and David Byrne aren’t casual choices for a choreographer looking for dance music — at least they shouldn’t be. Yet last week, Alvin Ailey American Dance Theater proved that there’s a place for both. Twyla Tharp’s “The Golden Section,” set to music by Mr. Byrne and returning to the repertory this season, still shimmers. True, the dancers need more time to live in the groove of her tricky coordinations — the movement needs to look as though it’s melting off the body — but nothing checks that box faster than performance time.
2017-12-10.headline_main: At Ailey, a Dance Set to Coltrane Finds a Somber Radiance

2017-12-10.abstract: When the Islamic State seized territory in Iraq and Syria, it had the time and space to industrialize advanced weapons manufacturing. The results included explosive space heaters and chemical rockets.
2017-12-10.snippet: When the Islamic State seized territory in Iraq and Syria, it had the time and space to industrialize advanced weapons manufacturing. The results included explosive space heaters and chemical rockets.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Late this spring, Iraqi forces fighting the Islamic State in Mosul discovered three unfired rocket-propelled grenades with an unusual feature — a heavy liquid sloshing inside their warheads. Tests later found that the warheads contained a crude blister agent resembling sulfur mustard, a banned chemical weapon intended to burn a victim’s skin and respiratory tract.

2017-12-10.abstract: Charities and churches shouldn’t be involved in political campaigns.
2017-12-10.snippet: Charities and churches shouldn’t be involved in political campaigns.
2017-12-10.lead_paragraph: As the House and the Senate seek agreement on tax reform, they will have to decide the fate of the so-called Johnson amendment. This provision of the Internal Revenue Code prohibits tax-exempt charities from electioneering — that is, from becoming involved in any way in a candidate’s campaign for elected office. The tax reform bill passed by the House last month loosened this prohibition to the point where it would no longer prohibit much. The Senate’s tax reform bill made no change to current law.
2017-12-10.headline_main: Leave the Johnson Amendment Alone

Booker Jr., an award-winning journalist and author who provided pioneering coverage of racial injustice and the civil rights struggle for readers of Jet and Ebony magazines and was The Washington Post’s first black reporter, died on Sunday in Solomons, Md. He was 99.

That amounts to an annual state subsidy (that is, taxpayer money) of $15,000 to $19,000 per promised job — more than five times the typical subsidy, according to job development specialists.

I hadn’t, but she was the third friend to ask me about it in a two-week span. Our teacher, Chloe, had tried it. Her verdict: “I’m really more of a heat person.”

2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: STAVANGER, Norway — Olympic-caliber speedskaters sometimes race for more than six miles, and gold medals can be determined by hundredths of a second. Countries that take the sport seriously have looked for every possible scientific advantage, from the composition of the hinge that connects the skate blade to the boot to the aerodynamics of hoods on racing suits.

2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: The potentially harmful effects of loneliness and social isolation on health and longevity, especially among older adults, are well established. For example, in 2013 I reported on research finding that loneliness can impair health by raising levels of stress hormones and inflammation, which in turn can increase the risk of heart disease, arthritis, Type 2 diabetes, dementia and even suicide attempts.

2017-12-11.snippet: The midseason finale continued to call into question the relationship between the show and its fan base.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: As the eighth season of “The Walking Dead” has sunk itself into the “All Out War” story line and the extended conflict with Negan, the writing staff has entered into an unspoken understanding with its patient audience. This season has gotten repeatedly bogged down by chatter, positioning and repositioning characters for an impending reckoning. When a show makes the choice to frame so much of itself as anticipatory, it had better have the firepower to back up that promise. But much in the same way that leaders on both sides have reneged on their social contracts by neglecting to protect their followers, the writers have punished viewers with inertia and bitter nihilism.
2017-12-11.headline_main: ‘The Walking Dead’ Season 8, Episode 8: The Sacrificial Lamb

2017-12-11.abstract: Kenneth Dillard Jr., 68, has worked for nonprofit organizations for much of his life. But when he lost his job, he struggled to find work and became homeless.
2017-12-11.snippet: Kenneth Dillard Jr., 68, has worked for nonprofit organizations for much of his life. But when he lost his job, he struggled to find work and became homeless.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Kenneth Dillard Jr. remembers the day he committed to improving the lives of others instead of his own.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Working in Philanthropy, Then Finding Himself in Need

2017-12-11.abstract: The only team that has paid a luxury tax in each of the 18 seasons it has existed said 2018 would be different. Then Giancarlo Stanton became available.
2017-12-11.snippet: The only team that has paid a luxury tax in each of the 18 seasons it has existed said 2018 would be different. Then Giancarlo Stanton became available.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: It is known colloquially as the luxury tax and euphemistically as the competitive balance tax. In practice, though, baseball’s tax on its most profligate spenders has really been a Yankees tax.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Giancarlo Stanton Deal Will Test the Yankees’ Newfound Fiscal Discipline

2017-12-11.abstract: The short fiction piece made an enormous splash after it was published in The New Yorker, prompting discussions about dating, power and consent.
2017-12-11.snippet: The short fiction piece made an enormous splash after it was published in The New Yorker, prompting discussions about dating, power and consent.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: When a short story makes a splash these days, you can see the ripples in real time.
2017-12-11.headline_main: ‘Cat Person’ in The New Yorker: A Discussion With the Author

2017-12-11.abstract: Il Laboratorio del Gelato has opened a second branch that mimics the original.
2017-12-11.snippet: Il Laboratorio del Gelato has opened a second branch that mimics the original.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: After 15 years on the Lower East Side, Il Laboratorio del Gelato is adding a Greenwich Village branch. It may look familiar since the owner Jon Snyder’s intent is to mimic the flagship bright-white dipping shop on the corner of Ludlow and East Houston Streets, down to the rotating menu of 48 flavors. The new location includes a holiday ice cream layer cake with chocolate-Kahlúa and eggnog gelatos, crushed amaretto cookies and a frosting of crunchy pink peppermint-stick gelato. The cake is available in three sizes ($39 to $89; with the smallest size on hand, and the larger ones to order with three day’s notice), and come January, gelato sandwiches will be assembled to order: Il Laboratorio del Gelato, 56 University Place (10th Street), 212-343-9922, laboratoriodelgelato.com.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Greenwich Village Gets Its Own Gelato Lab

2017-12-11.abstract: The New York Times editorial board would like to hear from readers about their experiences with domestic violence and law enforcement.
2017-12-11.snippet: The New York Times editorial board would like to hear from readers about their experiences with domestic violence and law enforcement.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: The New York Times editorial board would like to hear from readers about their experiences with domestic violence and law enforcement.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Domestic Violence and Firearms: Share Your Story

2017-12-11.abstract: We may covet gemstones for their beauty, but their real value lies in what they tell scientists about the extreme forces at work deep underground.
2017-12-11.snippet: We may covet gemstones for their beauty, but their real value lies in what they tell scientists about the extreme forces at work deep underground.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Around 1920, Justo Daza, an experienced mine worker, and Fritz Klein, a mining engineer, were scrambling over the steep mountainside terraces of Chivor, a legendary emerald site in northeast Colombia. They were breaking rocks apart with long iron poles and explosives packed into drill holes. They were hunting for new emerald veins and not finding any.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Precious Gems Bear Messages From Earth’s Molten Heart

2017-12-11.abstract: “The Complete Poems of A. R. Ammons” showcases, in two very large volumes, the friendly and searching style of a writer who twice won the National Book Award.
2017-12-11.snippet: “The Complete Poems of A. R. Ammons” showcases, in two very large volumes, the friendly and searching style of a writer who twice won the National Book Award.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: “That’s not writing, that’s typing,” Truman Capote said about Jack Kerouac, who wrote “On the Road” on a 120-foot scroll of paper and rarely revised.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Adding Up a Prolific Poet’s Charming Weather Reports

2017-12-11.abstract: The venerable experimental troupe Mabou Mines incorporates “Frankenstein,” fetishwear and puppetry in excavating the playwright’s obsessions.
2017-12-11.snippet: The venerable experimental troupe Mabou Mines incorporates “Frankenstein,” fetishwear and puppetry in excavating the playwright’s obsessions.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Blow out your candles, Laura. And close your eyes. You might not want to see this.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Review: A Gothic Tennessee Williams Mash-Up in ‘Glass Guignol’

2017-12-11.abstract: Employment agencies across the region recruit thousands of migrants for Foxconn and other businesses, with conditions and pay that few in-country nationals would accept.
2017-12-11.snippet: Employment agencies across the region recruit thousands of migrants for Foxconn and other businesses, with conditions and pay that few in-country nationals would accept.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: PARDUBICE, Czech Republic — As dusk settled over the rambling Czech countryside, a group of haggard workers emerged from a dank three-story concrete dormitory and jammed into buses. The evening shift was about to begin at two nearby factories owned by Foxconn and Panasonic.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Europe’s Thirst for Cheap Labor Fuels a Boom in Disposable Workers

2017-12-11.abstract: A team of conservationists documented the plight of an emaciated polar bear in the Canadian Arctic Archipelago. Now some wonder what can be done to save them.
2017-12-11.snippet: A team of conservationists documented the plight of an emaciated polar bear in the Canadian Arctic Archipelago. Now some wonder what can be done to save them.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: As his boat came around a corner last August, Paul Nicklen spotted what at first looked like a white blanket draped over a rock. And although he kept his distance, it soon became clear the blanket was not actually a blanket at all; it was a polar bear — one Mr. Nicklen thought was surely dead.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Video of Starving Polar Bear ‘Rips Your Heart Out of Your Chest’

2017-12-11.abstract: New packaging from Nicolas Feuillatte pays homage to the skylines of five American cities.
2017-12-11.snippet: New packaging from Nicolas Feuillatte pays homage to the skylines of five American cities.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Champagne on the New Year’s Eve shopping list? Certainly. And for gift-giving, Nicolas Feuillatte — whose brut reserve is reliable and reasonably priced — is introducing a gift package decorated with the golden skylines of a number of American cities: New York, Chicago, Los Angeles, Miami and Seattle. The “Cityscape” boxes hold well-rounded yet delicate Champagne, made mostly with red grapes (40 percent each pinot noir and pinot meunier, and 20 percent chardonnay). Wine shops in each of the cities carry the appropriate box: In New York at Sherry-Lehmann, $29.99, 212-838-7500; Chicago at SavWay Fine Wines and Spirits, $24.98, 630-325-6550; Los Angeles at Alan’s Market, $28.99, 310-822-2233; Miami at Crown Wine and Spirits, $31.97, 305-264-4210; and Seattle at Fred Meyers, $32.99, 206-297-4300.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Champagne With a View

2017-12-11.abstract: Amid a blur of question marks and conflicting polls, Roy S. Moore, the Republican, and Doug Jones, the Democrat, made their final appeals to voters Monday.
2017-12-11.snippet: Amid a blur of question marks and conflicting polls, Roy S. Moore, the Republican, and Doug Jones, the Democrat, made their final appeals to voters Monday.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Read the latest on the Alabama Senate race here with our live updates.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Alabama Senate Race, Unlikely Nail-Biter, Races to Finish Line

2017-12-11.abstract: Le Thé Blanc from Kusmi Tea is a white tea delicately scented with raspberry and rose.
2017-12-11.snippet: Le Thé Blanc from Kusmi Tea is a white tea delicately scented with raspberry and rose.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: For the first time in its 150-year history, Kusmi Tea is introducing a white tea, a type made from the very first tea leaves that sprout in the spring. The Paris-based company collaborated with the chef Alain Ducasse on the blend, which includes green tea and is delicately scented with raspberry and rose. It comes in a handsome white canister. The company recommends brewing the tea for three minutes in water at 176 degrees Fahrenheit. The leaves can be steeped twice: Kusmi Tea Le Thé Blanc, 4.3 ounces, $49, Kusmi Tea Boutiques, kusmitea.com.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Alain Ducasse Collaborates on a Floral Tea

2017-12-11.abstract: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2017-12-11.snippet: Here’s what you need to know to start your day.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Good morning.
2017-12-11.headline_main: New York City, North Korea, Jerusalem: Your Tuesday Briefing

2017-12-11.abstract: The Oscar-winning actor concentrates on subtle acting in his new production of “Falstaff” at Opera Vlaanderen in Belgium.
2017-12-11.snippet: The Oscar-winning actor concentrates on subtle acting in his new production of “Falstaff” at Opera Vlaanderen in Belgium.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: ANTWERP, Belgium — Christoph Waltz acts musically — even operatically. Characters like the cunning S.S. officer he played in Quentin Tarantino’s film “Inglourious Basterds,” for which he won the first of two Oscars, and the sybaritic profiteer in the coming “Downsizing” draw much of their sly charisma from Mr. Waltz’s artful flow and pacing, and his command of vocal shades from soft purr to sharp steel.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Christoph Waltz, Directing Opera, Moves From Tarantino to Verdi

2017-12-11.abstract: Marinated sardines from Greece add a new twist to a Feast of the Seven Fishes antipasto platter.
2017-12-11.snippet: Marinated sardines from Greece add a new twist to a Feast of the Seven Fishes antipasto platter.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Here is an alluring addition to an antipasto platter for the Feast of the Seven Fishes: meaty cured sardines from Greece. A family that has been in the business of preserving fish for more than 100 years first marinates the sardines, then packs them in sunflower and olive oils. It is one of those items that deserve to be kept on hand: Trikalinos Marinated Sardine Fillets, $19.95 for seven ounces, Lucy’s Whey, 1417 Lexington Avenue (East 93rd Street), 212-289-8900, lucyswhey.com or rogerscollection.us; shipping available.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Cured Sardines for a Christmas Eve Feast

2017-12-11.abstract: The bomb, constructed by stuffing match heads into a narrow length of pipe, failed to blast apart and turn into shrapnel.
2017-12-11.snippet: The bomb, constructed by stuffing match heads into a narrow length of pipe, failed to blast apart and turn into shrapnel.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Pipe bombs, generally easy to build and simple to operate, are the most commonly used explosive device in the United States.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Crude Pipe Bomb Malfunctioned in Manhattan Attack, Authorities Say

2017-12-11.abstract: The British panto tradition finds a welcoming home on the Lower East Side.
2017-12-11.snippet: The British panto tradition finds a welcoming home on the Lower East Side.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: America has an acute case of Anglophilia, but it’s a highly selective one. We love “Downton Abbey,” Shakespeare and John Oliver but studiously ignore prawn-cocktail-flavored crisps, Cliff Richard and pantomime. The new Off Broadway show “Jack and the Beanstalk,” presented at the Abrons Arts Center, may help rectify the situation regarding panto, a vaudeville-derived, proudly lowbrow genre that happily endorses an anything-goes approach.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Review: ‘Jack and the Beanstalk’ Is a Holiday Treat Worth Savoring

2017-12-11.abstract: President Trump had announced on Twitter in July that he was barring transgender people from serving in the military, though a ban was never fully implemented.

2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Transgender people will be allowed to enlist in the military beginning Jan. 1, Defense Department officials said on Monday, a move that pauses President Trump’s effort to bar transgender troops.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Transgender People Will Be Allowed to Enlist in the Military as a Court Case Advances

2017-12-11.abstract: “A Tribute to Barbara Cook” will honor her life and work with a night of songs, stories and speeches on Dec. 18. Ms. Cook died this year at age 89.

2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: The Broadway community will honor the life and work of Barbara Cook, who died this year at age 89, with a night of songs, stories and speeches. The show, “A Tribute to Barbara Cook,” is set for Dec. 18 at the Vivian Beaumont Theater at Lincoln Center in Manhattan.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Celebrating Barbara Cook’s Life With Songs and Stories

2017-12-11.abstract: The Golden Globe nomination on Monday was especially gratifying for the “Molly’s Game” actress, who has been an outspoken critic of sexual harassment.
2017-12-11.snippet: The Golden Globe nomination on Monday was especially gratifying for the “Molly’s Game” actress, who has been an outspoken critic of sexual harassment.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Jessica Chastain received news of her Golden Globe nomination for best actress in a dramatic feature while promoting that film, “Molly’s Game,” in Paris. Directed by Aaron Sorkin, the film tells the true story of Molly Bloom, a world-class skier who began running high-stakes, celebrity-magnet poker games. Speaking by phone shortly before she was due to fly to Amsterdam, Ms. Chastain said the Globe nomination was especially gratifying because she had been outspoken about recent sexual harassment accusations and had worried that she would face industry repercussions.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Jessica Chastain Feared Speaking Out Would Hurt Her Career

2017-12-11.abstract: Readers are appalled that a man accused of sexual misconduct involving children might be elected to the Senate. One decries “blind partisanship.”
2017-12-11.snippet: Readers are appalled that a man accused of sexual misconduct involving children might be elected to the Senate. One decries “blind partisanship.”
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-12-11.headline_main: Eyes on Alabama and Roy Moore

2017-12-11.abstract: If it goes to the question of impeachment, Congress will need help.
2017-12-11.snippet: If it goes to the question of impeachment, Congress will need help.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: While President Trump’s allies have unleashed a political assault on the investigation led by the special counsel, Robert Mueller, his lawyers are arguing that Mr. Mueller lacks even the legal authority to investigate the president for obstruction of justice. The president, they maintain, fully controls the executive branch and possesses the constitutional power to dismiss a subordinate like James Comey, the former F.B.I. director, for any reason. They have garnered support for this position from some legal scholars who concur that the president’s motives are not subject to challenge if he is discharging his constitutional functions.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Why Team Trump Needs to Lay Off the Mueller Probe

2017-12-11.abstract: Few predicted when Mexico joined the free-trade deal that it would transform the country in a way that would saddle millions with diet-related illnesses.
2017-12-11.snippet: Few predicted when Mexico joined the free-trade deal that it would transform the country in a way that would saddle millions with diet-related illnesses.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: SAN CRISTÓBAL DE LAS CASAS, Mexico — William Ruiz Sánchez spends his days grilling burgers and slathering fried hot dogs with pepperoni and cheese at his family’s restaurant. Refrigerators and fire-engine red tables provided by Coca-Cola feature the company’s logo in exchange for exclusive sale of its drinks.
2017-12-11.headline_main: A Nasty, Nafta-Related Surprise: Mexico’s Soaring Obesity

2017-12-11.abstract: Three knock-your-socks-off seasons, all newly streaming.
2017-12-11.snippet: Three knock-your-socks-off seasons, all newly streaming.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Watching is The New York Times’s TV and film recommendation website. Sign up for our thrice-weekly newsletter here.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Three Shows to Watch This Week

2017-12-11.abstract: A long-awaited document says the $1.5 trillion plan will pay for itself, assuming robust economic growth from a host of policies yet to be enacted.
2017-12-11.snippet: A long-awaited document says the $1.5 trillion plan will pay for itself, assuming robust economic growth from a host of policies yet to be enacted.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Treasury Department released a one-page analysis of the nearly 500-page Senate tax bill on Monday that suggested the $1.5 trillion plan would more than pay for itself, assuming the economy grows much faster than any independent analysis of the bill has projected.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Treasury Defends Tax Plan Cost With One-Page Analysis

2017-12-11.abstract: Forests will be decimated as trees become less resilient to drought and higher temperatures, new data suggest.
2017-12-11.snippet: Forests will be decimated as trees become less resilient to drought and higher temperatures, new data suggest.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: HELENA, Montana — Ponderosa pine and pinyon forests in the American West will die at an increasing rate as the world grows warmer, becoming less and less resilient when they are weakened by higher temperatures, according to new projections.
2017-12-11.headline_main: With Climate Change, Tree Die-Offs May Spread in the West

2017-12-11.abstract: Are you a podcast obsessive? Join us on Monday, Dec. 18, for a live meetup of the New York Times Podcast Club.
2017-12-11.snippet: Are you a podcast obsessive? Join us on Monday, Dec. 18, for a live meetup of the New York Times Podcast Club.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Welcome to Times Insider Events — live programming for Times Insiders and their guests. Times Insider offers behind-the-scenes insights into news, features and opinion at The New York Times.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Live Event: Podcast Club, IRL, With the Hosts of ‘By the Book’

2017-12-11.abstract: “Spoon” by Daniel Rozensztroch captures the humble utensil in myriad forms.
2017-12-11.snippet: “Spoon” by Daniel Rozensztroch captures the humble utensil in myriad forms.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: How many spoons? The author of this astonishing coffee-table book, Daniel Rozensztroch, has a collection of more than 2,000 spoons, assembled over 13 years of traveling. Many have made it into the book. The spoons are grouped according to material — wood, glass, mother-of-pearl, bone, metal, horn, ceramic, enamel and porcelain — and they range from rustic to exquisitely crafted: “Spoon” by Daniel Rozensztroch, photographs by Francis Amiand (Pointed Leaf Press, $50).
2017-12-11.headline_main: For Spoon Collectors and Design Enthusiasts

2017-12-11.abstract: The U.K. prime minister had to calm waters roiled by her own cabinet members, who seemed to undercut a hard-won agreement Friday to keep talks alive.
2017-12-11.snippet: The U.K. prime minister had to calm waters roiled by her own cabinet members, who seemed to undercut a hard-won agreement Friday to keep talks alive.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: LONDON — After striking a last-minute deal with European Union leaders last week to keep withdrawal talks going, Prime Minister Theresa May of Britain on Monday battled to sell her agreement at home, chiefly by putting out fires ignited by two members of her cabinet.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Theresa May Quiets Brexit Deal Critics — in Her Own Party

2017-12-11.abstract: The Irish band has its eighth No. 1 album, including one in each of the last four decades.
2017-12-11.snippet: The Irish band has its eighth No. 1 album, including one in each of the last four decades.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: The arrival of Taylor Swift’s “Reputation” on streaming services was no match for a good old-fashioned album from U2.
2017-12-11.headline_main: U2’s ‘Songs of Experience’ Tops Taylor Swift on the Billboard Chart

2017-12-11.abstract: Riders complained that Lyft and Uber were profiteering off a terror attack near Times Square, and the companies then turned off surge pricing.
2017-12-11.snippet: Riders complained that Lyft and Uber were profiteering off a terror attack near Times Square, and the companies then turned off surge pricing.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: As the supply of subways and buses vanished around Times Square during the Monday morning rush, the demand for cabs increased. The result: fare increases from Uber and Lyft, whose algorithms automatically adjust price based on the volume of requests.
2017-12-11.headline_main: After a Midtown Blast, Ride-Hailing Prices Spike, Briefly

2017-12-11.abstract: Fewer people are parking their cars at airports, using taxis or renting cars. And fees from Uber and Lyft do not make up for the lost revenue from those services.
2017-12-11.snippet: Fewer people are parking their cars at airports, using taxis or renting cars. And fees from Uber and Lyft do not make up for the lost revenue from those services.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: For many air travelers, getting to and from the airport has long been part of the whole miserable experience. Do they drive and park in some distant lot? Take mass transit or a taxi? Deal with a rental car?
2017-12-11.headline_main: Airports Are Losing Money as Ride-Hailing Services Grow

2017-12-11.abstract: Lucian Wintrich was arrested in November after a scuffle with a woman who took papers from his lectern.
2017-12-11.snippet: Lucian Wintrich was arrested in November after a scuffle with a woman who took papers from his lectern.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Prosecutors have dropped the breach of peace charge against Lucian Wintrich, the conservative pundit who grabbed a woman after she took papers from his podium during an appearance last month at the University of Connecticut, his lawyer said on Monday.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Gateway Pundit Writer Will Not Face Charge in UConn Scuffle

2017-12-11.abstract: The Harry Ransom Center in Texas has digitized and made available roughly half of the novelist’s archive, including a draft of an unpublished memoir.
2017-12-11.snippet: The Harry Ransom Center in Texas has digitized and made available roughly half of the novelist’s archive, including a draft of an unpublished memoir.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: When Gabriel García Márquez’s archive was sold to the University of Texas two years ago, some decried the fact that the literary remains of Latin America’s foremost novelist — and a fierce critic of American imperialism — had come to rest in the United States.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Gabriel García Márquez’s Archive Freely Available Online

2017-12-11.abstract: Changes are needed at the World Trade Organization, but weakening it has consequences for U.S. firms.
2017-12-11.snippet: Changes are needed at the World Trade Organization, but weakening it has consequences for U.S. firms.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s statements against the World Trade Organization hurt America first. The president is no friend to the global trade body, which is hunkering down for its biennial confab. Reforms are needed, but America has won most of the complaints it has brought to the global trade body, including against China.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Trump’s Criticism of W.T.O. Hurts America First

2017-12-11.abstract: Pete Wells picks the favorite things he ate (or drank) this year, from bacon-y mussels to a grandma-style pizza.
2017-12-11.snippet: Pete Wells picks the favorite things he ate (or drank) this year, from bacon-y mussels to a grandma-style pizza.

2017-12-11.headline_main: The Top 10 New York Dishes of 2017

2017-12-11.abstract: With a Golden Globe nomination for “The Disaster Artist,” the actor, director and recent “SNL” host talks about making a good movie about a bad one, and the wave of sexual harassment allegations in Hollywood.
2017-12-11.snippet: With a Golden Globe nomination for “The Disaster Artist,” the actor, director and recent “SNL” host talks about making a good movie about a bad one, and the wave of sexual harassment allegations in Hollywood.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: James Franco has never made a film as critically reviled as “The Room,” the infamous subject of his new movie-about-the-movie-business “The Disaster Artist,” which he both stars in and directs. But as a comedic actor who now spends much of his time behind the camera, he knows what it’s like to struggle to be taken seriously in Hollywood.
2017-12-11.headline_main: James Franco Can Relate to Tommy Wiseau

2017-12-11.abstract: Bitcoin futures open fresh avenues for trading, but for now the new contracts have little utility beyond speculation.
2017-12-11.snippet: Bitcoin futures open fresh avenues for trading, but for now the new contracts have little utility beyond speculation.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Bitcoin action is now available without the Bitcoin. The Chicago Board Options Exchange started offering futures on the cryptocurrency late on Sunday. The new contracts open fresh avenues for trading, but for now they have little utility beyond speculation.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Bitcoin Futures Set Scene for More Gambling

2017-12-11.abstract: The magazine said it “severed ties” with Mr. Lizza, its Washington correspondent, over “improper sexual conduct.” He denied that charge.
2017-12-11.snippet: The magazine said it “severed ties” with Mr. Lizza, its Washington correspondent, over “improper sexual conduct.” He denied that charge.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: The New Yorker said Monday that it had fired Ryan Lizza, the magazine’s Washington correspondent, after it said he had engaged in what it called “improper sexual conduct,” a charge that Mr. Lizza denied.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Ryan Lizza Fired by The New Yorker Over Sexual Misconduct Allegation

2017-12-11.abstract: As the authorities searched for clues, those who knew Akayed Ullah described the trappings of an ordinary immigrant life in Brooklyn.
2017-12-11.snippet: As the authorities searched for clues, those who knew Akayed Ullah described the trappings of an ordinary immigrant life in Brooklyn.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: On the surface, Akayed Ullah seemed to be an ordinary member of a Bangladeshi enclave in Brooklyn. He often prayed at a mosque in an unassuming brownstone in the Kensington section of the borough, where a few thousand of his countrymen reside. Like many immigrants in New York, he made his living — at least for a while — driving for a car service.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Suspect in Times Square Bombing Leaves Trail of Mystery

2017-12-11.abstract: Mr. Hanley served for four decades in New York City’s labor relations office and won productivity gains and respect from union negotiators.
2017-12-11.snippet: Mr. Hanley served for four decades in New York City’s labor relations office and won productivity gains and respect from union negotiators.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: James F. Hanley, who started work as a union electrician and went on to become New York City’s chief labor negotiator for nearly 15 years, died on Wednesday on Staten Island. He was 69.
2017-12-11.headline_main: James Hanley, Labor Negotiator for Three Mayors, Dies at 69

2017-12-11.abstract: Mr. Loeb turned a floundering Money into one of the nation’s most successful publications in the 1980s and led a similar revival at Fortune.
2017-12-11.snippet: Mr. Loeb turned a floundering Money into one of the nation’s most successful publications in the 1980s and led a similar revival at Fortune.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: Marshall R. Loeb, a business journalist who turned a floundering Money magazine into one of the nation’s most successful publications in the 1980s and then led a similar revival at Fortune, died on Saturday in Manhattan. He was 88.

2017-12-11.abstract: McCown, who is enjoying the best season of his career, sustained a broken left hand on Sunday. Bryce Petty will start for the Jets next week.

Crushed juniper berries contribute a distinctly piney note to the creamy cow’s milk cheese while also enlivening the satiny texture. It’s a high-fat quintuple-cream cheese, making it particularly indulgent. Serve it with a martini: The Blue Jay Juniper Berry Infused Quintuple Crème Blue by Deer Creek, $9.99 for 7.5 ounces, igourmet.com.

2017-12-11.abstract: A Treasury report on tax cuts that’s a sick joke, but very much in the modern G.O.P. tradition.
2017-12-11.snippet: A Treasury report on tax cuts that’s a sick joke, but very much in the modern G.O.P. tradition.
2017-12-11.lead_paragraph: On Monday the Treasury Department released a one-page report claiming that tax cuts would pay for themselves. The document was a shameless attempt to fool the public — carefully worded to imply that economic experts at Treasury (they’re still in there somewhere, maybe locked in a closet) had actually done an analysis to that effect, without explicitly saying so. In fact, there was no economic analysis; Trump officials just made up numbers that would give them the result they wanted.
2017-12-11.headline_main: Steve Mnuchin Pulls a Paul Ryan

2017-12-11.headline_main: Yes, the Truth Still Matters

But there is a notable exception, and it was amply displayed on Monday after an explosion in a busy transit corridor at Times Square. At such moments New York embodies the classic British slogan of World War II vintage: Keep calm and carry on.

2017-12-12.abstract: The choice lines and the soundtrack hits are there in this enjoyable adaptation of the movie. Now it’s time to make a full-fledged show out of a quasi concert.
2017-12-12.snippet: The choice lines and the soundtrack hits are there in this enjoyable adaptation of the movie. Now it’s time to make a full-fledged show out of a quasi concert.
2017-12-12.lead_paragraph: It’s no “Clueless,” but “Cruel Intentions” has endured better than most 1990s teen movies. Partly this has to do with its cast, especially Reese Witherspoon, just as good playing saintly as she would be ruthless in “Election” a couple of months later. But what really made Roger Kumble’s film stand out were the timeless structure and timely embroideries: a fail-safe plot based on the 18th-century novel “Les Liaisons Dangereuses” combined with an arch ’90s sensibility and an inspired soundtrack — the denouement, set to the Verve’s “Bitter Sweet Symphony,” was worthy of Scorsese.
2017-12-12.headline_main: Review: In This ‘Cruel Intentions,’ High School Schemers Sing the Best of the ’90s

2017-12-12.lead_paragraph: As we navigated our way out of the airport and onto a shuttle bus, we were surrounded by Brazilians and Argentines — not an American or European accent to be heard. This, for a North American, is part of the appeal of South American skiing: The experience is that of a world slightly tilted. There’s no English babble, and July and August are the best months for snow. I was here in the late North American summer with my partner, Alan, and an Argentine friend, Adrián, to explore the mountain sports resort of Chapelco, tucked into the Andes near the Chilean border in Patagonia.
2017-12-12.headline_main: At Chapelco in Argentina, Skiing, Steaks, Sun (and Few Crowds)

2017-12-12.abstract: Emily Bazelon moderates a round table with Anita Hill, Laura Kipnis, Lynn Povich, Soledad O’Brien, Amanda Hess and Danyel Smith to talk about how — or if — real change is possible.
2017-12-12.snippet: Emily Bazelon moderates a round table with Anita Hill, Laura Kipnis, Lynn Povich, Soledad O’Brien, Amanda Hess and Danyel Smith to talk about how — or if — real change is possible.
2017-12-12.lead_paragraph: Emily Bazelon: Sexual harassment has been clearly against the law since the 1980s. The Supreme Court said in 1986 that employers couldn’t let one employee create a hostile work environment for another or base advancement on a quid pro quo for sex. And we had what I might call a kind of mini revolution in the early ’90s after Anita’s testimony about Clarence Thomas before the Senate Judiciary Committee. Women saw that all-white-and-male array of senators, and there was an uprising. We got mad, and we fought back. More women entered politics, and more engaged in politics. I think a lot of people felt as if we were making progress.
2017-12-12.headline_main: The Conversation: Seven Women Discuss Work, Fairness, Sex and Ambition
