2017-12-22.snippet: This year, the most stunning (and unique) homes we’ve featured included a Fire Island kit house, an Italian castle and an all-gray apartment in Copenhagen.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: From a tiny Fire Island kit house, to an all-gray apartment in Copenhagen to a neo-Classical home in Milan, T has featured a wide range of stunning, one-of-a-kind homes this year. Click through our slide show for some of the best rooms we featured in 2017.
2017-12-22.headline_main: The Best Rooms in T in 2017

2017-12-22.abstract: The dominant sound this year was dark, traumatized and defensive, led by artists like Lil Uzi Vert, Future and Taylor Swift.
2017-12-22.snippet: The dominant sound this year was dark, traumatized and defensive, led by artists like Lil Uzi Vert, Future and Taylor Swift.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: “Push me to the edge/All my friends are dead,” Lil Uzi Vert intones in “XO TOUR Llif3,” at first in a matter-of-fact chant and later in a slurred, raw singsong. The backing track is a bass line going nowhere slowly, oozing to bind together twitches of electronic percussion and little tinkles and twangs that drift in and out. The lyrics, rapped and sung in an assortment of scratchy voices, juggle the bitterness of a crumbling relationship alongside career boasts and druggy, suicidal ramblings.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Pop Music in 2017: Glum and Glummer

2017-12-22.abstract: Shin Dong-bin received a suspended sentence, extending a long list of business titans in the country who have escaped the harshest punishments for breaking laws.
2017-12-22.snippet: Shin Dong-bin received a suspended sentence, extending a long list of business titans in the country who have escaped the harshest punishments for breaking laws.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: A court in Seoul, South Korea, on Friday convicted Shin Dong-bin, the chairman of the multinational Lotte Group, of embezzlement and breach of trust in connection with a corruption scandal, according to the Yonhap news agency.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Chairman of Lotte Group Is Convicted of Graft in South Korea, but Avoids Jail

2017-12-22.abstract: Night showers may be leisurely and relaxing, but our writer was surprised to learn that morning showers — or even two showers a day — may be better.
2017-12-22.snippet: Night showers may be leisurely and relaxing, but our writer was surprised to learn that morning showers — or even two showers a day — may be better.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: There were few greater sins in my childhood home than going to bed dirty, though I could sometimes appease my mother by just washing my feet before slipping between the clean sheets. Now, as an adult, I cannot bear to get in bed with the grime of the day clinging to my skin. And I’m not alone.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Should You Shower in the Morning, or at Night? Yes

2017-12-22.abstract: Two Times technology reporters discuss the goings-on of Silicon Valley and beyond. This week: more Bitcoin and Uber’s problems (again).
2017-12-22.snippet: Two Times technology reporters discuss the goings-on of Silicon Valley and beyond. This week: more Bitcoin and Uber’s problems (again).
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Each Friday, Farhad Manjoo and Mike Isaac, technology reporters at The New York Times, review the week’s news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Want this newsletter in your inbox? Sign up here.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Farhad and Mike’s Week in Tech: Cuckoo for Cryptocurrency

2017-12-22.abstract: The members of the Lucasfilm story group are fulfilling fans’ expectations — and creating meaningful female characters while they’re at it.
2017-12-22.snippet: The members of the Lucasfilm story group are fulfilling fans’ expectations — and creating meaningful female characters while they’re at it.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Princess Leia is tough, idealistic and frequently sardonic. Yet she is also quiet. Women in the original “Star Wars” trilogy spoke fewer than half as many words as their male colleagues did. Leia’s limited dialogue in “Star Wars” went unchallenged in 1977, but 40 years later, the lack of meaty roles for women and people of color in Hollywood is under new scrutiny. While those in the film industry ponder how to better reflect the diversity of human experience in their scripts, at Lucasfilm, a small group of women and men may have found one answer.
2017-12-22.headline_main: The Women Who Run the ‘Star Wars’ Universe

2017-12-22.abstract: For homeowners who worry about keeping their homes secure, choosing a security system in the digital age can be a dizzying process.
2017-12-22.snippet: For homeowners who worry about keeping their homes secure, choosing a security system in the digital age can be a dizzying process.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: After my sister’s house was broken into and burglarized last summer, I decided to get a home alarm. You would think that I would have had one already — buy a house and one of the first things your broker (or your mother) tells you to do is to secure the place.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Do Security Systems Make Your Home Safer?

2017-12-22.abstract: Our “Your Money” columnist answers questions about the bill, addressing student loan deductions, child care benefits, charitable deductions and more.
2017-12-22.snippet: Our “Your Money” columnist answers questions about the bill, addressing student loan deductions, child care benefits, charitable deductions and more.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: The Reader Center is one way we in the newsroom are trying to connect with you, by highlighting your perspectives and experiences and offering insight into how we work.
2017-12-22.headline_main: You Asked, Ron Lieber Answered: How Will This Tax Bill Affect You?

2017-12-22.abstract: Friday: Meat-free animal shelters, toys for hackers and where to celebrate a California Christmas.
2017-12-22.snippet: Friday: Meat-free animal shelters, toys for hackers and where to celebrate a California Christmas.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Good morning. California Today will take a break for the Christmas holiday. We’ll be back on Tuesday.
2017-12-22.headline_main: California Today: Should Shelter Dogs Be Vegan?

2017-12-22.abstract: Oxford Dictionaries’ Word of the Year drew some bafflement and derision. We asked readers to do better.
2017-12-22.snippet: Oxford Dictionaries’ Word of the Year drew some bafflement and derision. We asked readers to do better.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: The announcement that Oxford Dictionaries had chosen “youthquake” as its international Word of the Year, triumphing over a shortlist that also included “white fragility,” “kompromat” and “Antifa,” drew puzzlement across the English-speaking world.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Stop Trying to Make ‘Youthquake’ Happen: Readers Pick Their Words of the Year

2017-12-22.abstract: The capital’s dead holiday symbol stands for the city’s failings — and its residents’ enduring love for it.
2017-12-22.snippet: The capital’s dead holiday symbol stands for the city’s failings — and its residents’ enduring love for it.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: ROME — If the paragon of all Christmas trees is the one in front of the Rockefeller Center in New York — first erected, mind you, by an Italian in 1931 — the prize for most pitiful must go to the one that stands in Rome’s Piazza Venezia this year. Just days after it was put up, it began to gray and shed its needles, and soon it had become nearly see-through. The tree cuts so sad and forlorn a figure that it has been nicknamed Spelacchio, or Mangy.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Did Rome Kill Its Christmas Tree?

2017-12-22.abstract: Is a seemingly transparent top appropriate for a royal engagement photograph? The destuffing of the House of Windsor has reached a new stage.
2017-12-22.snippet: Is a seemingly transparent top appropriate for a royal engagement photograph? The destuffing of the House of Windsor has reached a new stage.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Meghan Markle, the soon-to-be wife of the man who is soon to be sixth in line to the British throne, set off something of a controversy this week when the couple’s official engagement photographs were released.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Meghan Markle’s Sheer Top Was a Sneaky Statement for a Royal Portrait

2017-12-22.abstract: Auction records tend to give a dazzling sheen to the international art world, but will they have a trickle-down effect on the rest of the market?
2017-12-22.snippet: Auction records tend to give a dazzling sheen to the international art world, but will they have a trickle-down effect on the rest of the market?
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Viewed from the top, 2017 has been a momentous year for the art market. After a Jean-Michel Basquiat sold for $110.5 million at auction in May, and a Leonardo da Vinci soared to $450.3 million last month, paintings by world-famous artists have never looked more expensive. But will the increasingly high prices paid for such trophies have a trickle-down effect on the rest of the art world?
2017-12-22.headline_main: It Was a Year of Mind-Boggling Prices, but ‘Art Is in a Funny Place’

2017-12-22.abstract: Workers at Melegatti, the maker of traditional Christmas cakes, have staved off layoffs by urging Italians to eat pandoro.
2017-12-22.snippet: Workers at Melegatti, the maker of traditional Christmas cakes, have staved off layoffs by urging Italians to eat pandoro.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: VERONA, Italy — Elena Galeotto, a longtime employee of Melegatti, Italy’s original producer of traditional pandoro Christmas cakes, scooped this season’s final mound of dough from the conveyor belt, rounded it and dropped it into a deep, star-shaped cast.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Pandoro Is Italy’s Christmas Miracle. Easter Is Another Story.

2017-12-22.abstract: Our columnist David Orr picks 10 favorites.
2017-12-22.snippet: Our columnist David Orr picks 10 favorites.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: The end of 2017 is a good time to reflect on the surprising fact that the past year was not all a dream. We do indeed live in a world in which President of the United States Donald John Trump routinely misuses quotation “marks” while conducting “foreign policy” on “Twitter”; we really have heard the last from Chuck Berry; and it is actually the case that a large number of powerful men appear to have been laboring for years under the impression that the American workplace was pants-optional. Given this reality, why not read some poems? It can’t hurt.
2017-12-22.headline_main: The Best Poetry of 2017

2017-12-22.abstract: Ms. Kruger talks about “In the Fade,” her first German-language film; winning best actress at the Cannes Film Festival; and why women are owning the moment in Hollywood.
2017-12-22.snippet: Ms. Kruger talks about “In the Fade,” her first German-language film; winning best actress at the Cannes Film Festival; and why women are owning the moment in Hollywood.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Who says you can’t go home again? Twenty-five years after departing her native Germany to model in Paris, Diane Kruger is finally starring in her first German-language movie — a role for which she won best actress at the Cannes Film Festival in May.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Diane Kruger Returns Home and Wins Big

2017-12-22.abstract: “Vampir Cuadecuc,” Pere Portabella’s highly regarded avant-garde film, is now available on DVD; so is Stan Brakhage’s “Anticipation of the Night.”
2017-12-22.snippet: “Vampir Cuadecuc,” Pere Portabella’s highly regarded avant-garde film, is now available on DVD; so is Stan Brakhage’s “Anticipation of the Night.”
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: “Vampir Cuadecuc” is a ghostly film as well as the ghost of a film and perhaps the ghost of cinema itself.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Elusive Vampire Film Steps Out of the Shadows

2017-12-22.abstract: Élise Béliveau, the widow of the Canadiens great Jean Béliveau, is a beloved regular at games and an inspiring presence for players and fans.
2017-12-22.snippet: Élise Béliveau, the widow of the Canadiens great Jean Béliveau, is a beloved regular at games and an inspiring presence for players and fans.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: MONTREAL — Hours before the puck drops at Bell Centre, Élise Béliveau can be found in the Salon des Anciens Canadiens. She converses with family and friends, sharing laughs and stories of yesteryear in a room where walls are decorated with framed photographs of her husband, Jean Béliveau, who won 10 Stanley Cups as a Canadiens player and seven more as a team executive.
2017-12-22.headline_main: The First Lady of the Canadiens Sits Behind the Montreal Bench

2017-12-22.abstract: Just days after the price of Bitcoin nearly reached $20,000, the virtual currency was hit by a panicked sell-off. Reddit users posted suicide hotlines.
2017-12-22.snippet: Just days after the price of Bitcoin nearly reached $20,000, the virtual currency was hit by a panicked sell-off. Reddit users posted suicide hotlines.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: You can’t exactly say that Bitcoin was burning a hole in anyone’s pocket, but the virtual currency burned a hole in quite a few hearts on Friday when it plunged 30 percent in less than 24 hours after defying gravity for the past few months.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Bitcoin Plummets More Than 30 Percent in Less Than a Day

2017-12-22.abstract: The Palestinian village of Qusra used to have friendly relations with the Jewish settlement of Migdalim. A struggle over land changed that.
2017-12-22.snippet: The Palestinian village of Qusra used to have friendly relations with the Jewish settlement of Migdalim. A struggle over land changed that.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: QUSRA, West Bank — It started as a bar mitzvah hike through rocky, biblical terrain. It ended with a Palestinian man shot dead and 20 traumatized Israeli schoolchildren sheltering in a cave from Palestinian stone-throwers.
2017-12-22.headline_main: An Israeli Settler, a Dead Palestinian and the Crux of the Conflict

2017-12-22.abstract: A Times analysis of his only publicly available tax return found that his tax bill would be about 30 percent less.
2017-12-22.snippet: A Times analysis of his only publicly available tax return found that his tax bill would be about 30 percent less.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: A Times analysis of his only publicly available tax return found that his tax bill would be about 30 percent less.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Trump Could Save More Than $11 Million Under the New Tax Plan

2017-12-22.abstract: There’s magic in the skates: On Wednesday nights, the Brooklyn Skate Club transforms a gymnasium in Bedford-Stuyvesant into a swirl of bodies.
2017-12-22.snippet: There’s magic in the skates: On Wednesday nights, the Brooklyn Skate Club transforms a gymnasium in Bedford-Stuyvesant into a swirl of bodies.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Wheels on wood. That soothing sound is a giveaway — the gymnasium at the Salvation Army Bedford Day Care Center in Bedford-Stuyvesant, Brooklyn, isn’t a sad, decaying space cheered up with Christmas lights and a disco ball. This gleaming setting is home to Brooklyn Skate Club, a weekly tonic for the soul.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Watch These Brooklyn Skate Club Regulars Dance Their Wheels Off

2017-12-22.abstract: In a final twist to a turbulent year in the fashion industry, another designer is leaving the brand she rebuilt.
2017-12-22.snippet: In a final twist to a turbulent year in the fashion industry, another designer is leaving the brand she rebuilt.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: A decade after transforming Céline into the favored label of power women everywhere and beginning a new era of minimalism in fashion, Phoebe Philo, its artistic director, has announced she is leaving the house.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Phoebe Philo Exits Céline, Adding to Fashion Turmoil

2017-12-22.abstract: Once the country leaves the European Union, Britons’ travel documents will return to a shade that was phased out in the name of solidarity.
2017-12-22.snippet: Once the country leaves the European Union, Britons’ travel documents will return to a shade that was phased out in the name of solidarity.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: LONDON — Britain’s journey into Brexit has been a little bumpy. Banking jobs are in peril, and doctors and nurses are heading back across the English Channel. Employers are struggling to find workers. Negotiations with the European Union on the British departure have been fractious.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Feeling Blue (and Feeling Good): U.K. Picks a Post-Brexit Passport Color

2017-12-22.abstract: If you’re struggling to figure out exactly how the tax overhaul will affect you, you’ve come to right place. Here is a brief overview of the new provisions, and what it means for your returns.
2017-12-22.snippet: If you’re struggling to figure out exactly how the tax overhaul will affect you, you’ve come to right place. Here is a brief overview of the new provisions, and what it means for your returns.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: If you’re struggling to figure out exactly how the tax overhaul will affect you, you’ve come to right place. Here is a brief overview of the new provisions, and what it means for your returns.
2017-12-22.headline_main: If You Want to Know How the New Tax Code Affects You, Read This First

2017-12-22.abstract: New York State officials report a rash of deaths as deer hunters fall out of their elevated platforms on trees.
2017-12-22.snippet: New York State officials report a rash of deaths as deer hunters fall out of their elevated platforms on trees.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Jeff Callahan can still recall the morning he dozed off while hunting deer from a homemade tree-stand in upstate New York.
2017-12-22.headline_main: For Hunters in the Woods, a Quiet Killer: Tree Stands

2017-12-22.abstract: President Trump signed the most significant overhaul of the American tax system in three decades, hastily adding the ceremony after media reports questioned whether he would sign it before Christmas.
2017-12-22.snippet: President Trump signed the most significant overhaul of the American tax system in three decades, hastily adding the ceremony after media reports questioned whether he would sign it before Christmas.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump signed the most consequential tax legislation in three decades on Friday, even as he complained that he has not been given credit for his administration’s accomplishments during a turbulent first year.
2017-12-22.headline_main: In Signing Sweeping Tax Bill, Trump Questions Whether He Is Getting Enough Credit

2017-12-22.abstract: As the economy has changed, so have the relationships between places, to the disadvantage of smaller cities and rural areas.
2017-12-22.snippet: As the economy has changed, so have the relationships between places, to the disadvantage of smaller cities and rural areas.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Well before anyone thought of this place as the center of the tech economy, the Bay Area built ships. And it did so with the help of many parts of the country.
2017-12-22.headline_main: What Happens When the Richest U.S. Cities Turn to the World?

2017-12-22.abstract: Make a festive dish of shredded duck on sautéed scallops, with hollandaise sauce, or feast on some breakfast recipes from Yotam Ottolenghi.
2017-12-22.snippet: Make a festive dish of shredded duck on sautéed scallops, with hollandaise sauce, or feast on some breakfast recipes from Yotam Ottolenghi.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Sam Sifton emails readers of Cooking five days a week to talk about food and suggest recipes. That email also appears here. To receive it in your inbox, register here. Download the NYT Cooking app here.
2017-12-22.headline_main: What to Cook This Weekend

2017-12-22.abstract: A Times editor sheds more light on how the newsroom investigation reached its conclusion about the reporter Glenn Thrush.
2017-12-22.snippet: A Times editor sheds more light on how the newsroom investigation reached its conclusion about the reporter Glenn Thrush.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: The Reader Center is one way we in the newsroom are trying to connect with you, by highlighting your perspectives and experiences and offering insight into how we work.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Readers React to Glenn Thrush’s Punishment; We Respond

2017-12-22.abstract: The tags bear a message that remind people that women in Ireland, where abortion is banned, must leave the country to have the procedure.
2017-12-22.snippet: The tags bear a message that remind people that women in Ireland, where abortion is banned, must leave the country to have the procedure.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: LONDON — As travelers board flights to Ireland and Northern Ireland for the Christmas holiday, they are finding themselves in the company of fliers toting a message on their luggage tags about the journey women on the island must make to have an abortion.
2017-12-22.headline_main: For Travelers to Ireland, Luggage Tags Make Statement on Abortion

2017-12-22.abstract: “New York Cocktails” by Amanda Schuster is a story of the cocktail told through the city.
2017-12-22.snippet: “New York Cocktails” by Amanda Schuster is a story of the cocktail told through the city.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: This fat 352-page book covers drinking in New York from every angle, justifying the notion that this is the epicenter of the cocktail world. You’ll find the classics, pre- and post-Prohibition trends, significant personalities in the drinks world and profiles of bars and lounges and their signature cocktails. The recipes for holidays include a cosmopolitan, made not with cranberry juice but shaken with cranberry sauce and strained: “New York Cocktails: An Elegant Collection of Over 100 Recipes Inspired by the Big Apple,” by Amanda Schuster (Cider Mill Press, $19.95).
2017-12-22.headline_main: New York, New York, a Wonderful Drinking Town

2017-12-22.abstract: St. Johnsville Jr., a small soft-ripening goat cheese, makes a subtle statement on the cheese board.
2017-12-22.snippet: St. Johnsville Jr., a small soft-ripening goat cheese, makes a subtle statement on the cheese board.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Anne Saxelby considers St. Johnsville Jr. soft-ripening goat cheese as a paragon of subtle elegance. It has a somewhat rumpled, downy white rind. The six-ounce disk of cheese, about three inches across, has a chalky center that turns to satin when fully ripe. The aroma is herbal, and the flavor is mild and fresh with a hint of musk: St. Johnsville Jr. goat cheese, Cochran Farm 1790, St. Johnsville, N.Y.; $13 for six ounces at Saxelby Cheese in the Essex Street and Chelsea markets, saxelbycheese.com.
2017-12-22.headline_main: A Small Gem for an Intimate Dinner

2017-12-22.abstract: Brother Guy Consolmagno once taught astronomy at Lafayette College. Now, he leads the Vatican’s centuries-old observatory at Castel Gandolfo.
2017-12-22.snippet: Brother Guy Consolmagno once taught astronomy at Lafayette College. Now, he leads the Vatican’s centuries-old observatory at Castel Gandolfo.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: ALBANO LAZIALE, Italy — Some 2,000 years ago, a celestial phenomenon is believed to have lit up the sky. Guiding the wise men of New Testament lore to the birthplace of Jesus, the star of Bethlehem has since become a planetarium and Christmas carol favorite.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Searching for the (Star) Light at the Vatican Observatory

2017-12-22.abstract: The Gene Autry standard
2017-12-22.snippet: The Gene Autry standard
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: The Gene Autry standard
2017-12-22.headline_main: Rudolph the Red Nosed Reindeer

2017-12-22.abstract: Divided politically, Muslims in Southeast Asia are united by support for Palestinians and anger at President Trump for calling Jerusalem Israel’s capital.
2017-12-22.snippet: Divided politically, Muslims in Southeast Asia are united by support for Palestinians and anger at President Trump for calling Jerusalem Israel’s capital.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: BANGKOK — A protest in Malaysia against President Trump’s decision to designate Jerusalem the capital of Israel brought together political foes on Friday, illustrating how solidarity with Palestinians has united disparate forces in the Muslim world.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Malaysian Leader Says World’s Muslims Should Not ‘Lose to the Jews’

2017-12-22.abstract: Petrossian’s triple-smoked salmon is a decadent way to ring in the New Year.
2017-12-22.snippet: Petrossian’s triple-smoked salmon is a decadent way to ring in the New Year.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Among the iterations of smoked and cured fish sold by Petrossian is a versatile new triple-smoked salmon. Prepared this way, their thick Tsar-Cut salmon is exceptionally meaty but still succulent, with a delicate salinity. The salmon can be sliced thin for canapés on toast or dark bread and served with Champagne to ring in the new, slivered to toss with buttered pasta or savored in scrambled eggs for that 2018 brunch: Petrossian Souhoï-style Tsar-Cut smoked salmon, $60 for a four-ounce slab, petrossian.com.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Salmon Fit for a Czar

2017-12-22.abstract: In acclaimed works like “The Children,” now on Broadway, the British writer argues for collective responsibility in the face of environmental and other challenges.
2017-12-22.snippet: In acclaimed works like “The Children,” now on Broadway, the British writer argues for collective responsibility in the face of environmental and other challenges.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: The British playwright Lucy Kirkwood gets the jitters on opening nights, and it was no different earlier this month when she made her Broadway debut with “The Children.” But at the post-show party, at a blues club near Times Square, politics proved an unexpectedly pleasant distraction.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Don’t Despair, Protest: Playwright Lucy Kirkwood Sees No Other Choice

2017-12-22.abstract: Acts of heinous violence uncorked women’s rage in countries as different as India and Argentina. What have they wrought, and what might American women learn?
2017-12-22.snippet: Acts of heinous violence uncorked women’s rage in countries as different as India and Argentina. What have they wrought, and what might American women learn?
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: As the sexual misconduct scandals continue to unfold, our gender team is providing updates and analysis on the coverage and conversation. Today, Somini Sengupta, a longtime international correspondent, looks at other countries’ public reckonings with sexual misconduct.
2017-12-22.headline_main: The #MeToo Moment: What Happened After Women Broke the Silence Elsewhere?

2017-12-22.abstract: The design from Joseph Joseph gives cooks more leverage when juicing lemons.
2017-12-22.snippet: The design from Joseph Joseph gives cooks more leverage when juicing lemons.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: This new juicer for lemons and limes provides more leverage than most typical hand-held citrus presses. Instead of downward pressure, you set the fruit cut side down in the stainless steel container, match the dots as you insert the top and then pull the handles together. Pits stay in the container: Joseph Joseph Helix citrus juicer, $20, josephjoseph.com/en-us.
2017-12-22.headline_main: A Citrus Press With More Torque

2017-12-22.abstract: A new sweet red onion has less pungency than the average allium.
2017-12-22.snippet: A new sweet red onion has less pungency than the average allium.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: The color is as bright as ever in this new sweet red onion grown in the Netherlands, but the typical bold pungency is absent. Slice them with abandon into salads and sandwiches, chop them to top a bowl of soup or tacos, or mince them for ceviche, all without shedding a tear. They’re excellent to grill: Gourmet USA sweet red onions, $1.99 a pound, Fairway Markets.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Onions Without the Tears

2017-12-22.abstract: Natural disasters force philanthropists to find ways to maintain the momentum created by so much attention to sustain long-term redevelopment.
2017-12-22.snippet: Natural disasters force philanthropists to find ways to maintain the momentum created by so much attention to sustain long-term redevelopment.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: This has been a heavy year of natural disasters: Hurricanes Harvey, Irma and Maria, wildfires in California, the Mexico City earthquake, a monsoon in Bangladesh.
2017-12-22.headline_main: How Disaster Charity Can Pivot to Sustainable Philanthropy

2017-12-22.abstract: Taxing elite universities is a mistake, a Harvard professor says. These institutions are engines for growth and have used some of their wealth to enable need-blind, full-need admissions.
2017-12-22.snippet: Taxing elite universities is a mistake, a Harvard professor says. These institutions are engines for growth and have used some of their wealth to enable need-blind, full-need admissions.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: The tax legislation approved this week by Congress is a mixed bag. It combines some badly needed reforms with various messy provisions seemingly designed to keep accountants and tax lawyers fully employed. But the part of the bill that most disappoints me is a small, simple change in policy: a new tax on large university endowments.
2017-12-22.headline_main: The Peril of Taxing Elite Higher Education

2017-12-22.abstract: Gordon Savory in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, sells a host of sandwiches and salads from a former Charlie Bird chef.
2017-12-22.snippet: Gordon Savory in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, sells a host of sandwiches and salads from a former Charlie Bird chef.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Gordon Savory, a compact shop in Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, is well stocked with tins of imported Spanish sardines, wedges of Reading raclette (an American version of the Swiss classic), condiments from Brooklyn Delhi and fresh croissants and baguettes. Anna Gordon and Steven Hartong, who own the Good Batch bakery across the street, opened the shop. Jason Rivera, a former sous-chef at Charlie Bird, makes artful sandwiches and salads, many of them featuring eggs boiled in that sweet spot between soft- and hard-cooked. Roast chicken and meatballs in sauce are sold to take home. There are a few counter stools near the window: Gordon Savory, 995a Fulton Street (St. James Place), Clinton Hill, Brooklyn, 347-889-5696; gordonsavory.com.
2017-12-22.headline_main: The Sandwich Game Is Strong in Brooklyn

2017-12-22.abstract: Flying cats and dogs from shelters where there is no room for them to places where they can find safer havens is this nonprofit’s mission.
2017-12-22.snippet: Flying cats and dogs from shelters where there is no room for them to places where they can find safer havens is this nonprofit’s mission.

2017-12-22.abstract: Half a century ago, “The Confessions of Nat Turner” was ensconced on top of the fiction list. But not without controversy.
2017-12-22.snippet: Half a century ago, “The Confessions of Nat Turner” was ensconced on top of the fiction list. But not without controversy.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: HAPPY OLD YEAR: Half a century ago, in the winter after the Summer of Love, American reading habits were as turbulent as the culture at large. William Styron’s novel of slave rebellion, “The Confessions of Nat Turner,” ruled the fiction best-seller list of Dec. 31, 1967, where it was joined by titles as varied as “The Exhibitionist” (Henry Sutton’s sex-soaked Hollywood romp), “The Chosen” (Chaim Potok’s coming-of-age tale about Jewish identity) and “The President’s Plane Is Missing” (Robert J. Serling’s political thriller about a constitutional crisis). And — in maybe the clearest sign that you would have needed the Richter scale to measure the zeitgeist of the late 1960s — the same list made room for both “Christy,” Catherine Marshall’s historical Christian romance, and “Rosemary’s Baby,” Ira Levin’s tale of satanic horror. Strange days, as the Doors noted that fall.
2017-12-22.headline_main: When William Styron Ruled the Best-Seller List

2017-12-22.abstract: Customs officials seized 68 pounds of cocaine from a woman who traveled to Lebanon from Venezuela. Two security officers were also arrested.
2017-12-22.snippet: Customs officials seized 68 pounds of cocaine from a woman who traveled to Lebanon from Venezuela. Two security officers were also arrested.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — A woman who is around 80 was arrested at Beirut’s international airport on Friday after trying to smuggle about 68 pounds of cocaine, according to government officials and state media in Lebanon, which called the illicit operation the largest in recent memory.

2017-12-22.abstract: The automaker said the vehicle could be shifted out of park without a driver’s foot on the brake. Seven injuries were linked to the defect.

2017-12-22.abstract: A video that captured an encounter between a Palestinian teenager and an Israeli soldier has roiled both Israelis and Palestinians.
2017-12-22.snippet: A video that captured an encounter between a Palestinian teenager and an Israeli soldier has roiled both Israelis and Palestinians.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — It is quite a video: A teenage girl, a kaffiyeh over her denim jacket, screaming in Arabic, repeatedly punches, slaps and kicks a heavily armed Israeli army officer, who faces her impassively, absorbing some blows, evading others, but never hitting back.
2017-12-22.headline_main: Acts of Resistance and Restraint Defy Easy Definition in the West Bank

2017-12-22.abstract: In his last Christmas sermon, Martin Luther King anticipated the links between ecology and social justice that are so pertinent today.
2017-12-22.snippet: In his last Christmas sermon, Martin Luther King anticipated the links between ecology and social justice that are so pertinent today.
2017-12-22.lead_paragraph: Fifty years ago Sunday — Christmas Eve 1967 — the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. stood in his pulpit at Ebenezer Baptist Church in Atlanta and told the congregation that in order to achieve peace on earth, “we must develop a world perspective,” a vision for the entire planet. “Yes,” he said, “as nations and individuals, we are interdependent.” Then, with a sentence that could easily have been uttered by John Muir or Rachel Carson, Dr. King stated, “It really boils down to this: that all life is interrelated.”
2017-12-22.headline_main: Dr. King’s Interconnected World

2017-12-23.snippet: When the food industry funds nutritionists, critics say it subverts science to preserve its market.
2017-12-23.lead_paragraph: KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia — Over the past three decades this increasingly prosperous nation has become the fattest country in Asia, with nearly half the adult population now overweight or obese. Several years ago, Dr. Tee E Siong, Malaysia’s leading nutrition expert, decided to act, organizing a far-reaching study of local diets and lifestyle habits.
2017-12-23.headline_main: In Asia’s Fattest Country, Nutritionists Take Money From Food Giants

2017-12-23.snippet: Heavy rains unleashed landslides and mudslides in remote communities while also causing rivers to overflow.
2017-12-23.lead_paragraph: MANILA — A tropical storm in the Philippines cut through a swath of the main southern island of Mindanao, killing at least 103 people and burying many in remote areas by landslides and mudslides just as families were preparing for Christmas, officials said Saturday.
2017-12-23.headline_main: Tropical Storm in Philippines Kills More Than 100 and Leaves Dozens Missing

2017-12-23.abstract: Christmas trees and poinsettias irk some longtime residents of an Upper West Side co-op.
2017-12-23.snippet: Christmas trees and poinsettias irk some longtime residents of an Upper West Side co-op.
2017-12-23.lead_paragraph: Q. We live in a large Upper West Side co-op built in the 1960s as middle-income housing. However, newer residents are typically much wealthier than longtime ones. Over the last few years, there has been a marked increase in Christmas decorations in the lobby — large Christmas trees, poinsettias and other items. But half of the residents are Jewish, and some tenants feel unwelcome by the extensive and opulent Christmas display.
2017-12-23.headline_main: Not Everyone Is Jolly About Christmas Trees in the Lobby

2017-12-23.abstract: Amier Agha was beaten and his best friend executed by fighters in Syria. Intent on escaping the country, he persevered in the face of visa problems and President Trump’s travel ban.
2017-12-23.snippet: Amier Agha was beaten and his best friend executed by fighters in Syria. Intent on escaping the country, he persevered in the face of visa problems and President Trump’s travel ban.

He would recall his younger brother’s new, prosperous life in San Francisco, which invariably made him think of images he had seen of sprawling metropolises and the New York City skyline. The thoughts filled him with warmth and wonder.
2017-12-23.headline_main: ‘I Was Not Going to Accept It’: After Captivity, Blind Syrian Forges Path to U.S.

2017-12-23.snippet: The Sugars answer a letter from a woman whose parents refuse to give her financial independence and a father weighing whether to cut off his adult son. In both cases, money comes with strings attached.

I could certainly opt to continue providing that support but should I?”

2017-12-23.lead_paragraph: Much has been made in recent weeks of “Phantom Thread,” the Paul Thomas Anderson movie about a 1950s couturier that opens, like a big present for us all, on Christmas Day. That is mostly because its star, Daniel Day-Lewis, has announced loudly that it will be his last film, and because his last collaboration with Mr. Anderson, “There Will Be Blood,” about the oil business, was such a power punch of a flick (and won Mr. Day-Lewis his second Oscar for best actor).

2017-12-23.abstract: Questions for the Army Corps of Engineers and the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority on the power failures on the island.
2017-12-23.snippet: Questions for the Army Corps of Engineers and the Puerto Rico Electric Power Authority on the power failures on the island.
2017-12-23.lead_paragraph: Some mountainous areas of Puerto Rico are going to be without electricity for as long as eight months, the United States Army Corps of Engineers said this week. It has been three months since Hurricane Maria swept through the island, knocking down tens of thousands of power poles and turning off virtually everyone’s lights. The amount of power being generated there is at about 65 percent of capacity — and it has been stuck around that level since late November.
2017-12-23.headline_main: Parts of Puerto Rico Won’t Have Power for 8 Months. What’s the Holdup?

2017-12-23.abstract: Mount Everest, Christmas carols, the year in pictures and the most expensive house in America (for now). Read all about them and get some breakfast recipes, too.
2017-12-23.snippet: Mount Everest, Christmas carols, the year in pictures and the most expensive house in America (for now). Read all about them and get some breakfast recipes, too.
2017-12-23.lead_paragraph: My, my — only one more week until 2018. (We’re purposely not reminding you how much time you don’t have left before Christmas.) Between wrapping gifts and wrapping up your New Year’s Eve plans, take a minute or an hour to invest in your intellect. Here are some of the best stories you may have missed.
2017-12-23.headline_main: 11 of Our Best Weekend Reads

2017-12-23.abstract: The degradation of the Pantanal region, one of the richest wildlife havens on the planet, is seen by critics as a sign of Brazil’s weakening resolve to protect its environment.

2017-12-23.abstract: The intelligence failure around the assault, more than the offensive itself, showed that American “victory” in Vietnam was impossible.
2017-12-23.snippet: The intelligence failure around the assault, more than the offensive itself, showed that American “victory” in Vietnam was impossible.
2017-12-23.lead_paragraph: When the Tet offensive ignited South Vietnam on Jan. 30, 1968, American forces were taken by surprise. Every one of the country’s 44 provinces was hit in a stunning, coordinated attack that changed the course of the war. With so many American resources in Vietnam focused on intelligence-gathering, why was the United States so clueless? My own experience with the United States Agency for International Development might shed some light on this lapse.
2017-12-23.headline_main: Why Did No One See the Tet Offensive Coming?

2017-12-23.lead_paragraph: I am completely in favor of federal spending on U.F.O. research, an outlay whose existence was revealed to surprisingly little paranoid excitement by this newspaper last week. It is a sign of civilizational health to devote excess dollars to the scientific fringe, and to hope that bizarre secrets still await discovery even in our satellite-surveilled world. So good for Harry Reid and his little-green-men-obsessed billionaire pal for keeping the flame of weird curiosity alive.

They haven’t been seen or heard from since.

Moore stood at a lectern this month and refused to concede the Alabama Senate race, one political reality was clear: An extraordinary turnout among black voters had helped push Doug Jones to a rare Democratic victory in this state.
2017-12-24.headline_main: Black Turnout in Alabama Complicates Debate on Voting Laws

2017-12-24.abstract: When an unexpected cold spell hit Myanmar, caretakers of orphaned animals pulled out giant blankets that had been knitted for them.
2017-12-24.snippet: When an unexpected cold spell hit Myanmar, caretakers of orphaned animals pulled out giant blankets that had been knitted for them.

2017-12-24.snippet: Even tax-cut-friendly models say 2018 wages won’t benefit from corporate cuts
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: “You all just got a lot richer,” Trump reportedly told guests at Mar-a-Lago. But Republicans will nonetheless keep insisting that the corporate tax cut that is the main item in the tax bill is really for the benefit of workers. They will be aided in this claim by some recent corporate announcements of bonuses or wage hikes that they attribute to the tax cut.
2017-12-24.headline_main: Trickle Down? Not Now, and Not for a While at Best (Wonkish)

2017-12-24.abstract: Since arriving at Saint Athanasius School in the Bronx, Marianne Kraft has nurtured youngsters for whom the school was a haven.
2017-12-24.snippet: Since arriving at Saint Athanasius School in the Bronx, Marianne Kraft has nurtured youngsters for whom the school was a haven.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: Marianne Kraft talks a lot about gifts. This being the Christmas season, you might think she was referring to the dozens of presents wrapped in holiday paper and stuffed into gift bags that take up a good chunk of space just inside Saint Athanasius School in the Bronx.
2017-12-24.headline_main: In the South Bronx, Watching Over Joseph, Mary and Jesus One Last Time

2017-12-24.snippet: A faded industrial town in the North Country region of New York State is relying on local residents’ crafts and wits to make its shopping center a destination again.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: MASSENA, N.Y. — When the Payless ShoeSource at the St. Lawrence Center closed this spring, it could have been just another statistic in a grim year for retailers, one more struggling shop gone in a dilapidated mall.
2017-12-24.headline_main: Town Fights to Turn Retail Tide at a Little Mall That Might

2017-12-24.abstract: Barbara Jatta has abandoned her predecessor’s moves to limit visitor numbers to the Holy See’s collection of treasures, including the Sistine Chapel.
2017-12-24.snippet: Barbara Jatta has abandoned her predecessor’s moves to limit visitor numbers to the Holy See’s collection of treasures, including the Sistine Chapel.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: VATICAN CITY — Vatican City has been governed by men since it was established as an independent state in 1929. A year ago, however, a woman  joined the upper ranks: Barbara Jatta, the first female director of the Vatican Museums.
2017-12-24.headline_main: A Woman Now Leads the Vatican Museums. And She’s Shaking Things Up.

2017-12-24.abstract: In Aaron Sorkin’s directorial debut, Jessica Chastain plays a gambling entrepreneur running a high-stakes poker game. Much talking, some walking.
2017-12-24.snippet: In Aaron Sorkin’s directorial debut, Jessica Chastain plays a gambling entrepreneur running a high-stakes poker game. Much talking, some walking.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: Words aren’t really exchanged in “Molly’s Game,” Aaron Sorkin’s directorial debut; they’re smashed like racquetballs. Life comes at you fast, and so do the words that rush out of Molly Bloom (Jessica Chastain) as she relays her tale. A poker entrepreneur who ran a high-stakes game before slamming into trouble, Molly is a speed-talker and somewhat of a close one, too. She delivers stretches of her story in a voice-over that suggests that Mr. Sorkin wrote and directed his movie with a stopwatch in one hand and a DVD of Howard Hawks’s motor-mouth comedy “His Girl Friday” in the other.
2017-12-24.headline_main: Review: The Big and Minor Stakes of ‘Molly’s Game’

2017-12-24.abstract: Paul Thomas Anderson’s latest film is a luxuriant love story set in 1950s London.
2017-12-24.snippet: Paul Thomas Anderson’s latest film is a luxuriant love story set in 1950s London.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: Reynolds Woodcock, a couturier plying his trade in London in the 1950s, has a habit of sewing secret messages into his garments. (“Never cursed” is the blessing stitched in lavender thread that he slips into the hem of a wedding gown commissioned by a princess.) These invisible traces of his hand — hidden meanings in the literal sense — signify that his dresses are more than luxurious commodities. They are works of art, obscurely and yet unmistakably saturated with the passion and personality of their creator.
2017-12-24.headline_main: Review: Daniel Day-Lewis Sews Up Another Great Performance in ‘Phantom Thread’

2017-12-24.abstract: As motorists turn onto residential streets, towns are fighting back by creating turn restrictions, speed humps and even closing roads to outsiders.
2017-12-24.snippet: As motorists turn onto residential streets, towns are fighting back by creating turn restrictions, speed humps and even closing roads to outsiders.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: LEONIA, N.J. — It is bumper to bumper as far as the eye can see, the kind of soul-sucking traffic jam that afflicts highways the way bad food afflicts rest stops.
2017-12-24.headline_main: Navigation Apps Are Turning Quiet Neighborhoods Into Traffic Nightmares

2017-12-24.abstract: The demolition of schools for migrant children has driven 15,000 students out of their classrooms, depriving many of a chance at an education.
2017-12-24.snippet: The demolition of schools for migrant children has driven 15,000 students out of their classrooms, depriving many of a chance at an education.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — Ding Fei, a truck driver from rural China, was thrilled to find a school in a crowded migrant neighborhood where his 7-year-old daughter might flourish. Finally, he thought, she could learn to read and write, and maybe even have a shot at becoming a doctor or nurse, as her mother hoped.
2017-12-24.headline_main: One Target in Beijing’s Migrant Crackdown: Schoolchildren

2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: DUBLIN — People love a good story at this time of year, and preferably one with a twist. This past week, Ireland was stirred by the story of two men in Dublin who, three days before Christmas, married for tax reasons.

2017-12-24.abstract: Mr. Plummer, who replaced Kevin Spacey in the role of J. Paul Getty, is magnetic in the film, which recounts the 1973 kidnapping of his grandson.
2017-12-24.snippet: Mr. Plummer, who replaced Kevin Spacey in the role of J. Paul Getty, is magnetic in the film, which recounts the 1973 kidnapping of his grandson.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: “The quality of mercy is not strained,” Portia tells Shylock in “The Merchant of Venice.” It is “twice blest; it blesseth him that gives and him that takes.” The billionaire J. Paul Getty would probably have disagreed with Shakespeare’s take. A hoarder of women, art, antiquities — and most of all, money — Getty also might have taken issue with Portia’s claim that mercy “becomes the throned monarch better than his crown.” Portia delivers her mercy speech as she tries to persuade Shylock not to take a pound of flesh. She would have had an even tougher time with Getty.
2017-12-24.headline_main: Review: Christopher Plummer Dominates ‘All the Money in the World’

2017-12-24.abstract: The 115th Congress, under Republican control, has left a conservative imprint on the courts, taxation, regulation and the environment. Next up: poverty programs.
2017-12-24.snippet: The 115th Congress, under Republican control, has left a conservative imprint on the courts, taxation, regulation and the environment. Next up: poverty programs.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After a halting start, the Republican-controlled 115th Congress — sometimes in collaboration with President Trump, often despite him — has enacted surprisingly far-reaching conservative achievements in its first year, among them a long-promised rewrite of the tax code, oil drilling in the Arctic and a series of lifetime appointments to the judiciary.

2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — I imagine there are a lot of elves behind the crossword scene, busily tweaking patterns, perfecting little jokes and meticulously organizing the schedule of themes pinned to the days of the week, important (and sometimes obscure) anniversaries and holidays. Christmas must make one of them punchy, I guess.
2017-12-24.headline_main: Game of Pursuit

2017-12-24.abstract: The Packers said the league had approved the move, but according to an ESPN report, other teams contended that the Packers had committed a violation that should force them to release Rodgers.
2017-12-24.snippet: The Packers said the league had approved the move, but according to an ESPN report, other teams contended that the Packers had committed a violation that should force them to release Rodgers.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: The Green Bay Packers put themselves in an awkward position when they returned quarterback Aaron Rodgers to injured reserve after they had been eliminated from playoff contention last week. That move theoretically could have resulted in the team’s being forced to release Rodgers, a two-time winner of the N.F.L.’s Most Valuable Player Award.
2017-12-24.headline_main: Aaron Rodgers’s Return to Injured Reserve May Have Violated League Rules

2017-12-24.abstract: A movie offers a reminder that leaking to the press can be a patriotic act at a time when the president delights in attacking journalists.
2017-12-24.snippet: A movie offers a reminder that leaking to the press can be a patriotic act at a time when the president delights in attacking journalists.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: After a year of high- and low-level attacks on the press and the First Amendment, there’s plenty to appreciate in Steven Spielberg’s new movie, “The Post,” which some people around here believe should be called “The Times.”

2017-12-24.snippet: The gift-wrapped package was addressed to Mr. Mnuchin, the Treasury secretary, and left at his neighbor’s home in an upscale part of Los Angeles.

2017-12-24.abstract: I hope for the day when feeding the hungry, caring for the sick and welcoming refugees aren’t political issues at all.
2017-12-24.snippet: I hope for the day when feeding the hungry, caring for the sick and welcoming refugees aren’t political issues at all.
2017-12-24.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — At least since Martin Luther nailed his theses to the church door in 1517, Christians have disagreed on what Jesus calls them to do in the name of faith. There are nearly 34,000 Christian denominations worldwide, a number that doesn’t account for American Christians — nearly one in six, according to a Gallup poll last summer — who belong to no denomination at all.
2017-12-24.headline_main: Christians Need a New Right-to-Life Movement

2017-12-25.snippet: Twelve illustrators sum up their year in the form of an ornament.

2017-12-25.abstract: Three American sisters born in Cameroon can articulate the American ethos better than our president.
2017-12-25.snippet: Three American sisters born in Cameroon can articulate the American ethos better than our president.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: Ten years ago, a family arrived in the Bronx from Yaoundé, Cameroon, not speaking a word of English. This Christmas, they are celebrating a feat that would be impressive for any family: Three of the family’s five daughters have been accepted to Ivy League universities.
2017-12-25.headline_main: As Trump Rages About Immigrants, They Go to the Ivy League

2017-12-25.abstract: How we should talk about numbers.
2017-12-25.snippet: How we should talk about numbers.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: The Israeli intelligence service asked the great psychologist Daniel Kahneman for help in the 1970s, and Kahneman came back with a suggestion: Get rid of the classic intelligence report. It allows leaders to justify any conclusion they want, Kahneman said. In its place, he suggested giving the leaders estimated probabilities of events.
2017-12-25.headline_main: What I Was Wrong About This Year

2017-12-25.abstract: ... including the house where Virginia wrote the letter that inspired what is ranked as America’s most “unforgettable” editorial.
2017-12-25.snippet: ... including the house where Virginia wrote the letter that inspired what is ranked as America’s most “unforgettable” editorial.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: Santa Claus has a home in New York, in a colonnaded building across from Pennsylvania Station that is the city’s main post office. It must be his home, because that’s where letters addressed to him wind up. The letters come from all over, tens of thousands of them each year, sent by the needy and the hopeful, the luckless and the guileless. Every Christmas season, kindhearted New Yorkers enlist as surrogate Santas. They go to the post office and sift through the mail in search of people to help.
2017-12-25.headline_main: Santa’s Manhattan Homes

2017-12-25.abstract: The Chiefs and Rams won on Sunday to clinch division titles. The Rams will make their first playoff appearance since 2004.
2017-12-25.snippet: The Chiefs and Rams won on Sunday to clinch division titles. The Rams will make their first playoff appearance since 2004.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: There was a lot of potential for playoff chaos coming into this week, but for the most part, the teams that have been contenders all season took care of business. The Chiefs and Rams secured division titles on Sunday, the Saints moved closer to clinching one of their own, and Cleveland moved closer to finishing the season winless and joining the 2008 Detroit Lions at 0-16. Here’s what we learned:
2017-12-25.headline_main: N.F.L. Roundup: Steady Contenders Come Out on Top

2017-12-25.abstract: The deadly Amtrak train accident is, at bottom, yet another case of failing public policy and industry indifference.
2017-12-25.snippet: The deadly Amtrak train accident is, at bottom, yet another case of failing public policy and industry indifference.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: The Amtrak derailment near Tacoma, Wash., that killed three people last week may well have been partly the individual failure of an engineer who was going much too fast. It was also, however, yet another demonstration of this country’s collective, continuing failure to invest in infrastructure.
2017-12-25.headline_main: The Amtrak Derailment Was Caused by a Collective Failure

2017-12-25.abstract: Mr. Fujimori, who was president from 1990 to 2000, was serving a 25-year term for human rights abuses.
2017-12-25.snippet: Mr. Fujimori, who was president from 1990 to 2000, was serving a 25-year term for human rights abuses.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: LIMA, Peru — Alberto Fujimori, who as Peru’s leader in the 1990s revived the economy and crushed two violent leftist insurgencies, but was forced out in a corruption scandal and later imprisoned for human rights abuses, received a medical pardon on Sunday night, a decision that prompted an outcry across the Andean nation.
2017-12-25.headline_main: Peru’s President Pardons Alberto Fujimori, Enraging Critics

2017-12-25.abstract: The nation is the first to follow President Trump in deciding to change the site of its embassy from Tel Aviv.

2017-12-25.abstract: A film about an abduction case was banned by Pakistan’s censors, but a public outcry, fueled by a social media campaign, helped overturn the ruling.

2017-12-25.headline_main: Pakistani Women Seize Film Dispute as Chance to Discuss Rape and Injustice

2017-12-25.headline_main: Duterte’s Son Quits Post After Battling Daughter on Social Media

2017-12-25.abstract: If you missed the preholiday rush, fret not. There is still time for festive theater.
2017-12-25.snippet: If you missed the preholiday rush, fret not. There is still time for festive theater.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: If you were racing too fast in the preholiday rush to catch a show this festive season, fear not: There’s still time to bundle yourself to the theater and get that dose of cheer. Radio City Music Hall’s “Christmas Spectacular” continues through Jan. 1; here are six other possibilities and what The New York Times had to say about them, sometimes in previous years.
2017-12-25.headline_main: 6 More Shows to See if You Still Need Holiday Spirit

2017-12-25.abstract: All our critic wanted was to stop judging and share the “Christmas Spectacular” with her daughter. But her preschool companion had other ideas.
2017-12-25.snippet: All our critic wanted was to stop judging and share the “Christmas Spectacular” with her daughter. But her preschool companion had other ideas.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: The tap number set to the “The Twelve Days of Christmas” had just hit six geese a-laying when Ada, my 4-year-old, asked if we could leave. She’d slunk so far down in her seat that she was practically on the floor and she slunk further when I whispered that we were staying. Then the pear tree burst into flames again.
2017-12-25.headline_main: Big Critic, Little Critic? Me, My Daughter and the Rockettes

2017-12-25.abstract: The wall we have built between religion and reason is more porous than it seems.
2017-12-25.snippet: The wall we have built between religion and reason is more porous than it seems.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: Why is it that, according to Jesus, faith is better than proof? That’s a question I’ve struggled to answer ever since I began my pilgrimage of faith as a young man. Sometimes it seemed more pressing, other times less so. It can intensify during periods of grief and pain, when faith may not offer much consolation or even make much sense in a world that seems random and cruel.
2017-12-25.headline_main: How Can I Possibly Believe That Faith Is Better Than Doubt?

2017-12-25.abstract: After dropping out of rabbinical seminary, I was directionless. I spent a lot of time on the internet.
2017-12-25.snippet: After dropping out of rabbinical seminary, I was directionless. I spent a lot of time on the internet.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: I met him online. He texted me on Christmas. Two weeks later, we met in person at a Barnes & Noble.
2017-12-25.headline_main: The Reddit Connection That Got Me Into College

2017-12-25.abstract: My friend and teacher Hubert Dreyfus, who died this year, left me a message about life’s purpose I am still learning from.
2017-12-25.snippet: My friend and teacher Hubert Dreyfus, who died this year, left me a message about life’s purpose I am still learning from.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: A few weeks ago, I found a surprising line in my lecture notes. I don’t know how long it had been there or how it got in. I don’t remember having written it or even having seen it before. It said, “The goal of life, for Pascal, is not happiness, peace, or fulfillment, but aliveness.” I believe the line may have been written by my teacher and friend, the philosopher Hubert Dreyfus. Bert died in April at the age of 87.
2017-12-25.headline_main: Waking Up to the Gift of ‘Aliveness’

2017-12-25.abstract: In many cases, the development of a second cancer resulted from the same risk factors that likely precipitated the first malignancy.
2017-12-25.snippet: In many cases, the development of a second cancer resulted from the same risk factors that likely precipitated the first malignancy.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: Cancer can, and sometimes does, strike twice. It famously happened to Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg of the Supreme Court, who was successfully treated for colon cancer in 1999 and then for pancreatic cancer in 2011. If not for the regular checkups she underwent after colon cancer, it is quite likely that her pancreatic cancer, which is rarely found early, would not have been detected while still curable.
2017-12-25.headline_main: When Cancer Strikes Twice

2017-12-25.abstract: We followed up with subjects whose stories stuck with us this year.
2017-12-25.snippet: We followed up with subjects whose stories stuck with us this year.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: It was a newsy year across the country, filled with hurricanes, shootings, wildfires, marches and more. National correspondents for The New York Times wrote about these events as well as other stories about families and communities grappling with opioid addiction, the federal government’s crackdown on illegal immigration, and on teenagers celebrating prom night.
2017-12-25.headline_main: A Grieving Farmer, a Torn Couple, a Prom King: Meet the People Who Stuck With Us in 2017

2017-12-25.abstract: Jeepneys are the most popular mode of transportation in the Philippines. But a new government policy could spell the end of the country’s iconic auto.
2017-12-25.snippet: Jeepneys are the most popular mode of transportation in the Philippines. But a new government policy could spell the end of the country’s iconic auto.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: MANILA — In Alvin Ocampo’s 18-year-old jeepney, the dashboard is held together with yards of peeling electrical tape. The only concession to Manila’s stifling heat is a fan screwed to the ceiling. And unless you count the padlocked metal grate in place of the driver’s-side door that Mr. Ocampo installed after a gang of glue-sniffing teenagers robbed him of a fistful of pesos, the vehicle has no safety features to speak of.
2017-12-25.headline_main: Duterte Threatens to Dethrone the Jeepney as King of Filipino Roads

2017-12-25.abstract: Mr. Fairchild is playing Frankenstein’s monster — and making choreography that reveals the monster’s inner life.
2017-12-25.snippet: Mr. Fairchild is playing Frankenstein’s monster — and making choreography that reveals the monster’s inner life.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: Not too long ago, Robert Fairchild played a young god — Apollo — at New York City Ballet. Now, just two months after retiring from the company to try his luck in musical theater, he finds himself contorting his body to become one of the world’s most famous monsters.
2017-12-25.headline_main: Robert Fairchild: From God to Monster (and Choreographer)

2017-12-25.abstract: Here were a few of our favorite things.
2017-12-25.snippet: Here were a few of our favorite things.
2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: Each week, a group of staffers from across The New York Times (some of us are in the photo above) gets together to discuss race. We learn from one another during these meetings, and learn more from you, our readers, after publishing the newsletter. Thank you for reading, contributing and subscribing.

2017-12-25.lead_paragraph: In the months leading to the November election, the Working Families Party spent thousands of dollars aiding left-leaning Democratic candidates in dozens of races across the state, often with relatively small amounts in contests for obscure offices. There was the $663 spent on a race for trustee in the Westchester County village of Croton-on-Hudson, or the $1,549 for a candidate running for Monroe County legislator.

2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — On his first day of kindergarten, my son came home and told me that his classmates should be punished because all they did was run around and play instead of listen to the teacher. As he grew up, he played basketball at the Jewish Community Center, was a farmer in the musical “Oklahoma!” and celebrated his Bar Mitzvah at age 13. In the summer, he can be found at a grill, making hot dogs and hamburgers for kids in the neighborhood.
2017-12-26.headline_main: To the Chicago Police, Any Black Kid Is in a Gang

Junk food, the doctor warned, was especially dangerous to Indians, who are far more prone to diabetes than people from other parts of the world.

2017-12-26.abstract: At Perfumarie, you smell scents on tap. The catch? You aren’t allowed to know what they are.
2017-12-26.snippet: At Perfumarie, you smell scents on tap. The catch? You aren’t allowed to know what they are.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: Close your eyes. Imagine a perfume. It smells like honeyed amber and smoky tonka beans, topped with a squeeze of bergamot oil. Perhaps you detect a hint of chalky violets and the dry prairie winds of vetiver grass. Inhale again: Now you get a slice of mandarin orange, a burst of cardamom pods and a fresh cake of Irish Spring. The scent is spicy and a little feral but still bright and clean. It’s the sort of scent that makes you want to go out dancing.
2017-12-26.headline_main: What Perfume Are You Wearing? Now You Never Have to Tell

2017-12-26.abstract: New releases in speculative fiction include a viral dystopia, a fantasy kingdom ruled by magic, a lesbian pulp noir satire and a classic revisited.
2017-12-26.snippet: New releases in speculative fiction include a viral dystopia, a fantasy kingdom ruled by magic, a lesbian pulp noir satire and a classic revisited.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: For roughly the first quarter of Nora Roberts’s postapocalyptic saga YEAR ONE (St. Martin’s, $27.99), all the formulas for a good thriller are deployed to magnificent effect. Readers follow the MacLeod family as they enjoy a pleasant holiday in Scotland — in the process somehow awakening a mystical ancient doom. The epidemic that follows, eventually wiping out billions, is described with relentless brutality as governments collapse and things fall apart. In power and poignancy, this segment of “Year One” is a match for end-of-the-world classics like Stephen King’s “The Stand,” Nevil Shute’s “On the Beach” and the better zombie apocalypses.
2017-12-26.headline_main: From ‘Frankenstein’ to Nora Roberts in 200 Years

2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: I spent 1967 flying air shows with the Thunderbirds, the Air Force aerobatic team, and worrying the war in Vietnam would be over before I got there. 2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: “If someone had told me all of the things that would happen to me after leaving university just two years ago, I never would have believed them,” Edda Gimnes told T in September. The 25-year-old Norwegian designer is bubbly and enthusiastic — much like her clothes, which resemble large, spontaneous doodles and employ vivid spurts of color and pattern. “My aim is to combine art and fashion in an unexpected way,” she explained. And her design process reflects this sentiment: Many of her pieces begin as small, naïve illustrations (drawn with her nondominant hand), which she enlarges, prints onto cotton canvases and whips up into garments or accessories.

2017-12-26.snippet: A new ramen bar at Brushstroke, Shanghai soup dumplings in Midtown Manhattan, and other restaurant news.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: JADE SIXTY A good portion of the menu at this new restaurant is pure New York steakhouse: nine cuts of beef, surf & turf, whole chicken and seafood platters. But the rest of the menu looks to Asia for inspiration, offering soup dumplings, chicken won tons, rock shrimp tempura, chicken yakitori, crispy spring rolls and a deep list of sushi specialties. The restaurateur Stratis Morfogen, who has partnered with the former owner of Rothmann’s, Franco Moscato, for this venture, said this restaurant is not a typical Asian steakhouse, like the Korean and Japanese places around town. “There’s nothing Asian about the steaks,” he said. “But everything else is Asian.” Skinny Mei, who was at Philippe and Jue Lan Club, and Albert Diaz, who was the head chef at Zuma in London and Miami, run the kitchen. The 175-seat restaurant, dramatically done in gray and black with plush red banquettes and clusters of globe lights, has a bar on the ground floor, a dining room a half-flight up and another dining room on the next level. It will serve lunch and dinner on opening day. (Opens Tuesday): 116 East 60th Street, 212-256-1929, jadesixty.com.
2017-12-26.headline_main: A New Steakhouse, Jade Sixty, Comes to the Upper East Side

2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: Every Christmas season, New York City Ballet dances “George Balanchine’s ‘The Nutcracker’” for six weeks, sometimes doing as many as 10 performances a week. The production is often regarded as a machine that runs itself. This year, that’s just as well, since Peter Martins, the company’s ballet master in chief, has been on leave of absence since early December. He’s also chairman of faculty at the School of American Ballet, which provides dozens of students for each “Nutcracker” performance. The allegations of his harassment, physical and sexual, have been widely reported. A team of four, all under 40, has been leading the company until matters are resolved.
2017-12-26.headline_main: Under City Ballet’s ‘Nutcracker’ Tree, Dancers Find New Roles

2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: “In the Fade,” the new film by Fatih Akin, is divided into three parts. The first two follow a pattern that will be familiar to “Law & Order” fans. A crime is investigated, and then a trial conducted, with a few twists and reversals on the way to the verdict. The emphasis, though, falls less on the procedural aspects of the case than its psychological effects, specifically on Katja Sekerci (Diane Kruger), a German woman whose husband and young son are killed in a bombing in Hamburg.
2017-12-26.headline_main: Review: ‘In the Fade’ Is a Tale of Grief and Violence in Modern Germany

2017-12-26.abstract: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around The Times are reading.
2017-12-26.snippet: A selection of books published this week; plus, a peek at what our colleagues around The Times are reading.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: THE GRAPHIC CANON OF CRIME AND MYSTERY, VOLUME 1 Edited by Russ Kick. (Seven Stories Press, $29.95.) From Poe to Kafka to Dostoyevsky, all the masters are here, in these short, graphic renderings of the darkest, most foreboding writing of all time. With different artists and illustrators taking on each tale, there are many revelations. TIME OF GRATITUDE By Gennady Aygi. (New Directions, $16.95.) This collection of poetry and verse-infused prose from the celebrated Russian and Chuvash poet bows to the writers and artists who kept him creatively inspired during the Soviet era. YOU & ME & WHY WE ARE IN LOVE By Aurelia Alcaïs. (Penguin, $15.) Love comes in many flavors and Alcaïs, a French actress and illustrator, tries to capture many of them in her basic but sweet portraits of variations like “inquiring love,” “qualified love” and “modern love.” THE THREE MUSKETEERS By Alexandre Dumas. (Pegasus Books, $26.95.) The classic French epic in a new translation by Lawrence Ellsworth brings freshness to the story of d’Artagnan and his pals. THE RUIN OF KASCH By Roberto Calasso. (Farrar, Straus & Giroux, $17.) Calasso’s nearly four-decade project, eclectic and erudite, to tell the intellectual history of the modern world began with this first book in the series, about the French Revolution and so much more, translated anew into English.
2017-12-26.headline_main: New & Noteworthy

2017-12-26.abstract: In a Connecticut city known for showdowns between homeowners and the government, a tiny yard overtaken by bamboo is at the center of a new fight.
2017-12-26.snippet: In a Connecticut city known for showdowns between homeowners and the government, a tiny yard overtaken by bamboo is at the center of a new fight.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: NEW LONDON, Conn. — The jungle rises at the end of the block, past a few narrow clapboard houses, where an old station wagon is parked on the road. What neighbors said was once a small patch of bamboo has swelled over the years into a thicket, reaching above the utility lines, pushing to the edge of the property and nearly swallowing a white house on Borodell Place, with only a sliver left poking out.
2017-12-26.headline_main: Patch of Bamboo Creates New Legal Thicket for Connecticut City

2017-12-26.abstract: In a presidential runoff, voters are choosing between a soccer star, George Weah, and Vice President Joseph Boakai, to replace Ellen Johnson Sirleaf.
2017-12-26.snippet: In a presidential runoff, voters are choosing between a soccer star, George Weah, and Vice President Joseph Boakai, to replace Ellen Johnson Sirleaf.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: MONROVIA, Liberia — Liberia has not witnessed a peaceful transition of power since 1944, and the fate of past presidents — since 1971, four of them have either died in office or been sent into exile — is so grim that many Liberians consider the presidential palace to be haunted.
2017-12-26.headline_main: Liberia Election Could Mark First Peaceful Transfer of Power Since 1944

2017-12-26.abstract: Want to feel old? Everyone — well, every man — died.
2017-12-26.snippet: Want to feel old? Everyone — well, every man — died.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: Andre Calilhanna, like countless kids before him, fell hard for rock ’n’ roll. It was the early 1980s in suburban Maryland and his parents were Middle-Eastern immigrants who enjoyed classical music and had barely heard of Elvis Presley. Seeing Styx live at the Capital Centre, or drumming in high school bands, Mr. Calilhanna felt part of a vital American culture.
2017-12-26.headline_main: The Avalanche of Rock ’n’ Roll Death

2017-12-26.abstract: The author of the On Comedy column shares his philosophy on printing punch lines, how he decides what to review and why he laughs less than he used to.
2017-12-26.snippet: The author of the On Comedy column shares his philosophy on printing punch lines, how he decides what to review and why he laughs less than he used to.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: Are punch lines spoilers? Since a film review isn’t supposed to reveal the end of a movie, should a comedy review avoid divulging the big twist in a joke? As the comedy critic for The New York Times, I regularly struggle with this question.
2017-12-26.headline_main: What’s So Funny? The Times’s Comedy Critic Explains

2017-12-26.snippet: Ms. Puccini went to court to get herself recognized as a granddaughter of Giacomo Puccini. She then worked to foster his legacy.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: Simonetta Puccini, who went to court to prove that she was a descendant of the composer Giacomo Puccini and, after she won that case, worked to further Puccini’s legacy, died on Dec. 16 in Milan. She was 89 by most accounts.

2017-12-26.abstract: Efforts by Republicans to chip away at the Affordable Care Act, culminating in the repeal of the individual mandate, have left behind a more government-focused health program.
2017-12-26.snippet: Efforts by Republicans to chip away at the Affordable Care Act, culminating in the repeal of the individual mandate, have left behind a more government-focused health program.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Affordable Care Act was conceived as a mix of publicly funded health care and privately purchased insurance, but Republican attacks, culminating this month in the death of a mandate that most Americans have insurance, are shifting the balance, giving the government a larger role than Democrats ever anticipated.

2017-12-26.snippet: An explorer of sound’s visceral and mystical dimensions, Z’ev was a performer, composer and theorist for whom “cacophonous” was a compliment.
2017-12-26.lead_paragraph: Z’ev, a percussionist, performer, composer, instrument builder, visual artist, poet and theorist who explored visceral and mystical dimensions of sound — becoming a pioneer of industrial music along the way — died on Dec. 16 in Chicago, where he lived. He was 66.
