2017-12-27.abstract: After my father killed himself, I volunteered to stop others from doing the same. Then I was shown the door over gun control.
2017-12-27.snippet: After my father killed himself, I volunteered to stop others from doing the same. Then I was shown the door over gun control.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: In August 2006, my father fatally shot himself with a gun he pilfered from a friend’s bedroom. I wanted to do something positive in my mourning, so I went on a suicide-prevention walk organized by a nonprofit organization called the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention in Santa Monica, Calif.
2017-12-27.headline_main: The Gun Lobby Is Hindering Suicide Prevention

2017-12-27.abstract: Mr. Rudd helped to establish a place for his instrument on the free-jazz scene of the 1960s. He later explored a broad array of other styles.
2017-12-27.snippet: Mr. Rudd helped to establish a place for his instrument on the free-jazz scene of the 1960s. He later explored a broad array of other styles.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: Roswell Rudd, who helped establish a place for the trombone in the jazz avant-garde, then disappeared from the national stage for almost 20 years before enjoying a late-career resurgence in which he explored a wide array of styles, died on Thursday at his home in Kerhonkson, N.Y., in the Catskills. He was 82.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Roswell Rudd, 82, Trombonist With a Wide-Open Approach, Is Dead

2017-12-27.abstract: A doubter at Vox Media, where one of the latest organizing efforts has begun, became a believer — no thanks to Twitter, he said.
2017-12-27.snippet: A doubter at Vox Media, where one of the latest organizing efforts has begun, became a believer — no thanks to Twitter, he said.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: After employees at the online media company Vox Media announced plans to form a union last month, German Lopez, a senior reporter at the company’s general news website Vox.com, posted a thread on Twitter that inspired a heated debate more than 1,000 comments in length.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Unions Are Gaining a Foothold at Digital Media Companies

2017-12-27.abstract: A lawyer with abiding roots in white supremacy has no place on the federal bench.
2017-12-27.snippet: A lawyer with abiding roots in white supremacy has no place on the federal bench.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: GOLDSBORO, N.C. — Among President Trump’s worrisome nominees to the judiciary, perhaps none is as alarming as Thomas Alvin Farr, a protégé of Jesse Helms, the former North Carolina senator, and a product of the modern white supremacist machine that Mr. Helms pioneered.
2017-12-27.headline_main: William Barber II: Trump’s Terrible Choice for Judge

2017-12-27.abstract: Kane passed the mark for most Premier League goals in a calendar year with his 37th goal, and also ensured having the most international and club goals combined in 2017.
2017-12-27.snippet: Kane passed the mark for most Premier League goals in a calendar year with his 37th goal, and also ensured having the most international and club goals combined in 2017.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: Tottenham Hotspur striker Harry Kane set two scoring records and José Mourinho tried a little financial misdirection in his postgame remarks on Tuesday as English soccer’s traditional Boxing Day schedule overflowed with both goals and gripes.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Harry Kane Breaks 2 Records With 3 Goals in Tottenham’s Win

2017-12-27.abstract: The resignation of Christopher Cerf, the state-appointed superintendent, was welcomed by the mayor as the city prepares to take back control of its schools.
2017-12-27.snippet: The resignation of Christopher Cerf, the state-appointed superintendent, was welcomed by the mayor as the city prepares to take back control of its schools.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: The Newark public schools superintendent, Christopher D. Cerf, has submitted his resignation months ahead of schedule, the latest move in a series of steps designed to return New Jersey’s largest school district to local control more than two decades after the state seized oversight.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Newark Schools Chief Resigns Early to Ease Transition to Local Control

2017-12-27.abstract: Of home, belonging, hope and the Staten Island ferry.
2017-12-27.snippet: Of home, belonging, hope and the Staten Island ferry.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: From my window in Brooklyn Heights, I’ve watched the Staten Island ferry come and go for more than two years now, a big orange boat crisscrossing the water. That’s when I’m home, which is not much.
2017-12-27.headline_main: The Year Not to Defer Dreams

2017-12-27.abstract: First Aleksei A. Navalny, an anticorruption activist, was blocked from running for president. Then he was warned not to organize a boycott of the election.
2017-12-27.snippet: First Aleksei A. Navalny, an anticorruption activist, was blocked from running for president. Then he was warned not to organize a boycott of the election.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW — Aleksei A. Navalny, a Russian anticorruption activist, would have no real chance of defeating President Vladimir V. Putin in an election. The authorities have cast him as an utterly irrelevant showboat.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Putin May Be Re-Election Shoo-in, but He’s Taking No Chances

2017-12-27.abstract: The Virginia State Board of Elections announced it would delay a drawing of lots after receiving a letter from lawyers for the Democratic candidate.
2017-12-27.snippet: The Virginia State Board of Elections announced it would delay a drawing of lots after receiving a letter from lawyers for the Democratic candidate.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: RICHMOND — A race that would tip control of Virginia’s House of Delegates, whose constant and nearly comic pendulums between candidates has attracted national attention, took one more twist on Tuesday when a drawing to break a tie was unexpectedly postponed.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Tied Virginia Race That Was Headed for Name-Drawing Gets Another Twist

2017-12-27.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, December 27, 2017.
2017-12-27.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Wednesday, December 27, 2017.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: “Amadeo García, he wants Taushiro to come back. He wants it, he dreams of it, he longs for it, and he suffers to know that he’s the last speaker.”
2017-12-27.headline_main: Quotation of the Day: Thousands Once Spoke His Language. Now He Bears the Burden of Its Survival.

2017-12-27.abstract: The charges against a computer expert employed by Alberto Nisman, who was found dead in 2015, are the first time a judge has called the case a homicide.
2017-12-27.snippet: The charges against a computer expert employed by Alberto Nisman, who was found dead in 2015, are the first time a judge has called the case a homicide.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES — A federal judge in Argentina on Tuesday indicted a computer expert on charges that he acted as an accomplice in the January 2015 death of the prosecutor Alberto Nisman. It is the first time a judge has formally called the politically fraught case, which remains unsolved, a homicide.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Aide Accused of Playing Role in Death of Argentine Prosecutor

2017-12-27.abstract: Bower was 45 when he played his last game in the National Hockey League. He won four Stanley Cups with the Toronto Maple Leafs in a Hall of Fame career.
2017-12-27.snippet: Bower was 45 when he played his last game in the National Hockey League. He won four Stanley Cups with the Toronto Maple Leafs in a Hall of Fame career.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: Johnny Bower, the Hall of Fame goaltender who helped take the Toronto Maple Leafs to four Stanley Cup championships in the 1960s and became the oldest full-time goalie in National Hockey League history, playing until he was 45, died on Tuesday at a hospital near his home in Mississauga, Ontario, outside Toronto. He was 93.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Johnny Bower, Oldest Full-Time N.H.L. Goalie, Dies at 93

2017-12-27.abstract: David Kwong splits.
2017-12-27.snippet: David Kwong splits.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE — David Kwong, who is also a magician, is among a group of constructors whose alchemical specialty is combining the entries and the architecture of a grid to make their puzzles multidimensional gold. To solve these creations, you have to be flexible and open-minded; this is not for the type of brain that likes a lot of direction. But the more facets a puzzle has, the more opportunities there are for the satisfaction of figuring out a tricky concept, not just an obscure word.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Really Move

2017-12-27.abstract: The former Arkansas governor’s tweets after seeing “Darkest Hour,” a film about Winston Churchill, stirred up Twitter.
2017-12-27.snippet: The former Arkansas governor’s tweets after seeing “Darkest Hour,” a film about Winston Churchill, stirred up Twitter.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: Former Gov. Mike Huckabee of Arkansas drew a swift and intense response with a provocative claim on Tuesday: President Trump, he wrote, is similar to Winston Churchill, one of history’s most iconic leaders.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Mike Huckabee Says Trump Is Like Churchill. Historians Disagree.

2017-12-27.abstract: Residents have had to abandon their cars in the middle of the road after getting stuck. The snow, which shattered several records, is still coming down.
2017-12-27.snippet: Residents have had to abandon their cars in the middle of the road after getting stuck. The snow, which shattered several records, is still coming down.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: A holiday storm has blanketed the lakefront city of Erie, Pa., in more than five feet of snow this week, burying streets and driveways in mountains of powder and ice, forcing residents to abandon their incapacitated cars and shattering several snowfall records.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Erie, Pa., Buried in Five Feet of Snow After Record-Breaking Storm

2017-12-27.abstract: Swimming in this sun-baked desert oasis is to tour midcentury modernism as seen through its famously fabulous pools. An astonishing 40,000 pools are within the city limits.
2017-12-27.snippet: Swimming in this sun-baked desert oasis is to tour midcentury modernism as seen through its famously fabulous pools. An astonishing 40,000 pools are within the city limits.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: When you fly into Palm Springs, the geometry of pool-centric living is clearly laid out below, in the repeating grid of aquamarine rectangles, ovals and odd little squiggles. What is it about the swimming pool that grabs us by the hand and pulls us in? Nowhere is it more entwined with the history and culture of a place than the bright, sun-baked desert oasis of Palm Springs.
2017-12-27.headline_main: In Palm Springs, to Pool Hop Is to Time Travel

2017-12-27.abstract: South Korea examined the health of North Korean defectors amid fears that nuclear tests may have released radioactive fallout.

2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: SEOUL, South Korea — Four defectors from the area near North Korea’s nuclear testing site showed symptoms that could be attributed to radiation exposure, but scientists said they could not conclude that the health problems had been caused by a nuclear test, the South Korean government said on Wednesday.

2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: Thanks to its famous coastline and peninsular setting, tourists in Cape Town expect that they will be surrounded by water — and lots of it. But as visitors have descended this month for the peak summer tourist season, they have been greeted at the airport with signs beseeching them to “Slow the flow: Save H2O” and “Don’t waste a drop!” among others.

2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: It’s hard to be out with Anderson Cooper and Andy Cohen. Neither blends in. They are hugely recognizable, both appearing on television five nights a week, and when they’re spotted together, people stop in their tracks. Throughout a recent lunch at Cafe Cluny, they were approached by fans of “Watch What Happens Live With Andy Cohen,” his talk show on Bravo; the actress Julianne Moore; and a woman thanking Mr. Cooper for a hurricane relief segment on “Anderson Cooper 360,” his CNN show.
2017-12-27.headline_main: That Time Andy Cohen Asked Anderson Cooper Out (and About His Mom)

2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: The International Olympic Committee may have suspended Russia’s team from the 2018 Winter Games in Pyeongchang, South Korea, over a system of doping. But the ruling — which allows Russian athletes to compete under a “neutral flag” — is a joke, a non-punitive punishment meant to save face while protecting the I.O.C.’s and Russia’s commercial and political interests.

2017-12-27.abstract: The simple style, swept up and worn at the back of the head, offers an unexpected allure.
2017-12-27.snippet: The simple style, swept up and worn at the back of the head, offers an unexpected allure.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: In the admittedly small taxonomy of buns, the topknot, or the high bun, is the bun that tends to hog the spotlight. “Look at my hair!” it screams, perched like a papal crown. It’s the universal symbol of ballerinas; of young starlets parading their sex appeal; of flight attendants going for a vaguely retro look (an attempt, perhaps, to evoke a time when air travel was glamorous); of a certain brand of self-consciously sensitive bro.
2017-12-27.headline_main: The Enduring Power of a Low Bun

2017-12-27.snippet: McAnn’s, the last in a chain of New York pubs, occupies a special place on the second floor of Port Authority, right next to the bathroom.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: On the second floor of the Port Authority Bus Terminal is a lone Irish bar called McAnn’s. It has no bathroom and its regulars drink in the absence of sunlight. It has existed behind a blur of miserable commuters for 20 years, and it is the last location of a forgotten chain of New York bars founded in 1945.

2017-12-27.headline_main: 10 Ways to Love Better

2017-12-27.abstract: As streaming continues to remake the music industry, artists and record labels schemed and scrambled, remixed and bundled to get their songs into fans’ ears.
2017-12-27.snippet: As streaming continues to remake the music industry, artists and record labels schemed and scrambled, remixed and bundled to get their songs into fans’ ears.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: This year, 12 songs reached the top of the Billboard singles chart, known as the Hot 100, from Ed Sheeran’s meticulously constructed “Shape of You” to Cardi B’s casual “Bodak Yellow (Money Moves).” Including feature appearances, 14 acts had their first No. 1s, like the electronic dance veterans Daft Punk (as guests on the Weeknd’s “Starboy”) and the Philadelphia firecracker Lil Uzi Vert, whose verse on “Bad and Boujee” by Migos begins with “Yah!” yelped five straight times. The track with the longest run atop the heap — “Despacito,” by Luis Fonsi and Daddy Yankee, featuring Justin Bieber — was sung almost entirely in Spanish.
2017-12-27.headline_main: The Pop Charts Were Crazy This Year. Here’s Why.

2017-12-27.abstract: Whether a horticultural necessity or an off-season display of wealth, the now-ubiquitous custom of burlapping has had the unexpected effect of transforming the Hamptons into an enormous art park.
2017-12-27.snippet: Whether a horticultural necessity or an off-season display of wealth, the now-ubiquitous custom of burlapping has had the unexpected effect of transforming the Hamptons into an enormous art park.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: SAGAPONACK, N.Y. — There’s a cozy covering the Hamptons. Where once winter here meant broad, moody skies over expanses of bare potato fields, the terrain on Long Island’s moneyed East End suddenly looks as domesticated as tea at the Ritz. Drive anywhere in Southampton, East Hampton, Sagaponack and Water Mill and you find lanes filled with oddly humped shapes of trees, shrubs and hedges bundled in burlap against the cold.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Make Mine the Burlap Wrap

2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: New York City’s subway system unspools across 665 miles of track, spread over and under the city — threads that reach almost to the Atlantic Ocean in Queens and Brooklyn, and clump together beneath Manhattan. With nearly six million rides each day, it is the largest transportation network in the United States and one of the biggest in the world.

2017-12-27.abstract: In the wake of Trump’s victory, I built a bot to expose bigots. Then Twitter suspended it — and kept the bigots.
2017-12-27.snippet: In the wake of Trump’s victory, I built a bot to expose bigots. Then Twitter suspended it — and kept the bigots.
2017-12-27.lead_paragraph: Like many Jewish journalists who reported on Donald Trump’s presidential campaign, I spent the 2016 election being harassed by a motley crew of internet racists who coalesced around the future president. They sent me threats, photoshopped me into gas chambers and hurled an uncreative array of anti-Semitic slurs my way. A study by the Anti-Defamation League found that I’d received the second-most abuse of any Jewish journalist on Twitter during the campaign cycle. My parents didn’t raise me to be No. 2; fortunately, there’s always 2020.
2017-12-27.headline_main: Confessions of a Digital Nazi Hunter

Recently, however, a good many of us have decided to say, “The heck with it,” resolving to accomplish (or not accomplish) feats that run delightfully counter to conventional self-improvement wisdom.

2017-12-28.abstract: As a child, I didn’t understand the extent to which clan ideology distorted many people’s thinking.
2017-12-28.snippet: As a child, I didn’t understand the extent to which clan ideology distorted many people’s thinking.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: MINNEAPOLIS — On a sunny day in 1991, Maryan, my dad’s first cousin, was hiding from rifle-carrying soldiers in a house in Mogadishu, Somalia, while the melodic voice of the singer Magool blared from a megaphone outside. Magool repeated an ugly slur for the Darod, our family’s clan, while a sweaty Maryan crouched inside the kitchen, holding her breath.
2017-12-28.headline_main: A Deadly Year in My Family’s Homeland

2017-12-28.abstract: Frigid temperatures have settled in from Boston to Bismarck, N.D.
2017-12-28.snippet: Frigid temperatures have settled in from Boston to Bismarck, N.D.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO — Winter snowstorms and subzero temperatures are a teeth-chattering part of life in the Midwest and Northeast. But familiarity has offered little insulation this week as records fell, water pipes froze and snow piled up in a large swath of the United States.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Record-Breaking Winter Weather Grips Northern U.S.

2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A federal appeals court on Wednesday ordered the Environmental Protection Agency to revise its nearly 17-year-old standard for dangerous levels of lead in paint and dust within one year, a rare legal move that amounts to a sharp rebuff of President Trump and Scott Pruitt, the E.P.A. administrator.
2017-12-28.headline_main: E.P.A. Wanted Years to Study Lead Paint Rule. It Got 90 Days.

2017-12-28.headline_main: Prepaying Your Property Tax? I.R.S. Cautions It Might Not Pay Off

2017-12-28.abstract: Stop-and-frisk has been drastically reduced, but officers still need to be more accountable.
2017-12-28.snippet: Stop-and-frisk has been drastically reduced, but officers still need to be more accountable.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: New York City’s police commissioner, James O’Neill, showed admirable candor in a recent training video when he admitted that the department had “overused and sometimes misused” its stop-and-frisk program in past years — particularly in minority neighborhoods. He has also embraced the reforms ordered by a federal judge who ruled five years ago that the program had violated constitutional guarantees against unreasonable search and seizure and discriminated against black and Latino citizens, who were disproportionately targeted for unjustified stops.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Reforms Rein In Police Harassment; Now More Is Needed

2017-12-28.abstract: Yemenis are dying as Saudi Arabia, with American help, and Iran fight a proxy war.
2017-12-28.snippet: Yemenis are dying as Saudi Arabia, with American help, and Iran fight a proxy war.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: The Trump administration has long applied a double standard to the violence in Yemen, the world’s worst humanitarian crisis. It fiercely condemns Iran for supporting the indigenous Houthi insurgents and allegedly supplying them with short-range ballistic missiles and other weapons. At the same time, it has nothing bad to say about (and is indeed enabling) Saudi Arabia’s savage bombing in support of Yemen’s government — an air campaign that is worsening a civilian death toll among a population already suffering from a famine and cholera.
2017-12-28.headline_main: The Yemen Crucible

2017-12-28.abstract: They served together, and were wounded together twice.
2017-12-28.snippet: They served together, and were wounded together twice.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: Fifty years ago this month, I landed at Tan Son Nhut Airport near Saigon in the Republic of Vietnam. I recall the bus ride taking us from Travis Air Force Base in California to board the plane. The bus was full of young innocent Army privates, having no idea what awaited us in this faraway Southeast Asian land. At 21, I was one of the oldest on the bus of 19-year-olds. One memory of that trip that has never faded was the large boombox radios that many of the troops carried with them. The songs that blared out from those music boxes during my tour included Otis Redding’s “Dock of the Bay” and Aretha Franklin’s “Respect.” I would hear those songs and others for the next 12 months in Vietnam. Music was a defining part of our Vietnam experience. Music was our lifeline.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Chuck Hagel: Serving in Vietnam — With My Brother

2017-12-28.abstract: Ferguson’s debtors’ prisons devastated its black community. The attorney general wants to keep it that way.
2017-12-28.snippet: Ferguson’s debtors’ prisons devastated its black community. The attorney general wants to keep it that way.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: Last week, Attorney General Jeff Sessions retracted an Obama-era guidance to state courts that was meant to end debtors’ prisons, where people who are too poor to pay fines are sent. This practice is blatantly unconstitutional, and the guidance had helped jump-start reform around the country. Its withdrawal is the latest sign that the federal government is retreating from protecting civil rights for the most vulnerable among us.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Sessions Says to Courts: Go Ahead, Jail People Because They’re Poor

2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: Starting in the mid-1960s, Michelangelo Antonioni became what the German essayist Hans Magnus Enzensberger would call a “tourist of the revolution.” Antonioni left Italy to make “Blow-Up” (1966) in swinging London, “Zabriskie Point” (1970) in radical California and, most controversially, a three-and-a-half-hour TV documentary in the People’s Republic of China.

2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: Last week, our son came home from his first semester at college and announced that he would not be returning in mid-January. So far, he’s been very uncommunicative about what the problem is. When his mother and I try to broach the subject, which we do frequently, he becomes aggravated or shuts down. But we’re shocked. He was excited to go to college, and when we spoke with him on the phone during the fall, he seemed happy. How do we handle this?

2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: Starting with its mouthful of a title, “Cosmic Communities: Coming Out Into Outer Space — Homofuturism, Applied Psychedelia & Magic Connectivity” at Galerie Buchholz is baldly ambitious. Organized at this Upper East Side space by the German critic Diedrich Diederichsen and Buchholz’s Christopher Müller, the exhibition offers a crash course in over a century of utopian communities that used art, sex and music as models for better living.

2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: The close of 2017 probably finds you with little residual outrage. You spent it all during a year that supplied daily — no, often quarter-hourly — occasions to look up from your cubicle and beg for mercy, deliverance, scream therapy or permanent-resident status in Iceland. New Yorkers directed whatever anger they had left for the decrepit state of the subway system. But there was plenty more to get riled up about. Here’s what you might have missed:
2017-12-28.headline_main: The Year of Living Angrily

2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: SÃO PAULO, Brazil — It was not the best year for many of us. My country, for example, seemed to walk proudly backward through 2017, and the coming year promises fewer rights and even more inequality. Brazil is regressing so quickly that I can almost see on the horizon a fleet of Portuguese caravels coming to colonize us all over again.
2017-12-28.headline_main: I Want to Be an Angry Mother

2017-12-28.abstract: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2017-12-28.snippet: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: This week’s list of recommendations includes several books about the world’s major faiths. This year is the 500th anniversary of the Reformation, and a new biography of Martin Luther attempts to make him attractive to a general audience. Simon Schama continues his panoramic “The Story of the Jews” with his second volume, “Belonging: 1492-1900.” Christopher de Hamel offers a view into the stunning world of illuminated manuscripts, Garry Wills studies the Quran and Tova Mirvis tells her story of leaving the community of Modern Orthodox Judaism. On the secular side of things, we suggest a haunting memoir about surviving sexual assault, a collection of stories by P. D. James and an absorbing history of coffee.
2017-12-28.headline_main: 10 New Books We Recommend This Week

The United Nations agency warned against normalizing the brutality, a sentiment it has echoed in reports year after year.
2017-12-28.headline_main: The Most Dangerous Places for Children in 2017

2017-12-28.abstract: Bramwell Tovey, who led the orchestra’s Summertime Classics series, returned for some favorites, as well as Bartok with the pianist Yefim Bronfman.
2017-12-28.snippet: Bramwell Tovey, who led the orchestra’s Summertime Classics series, returned for some favorites, as well as Bartok with the pianist Yefim Bronfman.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: Can you seriously question the reality of global warming when Bramwell Tovey conducts the New York Philharmonic in the dark of December? Mr. Tovey is best known in New York for having been the host and conductor of the Philharmonic’s defunct Summertime Classics series from 2004 to 2014. Those were relatively informal concerts calculated to beat the heat, offering standard and lightish fare, which this genial British maestro introduced with witty palaver — often charming, occasionally tedious.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Review: New York Philharmonic’s Summer Host Beats the Cold

2017-12-28.abstract: Mr. Harris helped Neil Bogart found Casablanca, which in the ’70s was known for its wildness and a roster that included Donna Summer and Kiss.
2017-12-28.snippet: Mr. Harris helped Neil Bogart found Casablanca, which in the ’70s was known for its wildness and a roster that included Donna Summer and Kiss.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: Larry Harris, who helped his second cousin Neil Bogart found Casablanca Records, a flamboyant company that brought Kiss, Donna Summer and other splashy acts to the mainstream spotlight in the 1970s, died on Dec. 18 in Port Angeles, Wash. He was 70.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Larry Harris, Promoter of a Risk-Taking Record Label, Dies at 70

2017-12-28.abstract: The New York City police plan a “stronger police presence” for this year’s ball drop to counter the threat of high-rise snipers and suicide bombers.
2017-12-28.snippet: The New York City police plan a “stronger police presence” for this year’s ball drop to counter the threat of high-rise snipers and suicide bombers.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: With a gunman raining bullets down on a crowd of Las Vegas concertgoers in October, police officers who rushed into the hotel where he was holed up struggled at first to figure out what floor he was on.
2017-12-28.headline_main: In Wake of Attacks, Tighter Security for Times Square on New Year’s Eve

2017-12-28.abstract: The deal is a notable drop from the $70 billion valuation Uber once commanded, and is a humbling coda on a rough year for the company, which has been rocked by a series of scandals.
2017-12-28.snippet: The deal is a notable drop from the $70 billion valuation Uber once commanded, and is a humbling coda on a rough year for the company, which has been rocked by a series of scandals.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — A group of Uber’s largest shareholders have agreed to sell a significant stake in the ride-hailing giant at a steep discount, according to two people familiar with the process who were not allowed to comment on it publicly.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Uber Sells Stake to SoftBank, Valuing Ride-Hailing Giant at $48 Billion

2017-12-28.abstract: He founded Tomche Shabbos out of his kitchen in Brooklyn to bring food to people in need. It now distributes meals to 600 families every week.
2017-12-28.snippet: He founded Tomche Shabbos out of his kitchen in Brooklyn to bring food to people in need. It now distributes meals to 600 families every week.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: Yehoshua Zvi Hershkowitz, who more than 40 years ago was so concerned that his indigent neighbors would go hungry for the Sabbath that he founded a kosher meals-on-wheels program, which has been imitated by Jewish communities around the world, died on Monday in Brooklyn. He was 92.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Yehoshua Hershkowitz, 92, Founder of a Kosher Meal Program, Dies

2017-12-28.abstract: The Museum of Modern Art proves that creativity is not just a young person’s game, stocking its fourth-floor galleries with works made by artists 45 and older.
2017-12-28.snippet: The Museum of Modern Art proves that creativity is not just a young person’s game, stocking its fourth-floor galleries with works made by artists 45 and older.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: What good is an art collection if a museum doesn’t shake it up once in a while? The Museum of Modern Art has increasingly been acting on this principle. Its latest upending is “The Long Run,” a yearlong installation that is utterly engaging if slightly mild: around 130 works of art spread throughout the galleries and hallways of its fourth floor. With a couple of exceptions, these works have been made since 1970 by, as the title implies, artists with careers of some length.
2017-12-28.headline_main: MoMA Upends Its Collection to Celebrate Late Careers

2017-12-28.abstract: Ramzan Kadyrov and Russian officials challenged Facebook’s decision to end his Instagram and Facebook accounts after the U.S. hit him with sanctions.
2017-12-28.snippet: Ramzan Kadyrov and Russian officials challenged Facebook’s decision to end his Instagram and Facebook accounts after the U.S. hit him with sanctions.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: The strongman leader of the Chechen Republic has long been a prolific social media user, filling his accounts with photos of him cuddling his cat, lifting weights or soliciting poems about President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Facebook Removes Chechen Strongman’s Accounts, Raising Policy Questions

2017-12-28.abstract: He and Richard Barnet provided research on war, draft resistance, economic inequality and civil rights and had a role in the Pentagon Papers episode.
2017-12-28.snippet: He and Richard Barnet provided research on war, draft resistance, economic inequality and civil rights and had a role in the Pentagon Papers episode.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: Marcus Raskin, who channeled his discontent as a young aide in the Kennedy administration into helping to found the Institute for Policy Studies, a progressive think tank that became an abundant source of research about nuclear disarmament, the Vietnam War, economic inequality, civil rights and national security, died on Dec. 24 in Washington. He was 83.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Marcus Raskin, Co-Founder of Liberal Think Tank, Dies at 83

2017-12-28.abstract: After a racecar was sold as a work of contemporary art, a December auction put automotive crossover appeal on display.
2017-12-28.snippet: After a racecar was sold as a work of contemporary art, a December auction put automotive crossover appeal on display.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: For one evening early this month, the gravity of Manhattan’s auto marketplace shifted crosstown, from the dealerships on the northern reaches of 11th Avenue to the Upper East Side. While many of the same brands were offered — BMW, Jaguar, Mercedes-Benz and Porsche among them — the selling prices realized on the 10th floor of Sotheby’s New York auction house were on another scale entirely.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Sotheby’s Tries Selling New York as a Car Auction Destination

2017-12-28.abstract: President Trump’s broadside aimed at Vanity Fair mastered a tricky title and made much of a 14-word statement.
2017-12-28.snippet: President Trump’s broadside aimed at Vanity Fair mastered a tricky title and made much of a 14-word statement.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: President Trump, vacationing in Palm Beach, Fla., was relatively subdued on Twitter this week — at least until Thursday, when he launched a somewhat arcane broadside at the magazine Vanity Fair.  The tweet, dense by Trumpian standards, was a bit confounding, given its highly specific references to rumors and tensions within the Manhattan magazine industry, and a minor Twitter kerfuffle involving a 63-second video about Hillary Clinton.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Anatomy of a Trump Tweet: Vanity Fair Edition

2017-12-28.abstract: It’s a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. Here’s a sampling of cultural highlights this weekend and over the week ahead.
2017-12-28.snippet: It’s a big city, with plenty to do, see, hear and watch. Here’s a sampling of cultural highlights this weekend and over the week ahead.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: This new dance-and-travel series, to be unveiled on Netflix on New Year’s Day, explores the world through movement. Hosted by the dancer Vandana Hart, it investigates traditional and urban dance traditions on a global level. So far, there are five episodes with locations in Paris; Vietnam; Beirut, Lebanon; Lagos, Nigeria; and Bali. “It’s going to be a real mixture of different styles,” Ms. Hart says in the trailer. And it’s a good excuse for a New Year’s resolution: In 2018, see more dance. GIA KOURLAS
2017-12-28.headline_main: 10 Things to Do Now in NYC

2017-12-28.abstract: The man who built football programs at Miami, Louisville and Florida Atlantic is lapping it up this bowl season, even if he isn’t in the Hall of Fame.
2017-12-28.snippet: The man who built football programs at Miami, Louisville and Florida Atlantic is lapping it up this bowl season, even if he isn’t in the Hall of Fame.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: BOYNTON BEACH, Fla. — Howard Schnellenberger’s house is like a museum. Among its items are a cartoon signed by George H.W. Bush; a note from Burt Reynolds, the movie star and former Florida State halfback; and a jersey from perhaps the greatest quarterback Schnellenberger coached, Joe Namath.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Howard Schnellenberger’s Legacy Gets a Shine This Postseason

2017-12-28.abstract: Mr. Asaro, 82, who over the years has been accused of murder and taking part in the Lufthansa heist, admitted that he took revenge on a driver who cut him off.
2017-12-28.snippet: Mr. Asaro, 82, who over the years has been accused of murder and taking part in the Lufthansa heist, admitted that he took revenge on a driver who cut him off.
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: For nearly half a century, the reputed wise guy Vincent Asaro has escaped conviction on an array of criminal charges, having been accused — and then acquitted — of, among other things, strangling a man with a dog chain and taking part in the infamous Lufthansa heist in 1978.
2017-12-28.headline_main: Vincent Asaro, Reputed Mobster, Is Sentenced to 8 Years for Road Rage Arson

2017-12-28.abstract: Hassan Sharif shaped the art scene in the UAE from its street trash. “But his art insists that nothing is wasted if you make waste your creative source.”
2017-12-28.snippet: Hassan Sharif shaped the art scene in the UAE from its street trash. “But his art insists that nothing is wasted if you make waste your creative source.”
2017-12-28.lead_paragraph: SHARJAH, United Arab Emirates — Ethnic profiling is business as usual in the contemporary art market. 2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: SATURDAY PUZZLE — When you have finally pushed yourself and improved your solving skills to the point where you are ready to tackle a Saturday crossword, you will no doubt be of two minds. On the one hand, you will silently pray for mercy, because finding that elusive toehold will be much harder and, on the other hand, you will also want that Saturday struggle you’d heard so much about. You will want as much bang for your solving buck as you can get, and if it’s too easy, you will be left feeling vaguely disappointed.

It was only a matter of time, and yes, I got my flu shot. It wouldn’t be the Martian Death Flu without that kind of punch line.

2017-12-29.abstract: The photographer explains how this year’s photo essay came together.
2017-12-29.snippet: The photographer explains how this year’s photo essay came together.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: I had heard of the “anniversary effect,” or the pain of a traumatic event returning as its calendar date comes back around. My father died on Dec. 16, 2016, so my own anniversary effect was in full swing when I began this project. At each door, I was met by a person who had stepped up when needed — who had recently lost someone but hadn’t yet finished taking care of them. After a while, I stopped being surprised by everyone’s sense of humor and warm, present, tense clarity of purpose: I related to it. It was the common denominator with everyone I met, probably because it is the prerequisite — or perhaps the reward — for being the person who steps up before and after a loss. Each circumstance was different, but my intention was to honor each absence by describing vitality and presence wherever I could find it.
2017-12-29.headline_main: Behind the Lens of ‘The Things They Loved’

2017-12-29.abstract: Calvin Trillin reflects on the idioms lost in the age of the smartphone.
2017-12-29.snippet: Calvin Trillin reflects on the idioms lost in the age of the smartphone.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: I was on the subway, watching a teenager text on his smartphone, when I realized that the idiom “all thumbs” might be doomed. I’ve had any number of such moments — what some people would call “ah-ha” moments — on the subway lately. A day or so before the “all thumbs” revelation, I was reminded once again that I am what used to be called “getting on in years”: I was standing in a crowded car when my eye happened to catch the eye of an attractive young woman who was seated in front of me. She smiled. I smiled. I was on my way to thinking that maybe she had me confused with George Clooney — a mix-up that, I’ll admit, does not occur on a regular basis. Then she smiled again, and offered me her seat.
2017-12-29.headline_main: When ‘All Thumbs’ Becomes a Compliment

2017-12-29.abstract: For fiction writers, keeping up with technological and political change in their work is a risky proposition. But nowadays it is more essential than ever.
2017-12-29.snippet: For fiction writers, keeping up with technological and political change in their work is a risky proposition. But nowadays it is more essential than ever.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: Every novel is a letter written to the future. The words we write often don’t appear in print for a year, two years, even more — and by the time they appear, the world (which we are supposed to be reflecting) has changed. Increasingly, as history seems to speed up, novelists have to ask themselves hard questions about how they’ll possibly keep pace.
2017-12-29.headline_main: Planned Obsolescence

2017-12-29.snippet: Amor Towles, whose second novel has spent 46 weeks on the best-seller list, likes to bring vintage mysteries on vacation.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: CRIME SPREE: In 2017, no novel spent more time on the hardcover fiction list than “A Gentleman in Moscow,” Amor Towles’s elegant tale of a Russian count confined for decades to house arrest at the Metropol Hotel for writing a poem that displeased the Bolsheviks. Towles’s novel (his second, after “Rules of Civility”) initially hit the list in the fall of 2016, alongside new titles from Carl Hiaasen, Jonathan Safran Foer and James Lee Burke, among other eminences — and then, like its protagonist, it just sort of hunkered down for the long haul. As the calendar turns on a new year, “A Gentleman in Moscow” has been a best seller for 46 weeks.
2017-12-29.headline_main: He Wrote ‘A Gentleman in Moscow,’ and Likes Reading About Scoundrels in Los Angeles

2017-12-29.abstract: Five books on oceans, hurricanes and the perfect wave.
2017-12-29.snippet: Five books on oceans, hurricanes and the perfect wave.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: Surfers, like theologians, must wrestle with the problem of evil. For the theologian, the question is how to reconcile the malevolence and suffering of the world with the existence of an all-good, all-powerful god. For the surfer, the problem is slightly less profound: How do you justify the enjoyment of perfect waves when they are generated by destructive storms hundreds of miles away? In September, Hurricanes Irma and Maria posed this question with some vividness, producing the best run of swell seen in years along the East Coast while unleashing chaos and devastation down in the Caribbean. Surfers, to judge from the throngs who gleefully paddled out from Florida to New England, make for unreflective scholars of the divine.
2017-12-29.headline_main: What’s Bad News for Coastlines Can Be Good News for Surfers

2017-12-29.snippet: These 10 clips show why a riveting 1953 version of Puccini’s opera deserves its status as one of the finest classical albums ever made.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: Every soprano who sings Tosca tries to make her opening words — frantic calls of her lover’s name, before she’s even onstage — sound suspicious. The title character of Puccini’s great opera is an acclaimed prima donna in Rome in 1800. Tosca is passionate and jealous. So she must be wondering why the door to the church where her beloved Mario is painting a mural is locked. And who did she just hear him whispering with?
2017-12-29.headline_main: The Best Opera Recording Ever Is Maria Callas Singing ‘Tosca.’ Hear Why.

2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: New Year’s Eve is a time to set goals: to eat better, to save more money, to work harder, to drink less. It’s Day 1 on the road to a “new you.” But this road, as we all know, is difficult to follow. Humans are notoriously bad at resisting temptation, especially (as research confirms) if we’re busy, tired or stressed. By Jan. 8, some 25 percent of resolutions have fallen by the wayside. And by the time the year ends, fewer than 10 percent have been fully kept.
2017-12-29.headline_main: The Only Way to Keep Your Resolutions

2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: Carter Cleveland started Artsy, a site for buying and selling art, in 2009 when he was a senior at Princeton University. Since then, the company has grown rapidly, and it now offers access to the works of over 70,000 artists, the collective worth of which is estimated to be around $30 billion. Mr. Cleveland said that he used to “work 16 hours straight on a Sunday.” But he got a wake-up call when a repetitive stress injury left him temporarily unable to type. These days, he prefers wellness to work on Sundays. Mr. Cleveland, 30, lives in the East Village with two roommates.
2017-12-29.headline_main: How Carter Cleveland, of Artsy, Spends His Sundays

That’s one lesson from the selection of exceptional arts photography below, all commissioned or published by our photo editors this year. Memorable subjects like the actor Mark Hamill, the acrobat Elena Gatilova and the professional wrestler Jinder Mahal used their particular gifts to open portals to other worlds, resurrecting Luke Skywalker, making poetry out of aerial performance or conquering the WWE in the process.

2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: Action Bronson began a recent episode of “The Untitled Action Bronson Show” in the barber chair. In the corner of the studio, cobblers were building shoes. The comedian DeRay Davis arrived with some Chicago-style pizza that failed to impress. “Eh, it’s all right,” Bronson said with a shrug. Then, a yoga session began, and after a couple of minutes, he lit a blunt.
2017-12-29.headline_main: Action Bronson, the Leader of the Most Joyously Disorienting Show on Late Night

2017-12-29.abstract: Some drivers in Queens and Brooklyn worry their commuting costs could go up with a new congestion plan. They oppose tolls on the East River bridges.
2017-12-29.snippet: Some drivers in Queens and Brooklyn worry their commuting costs could go up with a new congestion plan. They oppose tolls on the East River bridges.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: The closest subway station to Bob Friedrich’s home in eastern Queens is 10 miles away, so he drives to work in Manhattan at least three times a week.
2017-12-29.headline_main: For Congestion Pricing Plan, New Support and Steadfast Critics

2017-12-29.abstract: More people are consuming alcohol in risky ways. That’s not a good trend.
2017-12-29.snippet: More people are consuming alcohol in risky ways. That’s not a good trend.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: After a season of indulgence, many Americans resolve to drink less in the new year. It’s a common pledge — many of us can recall cringe-worthy texts sent after a raucous night out or a regrettable comment uttered after that third glass of wine.
2017-12-29.headline_main: America, Can We Talk About Your Drinking?

2017-12-29.abstract: An award-winning playwright argues that the in-the-moment interplay between actors and audience can help us cope with an increasingly virtual world.
2017-12-29.snippet: An award-winning playwright argues that the in-the-moment interplay between actors and audience can help us cope with an increasingly virtual world.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: I recently learned that a group of neuroscientists have discovered that watching live theater can synchronize the heartbeats of an audience. One of the researchers put it this way: “Experiencing the live theater performance was extraordinary enough to overcome group differences and produce a common physiological experience.”
2017-12-29.headline_main: An Antidote to Digital Dehumanization? Live Theater

2017-12-29.abstract: The philanthropic set capped off 2017 with the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s Acquisitions Fund Benefit, the Berggruen Prize Gala and the New York Botanical Garden.
2017-12-29.snippet: The philanthropic set capped off 2017 with the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s Acquisitions Fund Benefit, the Berggruen Prize Gala and the New York Botanical Garden.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: The philanthropic set capped off 2017 with the Metropolitan Museum of Art’s Acquisitions Fund Benefit on Dec. 14. The Berggruen Institute awarded Baroness Onora O’Neill with its $1 million Berggruen Prize for Philosophy and Culture at the New York Public Library on the same evening. And the New York Botanical Garden held its 19th annual Winter Wonderland Ball at the Enid A. Haupt Conservatory on Dec. 15.
2017-12-29.headline_main: Wrapping Up a Year of Fund-Raising

2017-12-29.abstract: Sure, the Jets are 5-10, but at least they didn’t implode like the Giants. That was enough to earn Todd Bowles and Mike Maccagnan contract extensions.
2017-12-29.snippet: Sure, the Jets are 5-10, but at least they didn’t implode like the Giants. That was enough to earn Todd Bowles and Mike Maccagnan contract extensions.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: FLORHAM PARK, N.J. — Jets tight end Austin Seferian-Jenkins pointed a thumb over his shoulder to a piece of paper taped to the inside of his locker. It was a printout of an ESPN article that projected the Jets would go 0-16 this season.
2017-12-29.headline_main: Jets Put Positive Spin on 5 Wins, and Bring Back Bowles and Maccagnan

2017-12-29.abstract: This time last year, the company that made Mario and Donkey Kong household names seemed to have lost its touch. Now, with the new console, it’s on a roll.
2017-12-29.snippet: This time last year, the company that made Mario and Donkey Kong household names seemed to have lost its touch. Now, with the new console, it’s on a roll.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: Jake Kazdal, an American video game developer who lives in Kyoto, Japan, spent a night in early March refreshing the website of GameStop, the video game retail chain in the United States. He wanted to buy Nintendo’s just-released console, the Switch. But the device had already sold out in Japan, forcing him to look elsewhere.
2017-12-29.headline_main: Nintendo’s Switch Brings Some Magic Back

2017-12-29.abstract: News from Washington dominated headlines and captured the world’s attention this year. Here’s a look at a handful of those stories, with reflections from the reporters who covered them.
2017-12-29.snippet: News from Washington dominated headlines and captured the world’s attention this year. Here’s a look at a handful of those stories, with reflections from the reporters who covered them.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: It would be an understatement to say that 2017 was one of the most exciting years in American politics in decades.
2017-12-29.headline_main: 2017: Our Reporters Reflect on Covering Washington and Politics

2017-12-29.headline_main: Readers Respond to ‘Deliverance From 27,000 Feet’

2017-12-29.abstract: The authorities said Friday that “approximately 55 percent of the customers who are able to receive electric power have the service restored.”
2017-12-29.snippet: The authorities said Friday that “approximately 55 percent of the customers who are able to receive electric power have the service restored.”
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: For the first time in the 100 days since Hurricane Maria slammed Puerto Rico, the government finally knows how many people still don’t have power: about half.
2017-12-29.headline_main: Three Months After Maria, Roughly Half of Puerto Ricans Still Without Power

2017-12-29.abstract: He led the engineering team that produced an innovative answer to the conventional piston automotive engine. He later led the company.
2017-12-29.snippet: He led the engineering team that produced an innovative answer to the conventional piston automotive engine. He later led the company.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: Kenichi Yamamoto, who led the engineering team that produced a commercially viable rotary engine at the company now known as Mazda Motor Company and later became its president and chairman, died on Dec. 20 in Kanagawa Prefecture, near Tokyo. He was 95.
2017-12-29.headline_main: Kenichi Yamamoto, Father of Mazda’s Rotary Engine, Is Dead at 95

2017-12-29.abstract: At the site of a deadly fire from a decade ago, a rebuilt home disguises the terrible loss of 10 people, nine of them children, but a mother remembers.
2017-12-29.snippet: At the site of a deadly fire from a decade ago, a rebuilt home disguises the terrible loss of 10 people, nine of them children, but a mother remembers.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: To a stranger’s knock, a boy of about 9 opens the door of 1022 Woodycrest Avenue, the Bronx. He listens for a moment, then circles back to summon his mother, Manthia Magassa. The warming fragrance of a stew has drifted from the kitchen, then streams in to the cold doorway. An electronic chirp sounds from the wooden stairwell. The boy watches television.
2017-12-29.headline_main: In the Bronx, History Repeats Itself With Deadly Force

2017-12-29.abstract: Yuzuri, a Japanese drink made from whole yuzu fruits steeped in a rice-based spirit, adds a different dimension to traditionally lemony cocktails.
2017-12-29.snippet: Yuzuri, a Japanese drink made from whole yuzu fruits steeped in a rice-based spirit, adds a different dimension to traditionally lemony cocktails.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: Yuzu, the lemony citrus fruit that’s a staple in Japan, provides the essential flavor and aroma for Yuzuri, a new Japanese liqueur. The whole fruit — peels, juice and pulp — steeps for a month in a spirit made from rice. The liqueur is then lightly sweetened. The result is almost colorless, with a flavor that’s citrusy, hinting of lemongrass and more tart than sweet. I’d keep it on the bar to add a new dimension to tart-sweet cocktails like a sidecar or a whiskey sour: Yuzuri, $37.99 for 750 milliliters, Hi-Time Wine Cellars, Costa Mesa. Calif., hitimewine.net.
2017-12-29.headline_main: New Liqueur Adds Tart Citrus Flavors to Cocktails

2017-12-29.abstract: An all-purpose workhorse from northern Italy also holds pasta bakes and moussaka.
2017-12-29.snippet: An all-purpose workhorse from northern Italy also holds pasta bakes and moussaka.
2017-12-29.lead_paragraph: Lagostina, an Italian cookware company in the Piedmont region, was started in 1901 as a tin-plating factory. Today the company specializes in handmade cookware like this new lasagnera, a stainless steel pan designed for lasagna and the other savory dishes like moussaka and enchiladas that the season demands. It has a cherry wood cover: Lagostina Lasagnera, $199.95, Williams Sonoma stores, williams-sonoma.com.
2017-12-29.headline_main: Don’t Let ‘Lasagna’ Fool You. This Pan Is the Whole Enchilada.

2017-12-30.abstract: Made in Armenia, these mellow preserves combine a somewhat crisp texture with earthy richness.
2017-12-30.snippet: Made in Armenia, these mellow preserves combine a somewhat crisp texture with earthy richness.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The pumpkin preserves from Murray’s Cheese will give quince paste (membrillo) some mellow competition on the cheese plate. The preserves are made in Armenia and combine a somewhat crisp texture with earthy richness: Murray’s Preserved Pumpkin, $7.99 for 10.9 ounces, Murray’s Cheese, 888-692-4339, murrayscheese.com.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Pumpkin Preserves for the Cheese Plate

2017-12-30.abstract: A president’s character matters, no matter which policies he champions.
2017-12-30.snippet: A president’s character matters, no matter which policies he champions.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Tax cuts. Deregulation. More for the military; less for the United Nations. The Islamic State crushed in its heartland. Assad hit with cruise missiles. Troops to Afghanistan. Arms for Ukraine. A tougher approach to North Korea. Jerusalem recognized as Israel’s capital. The Iran deal decertified. Title IX kangaroo courts on campus condemned. Yes to Keystone. No to Paris. Wall Street roaring and consumer confidence high.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Why I’m Still a NeverTrumper

2017-12-30.abstract: The high-profile gerrymandering case, which could have important consequences for the 2018 midterm elections, will head to the state’s Supreme Court.
2017-12-30.snippet: The high-profile gerrymandering case, which could have important consequences for the 2018 midterm elections, will head to the state’s Supreme Court.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: A Pennsylvania judge said Friday the state’s Congressional districts were drawn to give Republicans an advantage, but they did not violate the state Constitution, ruling in a high-profile gerrymandering case with the potential to have major consequences on the 2018 midterm elections.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Judge Says Pennsylvania Election Districts Give Republicans an Edge, but Are Not Illegal

2017-12-30.abstract: Rocket Broth, a new broth line from a nutritionist and cookbook writer, sells chicken bone broth and vegan broth.
2017-12-30.snippet: Rocket Broth, a new broth line from a nutritionist and cookbook writer, sells chicken bone broth and vegan broth.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: It’s soup season, and here are some newcomers for which the graphic designers worked overtime cramming the hype (“Broth is cool!” “Hey everyone drink broth!”) all over the packages. The brand, Rocket Broth, offers a chicken bone broth and vegan broth, both made in Brooklyn from mostly organic ingredients. Sheryl Moller, a certified health practitioner and nutrition guide, and Cree LeFavour, a cookbook writer, created the broth line. Sold in stand-up pouches, the broths are pleasant and modestly flavorful (230 to 250 milligrams of sodium help) for drinking or using in recipes. The chicken bone broth has a hefty 16 grams of protein per cup: Rocket Broth, $13.99 for 24 ounces, sold frozen, myrocketbroth.com.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Broths for Sipping or Souping

2017-12-30.abstract: In the last week of the year, called the 13th Month or the Second Season by retailers, e-commerce-fueled returns and gift cards send consumers back to buy more.
2017-12-30.snippet: In the last week of the year, called the 13th Month or the Second Season by retailers, e-commerce-fueled returns and gift cards send consumers back to buy more.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Gina Mezzacappa avoided the mall for her holiday shopping, but an ill-fitting pair of Michael Kors boots brought her back this week.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Christmas May Be Over, but Holiday Shopping Is Not

2017-12-30.abstract: The inaccurate statements covered the Russia investigation, health care, immigration and the president’s following on social media.
2017-12-30.snippet: The inaccurate statements covered the Russia investigation, health care, immigration and the president’s following on social media.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump, in an impromptu interview on Thursday with The New York Times, rattled off at least 10 false or misleading claims about the Russia investigation, wars abroad, health care, immigration and trade. Here’s an assessment.
2017-12-30.headline_main: 10 Falsehoods From Trump’s Interview With The Times

2017-12-30.abstract: The chef Eric Ripert adds an eight-course meat-free option to the tasting menu.
2017-12-30.snippet: The chef Eric Ripert adds an eight-course meat-free option to the tasting menu.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: There has always been an occasional vegetable or meat dish served at Le Bernardin, which has featured mostly seafood from the day Maguy and Gilbert Le Coze opened it in Paris in 1972. Now Eric Ripert, the restaurant’s executive chef since 1994 and then partner, is introducing the restaurant’s first vegetarian tasting menu. “I often get a dozen inquiries a week for a vegetable tasting,” he said. “I like the idea of a menu that pays homage to the vegetable, though it’s a creative challenge.” The menu has six savory courses and two desserts. Standouts include celeriac soup served in a whole celeriac, a twist of pasta thatched with black truffles, a roulade of zucchini and caponata, and roasted porcini alongside eggplant that is both silky and crisp: Vegetarian tasting menu, $185 a person, Le Bernardin, 155 West 51st Street (Seventh Avenue), 212-554-1515, le-bernardin.com.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Le Bernardin Adds a Vegetarian Tasting Menu

2017-12-30.abstract: Constance Kirker, a culinary historian, will give a talk on sweets role in Christianity, Hinduism, Buddhism and Islam.
2017-12-30.snippet: Constance Kirker, a culinary historian, will give a talk on sweets role in Christianity, Hinduism, Buddhism and Islam.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: On the religious side of the holiday season, and indeed across the calendar, there are any number of traditional sweets with sacred meanings. Constance Kirker, a culinary historian and retired professor of art history at Penn State who now teaches at the Culinary Institute of America in Singapore, will address the topic “Sacred Sweet Tooth: The Symbolism and Function of Candy and Sweets in Religious Traditions” as it pertains to Christianity, Hinduism, Buddhism and Islam. The talk is sponsored by the Culinary Historians of New York. Sweets will be served: “Sacred Sweet Tooth,” Jan. 15 at 6:30 p.m., $25 for members, $40 for nonmembers, $10 for students, eventbrite.com; Culinary Historians of New York, Anthroposophical Society of America, 138 West 15th Street (Seventh Avenue), culinaryhistoriansny.org/events/.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Delving Into the Religious Symbolism of Candy

2017-12-30.abstract: I knew this was not going to go over well with the White House press office, which hates being blindsided by the president making news.
2017-12-30.snippet: I knew this was not going to go over well with the White House press office, which hates being blindsided by the president making news.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. — Shortly after 1 p.m. on Thursday, President Trump came off the 18th hole of his golf course here and walked into the club house’s Grill Room. Waiters scurried to bring menus and drinks to a large round table reserved for him as he stopped to shake hands and make small talk with members eating lunch.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Our Reporter Mike Schmidt on His Golf Club Interview With President Trump

2017-12-30.abstract: A fire tore through an apartment building in the Bronx on Thursday night, killing at least 12 people on multiple floors.
2017-12-30.snippet: A fire tore through an apartment building in the Bronx on Thursday night, killing at least 12 people on multiple floors.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: A fire tore through an apartment building in the Bronx on Thursday night, killing at least 12 people on multiple floors.

2017-12-30.abstract: Frigid weather can make fighting fires especially difficult, officials said, causing equipment to freeze and surfaces to become perilous.
2017-12-30.snippet: Frigid weather can make fighting fires especially difficult, officials said, causing equipment to freeze and surfaces to become perilous.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The frozen hydrant in front of the burning building. The icy steps tripping up firefighters as they carried people out. The frigid front and rear fire escapes cramped with dozens of people clambering to safety.
2017-12-30.headline_main: In Deadly Bronx Blaze, Responders Battled Fire and Ice

2017-12-30.abstract: Plans by a Google sibling for a development where robots collect trash and heated paths melt snow have generated excitement. But its data-collection sensors have spurred privacy concerns.
2017-12-30.snippet: Plans by a Google sibling for a development where robots collect trash and heated paths melt snow have generated excitement. But its data-collection sensors have spurred privacy concerns.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: TORONTO — For a city striving to become a major technology center, it was a prize catch: A Google corporate sibling would spend the coming year planning a futuristic metropolis in a derelict part of Toronto’s waterfront.
2017-12-30.headline_main: City of the Future? Humans, Not Technology, Are the Challenge in Toronto

2017-12-30.abstract: South Vietnam’s role in the controversial counterinsurgency effort offers lessons for today’s wars.
2017-12-30.snippet: South Vietnam’s role in the controversial counterinsurgency effort offers lessons for today’s wars.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: In late December 1967, the government of South Vietnam announced a reorganization of its war effort against the country’s Communist insurgency. Effective immediately, all South Vietnamese counterinsurgency activities became part of a new program known as Phuong Hoang, a reference to a magical bird associated with royalty and power in Vietnamese and Chinese cultural traditions. In response to the South Vietnamese move, American officials in Vietnam began referring to their own counterinsurgency coordination efforts by the name that they deemed the closest Western analogue to the mythical creature: Phoenix.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Behind the Phoenix Program

2017-12-30.abstract: An instance of swatting, in which a false report is made to get a SWAT team to raid a rival’s house, led to the fatal shooting, the police said.
2017-12-30.snippet: An instance of swatting, in which a false report is made to get a SWAT team to raid a rival’s house, led to the fatal shooting, the police said.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The call to the police sounded dire: a violent dispute at a house in Wichita, Kan., a person shot to death, an armed man holding hostages and threatening to burn the place down.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Summoned by a Prank Call, Police in Wichita Kill a Man at His Front Door

2017-12-30.abstract: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, December 30, 2017.
2017-12-30.snippet: Quotation of the Day for Saturday, December 30, 2017.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: “I need somebody to tell me what to feel. Where do I go from here? Four at one time — what do I do?”

2017-12-30.abstract: A complex new tax code is enacted as its enforcement agency, with a decimated staff and a shrinking budget, struggles to do its job.
2017-12-30.snippet: A complex new tax code is enacted as its enforcement agency, with a decimated staff and a shrinking budget, struggles to do its job.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: No federal agency generates as much rancor as the Internal Revenue Service, part of that duo of inevitability, taxes and death. Despite its reputation for toughness, the I.R.S. relies on voluntary compliance, as in Americans’ sense of duty, to collect the money that powers our government.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Don’t Cheer as the I.R.S. Grows Weaker

2017-12-30.abstract: With news breaking at a relentless pace, you might have missed some terrific articles The New York Times published this year. Here’s a selection.
2017-12-30.snippet: With news breaking at a relentless pace, you might have missed some terrific articles The New York Times published this year. Here’s a selection.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: There was a lot of news in 2017 — just take a look at the 750 breaking news alerts The New York Times sent this year, a 30 percent jump from last year. So we understand if you might have missed some of these great reads. Here’s a selection of some of our favorite somewhat-overlooked stories from the past year.
2017-12-30.headline_main: 20 Great Reads You Probably Missed in 2017

2017-12-30.snippet: A new season of Netflix’s digital-age creep show warns that technology can empower misanthropes and misogynists.

2017-12-30.abstract: Meet eccentric New York personalities through the HBO series “High Maintenance.” And catch the teenage comedy “Mean Girls” before it leaves Netflix.
