2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Meet eccentric New York personalities through the wandering HBO series “High Maintenance.” And catch the teenage comedy “Mean Girls” before it leaves Netflix in January.
2017-12-30.headline_main: What’s on TV Saturday: ‘High Maintenance’ and ‘Mean Girls’

2017-12-30.abstract: Ian Cathro had a coaching pedigree but not a playing one, and in the end that might have cost him his job. Will he ever get a second chance?
2017-12-30.snippet: Ian Cathro had a coaching pedigree but not a playing one, and in the end that might have cost him his job. Will he ever get a second chance?
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: EDINBURGH, Scotland — When the second goal went in, Ian Cathro felt a shift. Cathro, the Heart of Midlothian coach, had not given up on the game: His team was down by only 2-1 to visiting Dunfermline in their Scottish League Cup match, with much of the second half to play. There was still more than enough time to draw level, perhaps even go on to win.
2017-12-30.headline_main: For Young Coaches, Tradition Is Among the Toughest Opponents

2017-12-30.abstract: British government memos, tweets and other documents find their way to the National Archives, with some released each year. Here’s a quirky look at Friday’s yield.
2017-12-30.snippet: British government memos, tweets and other documents find their way to the National Archives, with some released each year. Here’s a quirky look at Friday’s yield.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: LONDON — The sporadic release of documents from Britain’s National Archives gives a glimpse into the country’s inner workings. For instance, there was the revelation that Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher debated using the military to quell a miners’ strike in 1984.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Pandas, U.F.O.s and Other Curiosities from Britain’s National Archives

2017-12-30.abstract: The British broadcaster, once a bastion of “received pronunciation,” has learned that if it wants to reach new audiences, it needs to try new approaches.
2017-12-30.snippet: The British broadcaster, once a bastion of “received pronunciation,” has learned that if it wants to reach new audiences, it needs to try new approaches.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The headline on the article, published on the BBC’s website, reads like this: “Woman wan troway poo-poo, come trap for window.”
2017-12-30.headline_main: The BBC in Pidgin? People Like It Well-Well

2017-12-30.abstract: Orphanages for Afghan children of jailed mothers meet part of the need, but funding cuts threaten their future and many others stay in prison.
2017-12-30.snippet: Orphanages for Afghan children of jailed mothers meet part of the need, but funding cuts threaten their future and many others stay in prison.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: KABUL, Afghanistan — On visiting days in the women’s wing of Pul-e-Charki prison in Kabul, Najia Nasim would regularly see a little girl named Dahlia waiting outside her mother’s cell, standing up straight, wearing a small backpack. Inside the backpack were all of the girl’s clothes and a few personal possessions.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Some Afghan Children Find an Alternative to Jail — for Now

2017-12-30.abstract: A reader wonders about the obstacles to redividing two apartments that were combined long ago.
2017-12-30.snippet: A reader wonders about the obstacles to redividing two apartments that were combined long ago.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Q. My wife and I have lived in a prewar co-op on the Upper West Side since 1985. In 1996, we purchased the neighboring unit, combining the two apartments to enlarge our living space. We are both seniors now and no longer need so much space. Are there any city laws or codes that would prohibit us from redividing the apartments and returning them to their original configurations so that we could sell one and remain in the other?
2017-12-30.headline_main: Can I Divide My Apartment Into Two?

2017-12-30.abstract: Charming villages. Inventive meals. A gorgeous glacier to hike. What’s not to like? (That rain was pretty loud.)
2017-12-30.snippet: Charming villages. Inventive meals. A gorgeous glacier to hike. What’s not to like? (That rain was pretty loud.)
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The big white mountain goats lazed on a path of an alpine park last August overlooking Bergen, Norway’s second largest city, where a crowded funicular had taken us to the top.
2017-12-30.headline_main: In Certifiably Happy Norway, a Cranky Traveler Finds Some Bliss (Within Reason)

2017-12-30.abstract: From a Mini Cooper ride around town to a street art survey, new ways to see a classic city.
2017-12-30.snippet: From a Mini Cooper ride around town to a street art survey, new ways to see a classic city.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Winter may not be London’s peak tourist season, but travelers with plans to head to the city in the coming colder weather months can look forward to a lineup of new tours that are far from run of the mill. Whether it’s your first time in London or you’re a repeat visitor, these seven city tours are meant to unearth perspectives on a perennially popular destination that both surprise and entertain.
2017-12-30.headline_main: London Tours Meant to Surprise and Entertain

2017-12-30.abstract: In an era of Amazonian price destruction, mutual funds are an outlier. Weak directors, complacent investors and the lure of rich profits are among the reasons.
2017-12-30.snippet: In an era of Amazonian price destruction, mutual funds are an outlier. Weak directors, complacent investors and the lure of rich profits are among the reasons.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The billionaire investor Ronald S. Baron flashed the grin of a proud father at his annual investor jamboree in November, as the chief executives of his favorite companies explained how slashing prices stoked their bottom lines.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Why Are Mutual Fund Fees So High? This Billionaire Knows

2017-12-30.abstract: Once dominant, they have not won a medal in the singles competition since 2006. Expectations are low that they will win any at the Games in February.
2017-12-30.snippet: Once dominant, they have not won a medal in the singles competition since 2006. Expectations are low that they will win any at the Games in February.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Can it be close to 20 years since Tara Lipinski, then 15, upset Michelle Kwan at the 1998 Winter Games in Nagano, Japan, to become the youngest Olympic figure skating champion?
2017-12-30.headline_main: Where Are the American Women in Olympic Figure Skating?

2017-12-30.abstract: Addiction treatment, heart surgery and brain research are just some of the areas where virtual reality is helping to improve traditional approaches to treatment and training in medicine. Step inside a human heart or experience addiction treatment in VR.
2017-12-30.snippet: Addiction treatment, heart surgery and brain research are just some of the areas where virtual reality is helping to improve traditional approaches to treatment and training in medicine. Step inside a human heart or experience addiction treatment ...
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Addiction treatment, heart surgery and brain research are just some of the areas where virtual reality is helping to improve traditional approaches to treatment and training in medicine. Step inside a human heart or experience addiction treatment in VR.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Brains, Hearts and Heroin Addiction: Medicine in VR

2017-12-30.abstract: High jinks and networking abound at 1600 Vine Street, the apartment complex minting the next generation of Instagram and YouTube celebrities.
2017-12-30.snippet: High jinks and networking abound at 1600 Vine Street, the apartment complex minting the next generation of Instagram and YouTube celebrities.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — On any given day, something crazy is likely to be happening at 1600 Vine Street, a 550-unit apartment complex in Hollywood.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Inside the Hollywood Home of Social Media’s Stars. (Don’t Be Shy.)

2017-12-30.abstract: Kazakh cowboys, while proud of providing their rapidly modernizing nation with a link to its nomadic past, rarely want their children to follow them onto the frigid steppes.
2017-12-30.snippet: Kazakh cowboys, while proud of providing their rapidly modernizing nation with a link to its nomadic past, rarely want their children to follow them onto the frigid steppes.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: KERBULAQ, Kazakhstan — It has been a long, rough ride for the cowboys of Kazakhstan, descendants of the nomadic herders who roamed across Central Asia until Russia declared in 1864 that it could no longer tolerate their “turbulent and unsettled character” and would force them to settle down.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Kazakhstan Prizes Its Cowboys, but Few Want to Saddle Up for Harsh Life

2017-12-30.abstract: Tashi Wangchuk, who was detained after appearing in a New York Times video about Tibetan language education, faces 15 years in prison for inciting separatism.
2017-12-30.snippet: Tashi Wangchuk, who was detained after appearing in a New York Times video about Tibetan language education, faces 15 years in prison for inciting separatism.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Chinese officials are planning to put Tashi Wangchuk, who advocates broader Tibetan language education, on trial next week for “inciting separatism,” a charge that could result in a sentence of up to 15 years in prison, according to his lawyers.
2017-12-30.headline_main: China to Try Tibetan Education Advocate Detained for 2 Years

2017-12-30.abstract: The magazine looks back at artists, innovators and thinkers we lost this year. Styles offers a lesson in cryptokitties (I had to Google it, too). And Metropolitan offers lessons in happiness from those who have lots of experience.
2017-12-30.snippet: The magazine looks back at artists, innovators and thinkers we lost this year. Styles offers a lesson in cryptokitties (I had to Google it, too). And Metropolitan offers lessons in happiness from those who have lots of experience.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: This weekend is one for reflecting and looking ahead; for family, friends and football; for sleeping in and starting things off right; for bundling up and bingeing on good (or bad) TV. Whatever you’re doing, take a minute, or a bit more, and indulge in some great journalism. Happy New Year!
2017-12-30.headline_main: 10 of Our Best Weekend Reads + One Great Video

2017-12-30.abstract: Will 2018 make more sense than 2017? Maybe! Right now, though, we’re baffled by these 9 things.
2017-12-30.snippet: Will 2018 make more sense than 2017? Maybe! Right now, though, we’re baffled by these 9 things.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The year was littered with mysteries. Still, we suspected we knew many of the answers already. Are dogs smarter than cats? Yes and, no offense, but there’s a reason so many anthropomorphized pets are pooches. Did the Pentagon secretly sort of believe in aliens? Fox Mulder made us all want to believe back in the ’90s. Was Hollywood corrupt? Sure thing! If even more so than we’d imagined.
2017-12-30.headline_main: The Most Vexing Unanswered Questions of 2017

2017-12-30.abstract: This year, 21 photographers captured the ways we present ourselves to the world.
2017-12-30.snippet: This year, 21 photographers captured the ways we present ourselves to the world.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: In a photograph by Sara Hylton, a confident woman stands in profile for a portrait. Wearing a patterned shirtdress and gleaming brass jewelry, she exudes style. What is not immediately apparent is that the picture was shot in South Sudan, a young, war-torn country where even carrying a camera in public is dangerous.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Don’t Call It Street Style

2017-12-30.abstract: Krav Maga, which extols eye gouging and groin kicking, is a mainstay of military training and increasingly popular with civilians. Now, its founder’s disciples are sparring over who is the real grandmaster.
2017-12-30.snippet: Krav Maga, which extols eye gouging and groin kicking, is a mainstay of military training and increasingly popular with civilians. Now, its founder’s disciples are sparring over who is the real grandmaster.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: NETANYA, Israel — More martial than art, this form of fighting extols the virtues of a poke in the eye and a timely kick to the groin. Its masters insist it is not a sport, because there are no rules, except for one: to survive.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Battle Royale Over Rightful Heir to Israeli Self-Defense Discipline

2017-12-30.abstract: As demonstrators called for Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran’s supreme leader, to step down, about 4,000 people in Tehran took part in an annual rally in support of the government.
2017-12-30.snippet: As demonstrators called for Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran’s supreme leader, to step down, about 4,000 people in Tehran took part in an annual rally in support of the government.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Iran’s leaders were confronted by unauthorized protests in major cities for the third straight day on Saturday, with crowds aiming their anger at the supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, and some demanding that he step down.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Iran Confronts 3rd Day of Protests, With Calls for Khamenei to Quit

2017-12-30.abstract: The star of a man once renowned as the prototype of a genius inventor has faded. But his reputation is having a revival, and his creations still resonate.
2017-12-30.snippet: The star of a man once renowned as the prototype of a genius inventor has faded. But his reputation is having a revival, and his creations still resonate.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: A Tesla is an electric car. Just about everybody knows that.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Tesla the Car Is a Household Name. Long Ago, So Was Nikola Tesla.

2017-12-30.abstract: “Please let her be at least 30.” “Please let him be under 50.” Neither was true, but it didn’t matter.
2017-12-30.snippet: “Please let her be at least 30.” “Please let him be under 50.” Neither was true, but it didn’t matter.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Abby René Olivier and Earp Franklin Jennings were married Dec. 30 at Christ Episcopal Church in Little Rock, Ark. The Rev. J. Scott Walters, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony, with the Rev. Kate Alexander, also an Episcopal priest, taking part.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Born for Each Other

2017-12-30.abstract: The entrepreneur behind the project hopes to give people somewhere safe to sleep in a city that bans material tents.
2017-12-30.snippet: The entrepreneur behind the project hopes to give people somewhere safe to sleep in a city that bans material tents.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: With material tents forbidden on the streets of Brussels, homeless people in the Belgian capital are often left without a safe place to sleep. But one entrepreneur seems to have found a way around the rule: origami-style cardboard tents.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Origami-Style Cardboard Tents for Homeless in Brussels

2017-12-30.abstract: Preschoolers and kindergartners are most likely to start fires caused by play, and are most likely to die in them, according to the National Fire Protection Association.
2017-12-30.snippet: Preschoolers and kindergartners are most likely to start fires caused by play, and are most likely to die in them, according to the National Fire Protection Association.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The fire that killed 12 people at an apartment building in the Bronx on Thursday night was started by a 3-year-old boy who was playing with the burners on a stove — which he had done before, his mother told investigators. The cause was heart-wrenching, but the behavior not that uncommon.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Why Children Play With Fire, and How to Stop Them

2017-12-30.abstract: Haiti’s ambassador on alleged comments from President Trump: “It is long past time for such thinking to end.”
2017-12-30.snippet: Haiti’s ambassador on alleged comments from President Trump: “It is long past time for such thinking to end.”
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Once again, Haiti, a country with deep historical ties to the United States, is in the news. Once again, a negative narrative permeates the public dialogue and Haitian people are compelled to defend our humanity. Once again, the circumstances require us to wage a battle on two fronts: tackling the physical rebuilding of our nation so that future generations can prosper, while simultaneously combating prejudice and stigma that risk being, over time, institutionalized in the American consciousness.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Our Country Deserves Your Respect, Not Your Pity

2017-12-30.abstract: George Papadopoulos, a Trump foreign policy adviser, was the improbable match that set off a blaze that has consumed the first year of the Trump administration.
2017-12-30.snippet: George Papadopoulos, a Trump foreign policy adviser, was the improbable match that set off a blaze that has consumed the first year of the Trump administration.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — During a night of heavy drinking at an upscale London bar in May 2016, George Papadopoulos, a young foreign policy adviser to the Trump campaign, made a startling revelation to Australia’s top diplomat in Britain: Russia had political dirt on Hillary Clinton.
2017-12-30.headline_main: How the Russia Inquiry Began: A Campaign Aide, Drinks and Talk of Political Dirt

2017-12-30.abstract: Ten great episodes that illustrate how “The Daily,” hosted by Michael Barbaro, uses storytelling to explain the biggest stories of the day to a fast-growing, devoted audience.
2017-12-30.snippet: Ten great episodes that illustrate how “The Daily,” hosted by Michael Barbaro, uses storytelling to explain the biggest stories of the day to a fast-growing, devoted audience.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Ten great episodes that illustrate how “The Daily,” hosted by Michael Barbaro, uses storytelling to explain the biggest stories of the day to a fast-growing, devoted audience.
2017-12-30.headline_main: The Best of ‘The Daily’ in 2017

2017-12-30.abstract: Mel Taub twists our brains.
2017-12-30.snippet: Mel Taub twists our brains.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: VARIETY PUZZLE — Mel Taub returns with a fun Puns and Anagrams puzzle. This flu is kicking my behind, so I’m going to leave you all to discuss this one amongst yourselves.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Puns and Anagrams

2017-12-30.abstract: A campaign to discredit the F.B.I. and the special counsel investigating President Trump is growing more heated, splitting the Republican Party.
2017-12-30.snippet: A campaign to discredit the F.B.I. and the special counsel investigating President Trump is growing more heated, splitting the Republican Party.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A growing campaign by President Trump’s most ardent supporters to discredit the special counsel, Robert S. Mueller III, and the law enforcement agencies assisting his investigation is opening new fissures in the Republican Party, with some lawmakers questioning the damage being done to federal law enforcement and to a political party that has long championed law and order.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Republican Attacks on Mueller and F.B.I. Open New Rift in G.O.P.

2017-12-30.abstract: He cooked up an ingenious scheme to break out of prison. So he tried to make a deal. But it wasn’t just any plan. And he wasn’t just any inmate.
2017-12-30.snippet: He cooked up an ingenious scheme to break out of prison. So he tried to make a deal. But it wasn’t just any plan. And he wasn’t just any inmate.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The plan sounds ingenious.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Why an Upstate Prisoner With a History of Escape Foiled His Latest

2017-12-30.abstract: Many were drawn to Belmont, where a fire killed 12, because it is affordable and safe. They stayed because they found a small town amid a metropolis.
2017-12-30.snippet: Many were drawn to Belmont, where a fire killed 12, because it is affordable and safe. They stayed because they found a small town amid a metropolis.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Even on a nose-numbingly cold morning, families were out on the sidewalks around Prospect Avenue. A mother tugged a beanie over her squiggling son’s ears, and girls ran down the block. They were trailed by a boy towing a wagon filled from a trip to the store, his younger brother wedged in with produce and paper towels.
2017-12-30.headline_main: In Fire-Scarred Bronx Neighborhood, a World of New Arrivals, Children and Community

2017-12-30.abstract: Feeling terrified and tormented, Jacqueline Torres bought a gun. Two decades later, she is still rebuilding her life after serving time for attempted murder.
2017-12-30.snippet: Feeling terrified and tormented, Jacqueline Torres bought a gun. Two decades later, she is still rebuilding her life after serving time for attempted murder.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The man would not leave Jacqueline Torres alone.
2017-12-30.headline_main: ‘It Was His Life or Mine’: A Drastic Plan Altered Her Course

2017-12-30.abstract: Work that felt not only moving but also necessary.
2017-12-30.snippet: Work that felt not only moving but also necessary.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: There are great photo books every year, and 2017 was no exception. But something about the strained times intensified my feelings about the work I saw this year. The role of art felt more urgent, both as a response to the general political disorder and as a refuge from it. I didn’t merely like or appreciate the best work I saw; I needed it. The photo books that made my list range from large scholarly catalogs to poetic little volumes. They were published in seven different countries. Some were more conceptual in approach, while others were freer and more visceral. These winners all had in common the special qualities of great photo books: the pleasure of turning pages, the precision of thoughtful book design, the tactility of paper and the glow of the afterimages in the mind long after the book is set down.
2017-12-30.headline_main: The Best Photo Books of 2017

2017-12-30.abstract: The council’s executive director said the dismissals were common when a new administration takes office. Six members resigned in June in protest of President Trump.
2017-12-30.snippet: The council’s executive director said the dismissals were common when a new administration takes office. Six members resigned in June in protest of President Trump.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The Trump administration this week dismissed the remaining members of a federal advisory council on H.I.V. and AIDS. The group’s executive director said the move was a common occurrence in new administrations, but others questioned that.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Trump Ends Terms of Remaining Members of H.I.V. and AIDS Council

2017-12-30.abstract: Despite tripling airstrikes this year, American officials concede an attack emanating from the chaotic, ungoverned spaces of Yemen remains among their top terrorism fears.
2017-12-30.snippet: Despite tripling airstrikes this year, American officials concede an attack emanating from the chaotic, ungoverned spaces of Yemen remains among their top terrorism fears.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: MANAMA, Bahrain — The United States has tripled the number of airstrikes this year against Al Qaeda’s branch in Yemen, one of the deadliest and most sophisticated terrorist organizations in the world. American allies have pushed the militants from their lucrative coastal strongholds. And the Pentagon recently boasted of killing key Qaeda leaders and disrupting the group’s operations.
2017-12-30.headline_main: The U.S. Has Pummeled Al Qaeda in Yemen. But the Threat Is Barely Dented.

2017-12-30.abstract: The action was an attempt to promote safety and reduce accidents, officials said, although some climbers said they intended to challenge the rule.
2017-12-30.snippet: The action was an attempt to promote safety and reduce accidents, officials said, although some climbers said they intended to challenge the rule.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: KATHMANDU, Nepal — Nepal has barred solo climbers on its mountains, including Mount Everest, in an attempt to promote safety and reduce accidents, an official said on Saturday.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Nepal Bars Solo Climbers From Mount Everest

2017-12-30.abstract: Will #MeToo be named “Word of the Year”? Plus, some of our favorite gender stories from 2017.
2017-12-30.snippet: Will #MeToo be named “Word of the Year”? Plus, some of our favorite gender stories from 2017.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: As sexual misconduct scandals continue to unfold, our gender team is providing updates and analysis in a new newsletter. Read previous installments here and sign up here to receive future newsletters.
2017-12-30.headline_main: The #MeToo Moment: The Year in Gender

2017-12-30.abstract: With their Senate majority narrowed even further and a midterm election approaching, Republicans are seeking some consensus with Democrats after a year of intense division.
2017-12-30.snippet: With their Senate majority narrowed even further and a midterm election approaching, Republicans are seeking some consensus with Democrats after a year of intense division.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Senator Mitch McConnell sounded downright magnanimous in anticipation of 2018, eager to work closely with Democrats even though he had cut them out of virtually every big-ticket deliberation during 2017.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Republicans’ 2018 Resolution: Bipartisanship. Will It Last?

2017-12-30.abstract: Norwich’s outsize success in Olympic sports has much to do with the way it collectively rears its children, helping them succeed without causing burnout.
2017-12-30.snippet: Norwich’s outsize success in Olympic sports has much to do with the way it collectively rears its children, helping them succeed without causing burnout.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The road to the 2018 Winter Olympics in Pyeongchang, South Korea, runs through Norwich, a hilly and wooded family-oriented farming community tucked between Interstates 89 and 91 in rural Vermont. With a main street lined with white clapboard colonial buildings and a landmark steepled church, Norwich could be a set designer’s rendering of a tiny New England village.
2017-12-30.headline_main: A Tiny Vermont Town Is a Big Cradle of Olympians

2017-12-30.abstract: Ms. Garner, whose father died in 2014 after being put in a police chokehold, was a prominent critic of policing tactics.
2017-12-30.snippet: Ms. Garner, whose father died in 2014 after being put in a police chokehold, was a prominent critic of policing tactics.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Erica Garner, the daughter of Eric Garner who became an outspoken activist against police brutality after her father’s death at the hands of a New York police officer, died on Saturday, according to her mother. She was 27.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Erica Garner, Activist and Daughter of Eric Garner, Dies at 27

2017-12-30.abstract: I’ve always loved advice columns. Now I’m writing one.
2017-12-30.snippet: I’ve always loved advice columns. Now I’m writing one.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: I love advice columns, always have. Growing up, I read “Dear Abby” and “Ask Ann Landers.” I enjoyed the voyeurism — glimpses into the lives and troubles of others — and I appreciated the steady, practical advice as if truly, for any problem, there was a solution. Giving advice is nearly as satisfying: the simple pleasure of offering counsel and hoping that you are helping in some small way.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Ask Roxane: Is It Too Late to Follow My Dreams?

2017-12-30.abstract: In response to an editorial series, readers discuss how to prevent often fatal crimes of passion.
2017-12-30.snippet: In response to an editorial series, readers discuss how to prevent often fatal crimes of passion.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: To the Editor:
2017-12-30.headline_main: Guns and Domestic Violence

2017-12-30.abstract: Reconsidering my years as a deficit hawk.
2017-12-30.snippet: Reconsidering my years as a deficit hawk.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Every year at this time I join a growing number of journalistic flagellants in enumerating things that I got wrong in the previous annum’s worth of columns. When I started the practice, the annual audit sometimes felt a little bit too scrupulous, like picking nits with my own work. But the last two years have been different: As Donald Trump’s ascent turned all sorts of supposed wisdom into folly, I’ve found myself with a great deal of mistaken analysis to acknowledge and live down.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Confessions of a Columnist

2017-12-30.abstract: Colleges are crucial to American greatness but found themselves on the defensive in 2017.
2017-12-30.snippet: Colleges are crucial to American greatness but found themselves on the defensive in 2017.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: When all was said and done, the tax overhaul that President Trump signed into law a little more than a week ago didn’t beat up on higher education to the extent that earlier drafts of the legislation did. Americans who were deducting interest on student loans will still be able to do so. The tuition waivers that many graduate students receive won’t be treated as income.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Higher Ed’s Low Moment

2017-12-30.abstract: Economists were mostly incorrect in their predictions for 2017. That was par for the course.
2017-12-30.snippet: Economists were mostly incorrect in their predictions for 2017. That was par for the course.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: To borrow from Yogi Berra, it is tough to make predictions, especially about the future. But 2017 was particularly difficult. On many of the biggest forecasts — global growth, inflation, the trajectory of the big powers — the experts got the year wrong.
2017-12-30.headline_main: When Forecasters Get It Wrong: Always

2017-12-30.abstract: The magic of living on the park comes to an end.
2017-12-30.snippet: The magic of living on the park comes to an end.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: As if New Year’s Eve isn’t wonderful enough, it’s also the night I’m getting kicked out of my apartment. I’ve had a magical year, a year of living in a gorgeous two-bedroom apartment overlooking Prospect Park, in Brooklyn, for the same price as my previous place in East Harlem, which I shared with a lovely roommate and his disrespectful cat, Bobbi.
2017-12-30.headline_main: There’s No Place Like This Rent-Stabilized Home

2017-12-30.abstract: My father and the Pentagon seemed to agree. There could be life out there.
2017-12-30.snippet: My father and the Pentagon seemed to agree. There could be life out there.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The year now ending has been so laden with tumultuous news that one astounding report in the exhausted final days of 2017 seemed almost routine: that for years, an intelligence official burrowed within the Pentagon warren was running a secret program to investigate reports of unidentified flying objects.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Dad Believed in U.F.O.s. Turns Out He Wasn’t Alone.

2017-12-30.abstract: A real D.J. is part shaman, part tech wizard, part crowd psychologist, all artist. Many people claim the title, but far fewer embody it.
2017-12-30.snippet: A real D.J. is part shaman, part tech wizard, part crowd psychologist, all artist. Many people claim the title, but far fewer embody it.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: On New Year’s Eve, you’ll be dancing, one hopes. If you’re lucky you’ll be dancing to an honest-to-God disc jockey — not to someone’s Spotify playlist or the musings of the latest demi-celebrities to fancy themselves party conductors. A real D.J. is part shaman, part tech-wizard, part crowd psychologist, all artist. Many people claim the title but far fewer embody it.
2017-12-30.headline_main: A D.J. Could Save Your Life Tonight

2017-12-30.abstract: James W. White and Justin C. Mann, both of Schenectady, N.Y., were charged in the deaths of a woman, her 11- and 5-year-old children and her partner.
2017-12-30.snippet: James W. White and Justin C. Mann, both of Schenectady, N.Y., were charged in the deaths of a woman, her 11- and 5-year-old children and her partner.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Two suspects have been charged in a quadruple homicide in Troy, N.Y., a crime the police chief described as the worst he had seen in more than 40 years in law enforcement.
2017-12-30.headline_main: 2 Men Charged in Quadruple Homicide in Troy; Motive Is a Mystery

2017-12-30.abstract: Small industrial cities are accidents of history, and sometimes their luck runs out.
2017-12-30.snippet: Small industrial cities are accidents of history, and sometimes their luck runs out.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: I’m on vacation, keeping vague track of the news but basically taking a break and spending a lot of time communing with nature. But I’ve also been thinking a bit about economics, taking advantage of psychological distance to ruminate on stuff that isn’t closely connected to the news. And one of the areas I’ve been chewing over goes back to my old stomping ground of economic geography.
2017-12-30.headline_main: The Gambler’s Ruin of Small Cities (Wonkish)

2017-12-30.abstract: Mr. Portman, who was also a developer, built futuristic office complexes and hotels with towering atriums, transforming cityscapes across the world.
2017-12-30.snippet: Mr. Portman, who was also a developer, built futuristic office complexes and hotels with towering atriums, transforming cityscapes across the world.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: John Portman, the architect and developer who revolutionized hotel designs with soaring futuristic atriums, built commercial towers that revitalized the downtowns of decaying postwar American cities and transformed Asian skylines from Shanghai to Mumbai, died on Friday in Atlanta. He was 93.
2017-12-30.headline_main: John Portman, Architect Who Made Skylines Soar, Dies at 93

2017-12-30.abstract: Instead, a changing electorate that appears more forgiving of the steroid era may gradually push Bonds and Clemens closer to Cooperstown.
2017-12-30.snippet: Instead, a changing electorate that appears more forgiving of the steroid era may gradually push Bonds and Clemens closer to Cooperstown.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: A year ago, a change of heart among Baseball Hall of Fame voters gave a boost to the drug-tarnished candidacies of Barry Bonds and Roger Clemens, although it did not win them induction, or even get them that close.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Early Hall of Fame Voting for 2018 Shows No Surge for Bonds and Clemens

2017-12-30.abstract: Openly gay, lesbian and transgender people face persecution across the Arab world. The exception may be in Lebanon, which has slowly grown more tolerant thanks to the work of activists.
2017-12-30.snippet: Openly gay, lesbian and transgender people face persecution across the Arab world. The exception may be in Lebanon, which has slowly grown more tolerant thanks to the work of activists.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: Throughout the Arab world, gay, lesbian and transgender people face formidable obstacles to living a life of openness and acceptance in conservative societies.

2017-12-30.abstract: Public support from the United States government will do the demonstrators more harm than good.
2017-12-30.snippet: Public support from the United States government will do the demonstrators more harm than good.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As anti-government rallies gather momentum across Iran — taking outside analysts and the Iranian government alike by surprise — President Trump and his foreign policy advisers are likely asking what they can do to support the protesters.
2017-12-30.headline_main: How Can Trump Help Iran’s Protesters? Be Quiet.

2017-12-30.abstract: President Klaus Iohannis, who has long criticized efforts to weaken the fight against corruption, has 20 days to sign the measures into law or send them back to Parliament.
2017-12-30.snippet: President Klaus Iohannis, who has long criticized efforts to weaken the fight against corruption, has 20 days to sign the measures into law or send them back to Parliament.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: BUCHAREST, Romania — Across Eastern Europe, liberal values were under threat in 2017, with governments in countries like Hungary, Poland and Romania passing measures intended to push back against democratic principles, including anticorruption efforts, freedom of the press and the rule of law.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Romania Braces for President’s Decision on Bills Seen as Weakening Judiciary

2017-12-30.abstract: From rare white giraffes to criminal donkeys to chilly elephants, take a look at some of our strangest stories about animals in 2017 that resonated with readers.
2017-12-30.snippet: From rare white giraffes to criminal donkeys to chilly elephants, take a look at some of our strangest stories about animals in 2017 that resonated with readers.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: The animal kingdom is full of wondrous, wild and weird stories.
2017-12-30.headline_main: A Year of Animal Oddities Around the World: 7 Reader Favorites

2017-12-30.abstract: John Lampkin ends our solving year.
2017-12-30.snippet: John Lampkin ends our solving year.
2017-12-30.lead_paragraph: SUNDAY PUZZLE — Even though John Lampkin’s puzzle publishes online on Saturday, it is technically the last crossword of the calendar year, so it’s fitting that he chose the concept of ringing out the old and ringing in the new as his theme.
2017-12-30.headline_main: Ring Out the Old, Ring In the New

2017-12-31.snippet: “Mechanics of History” features a circular staircase, a trampoline and entitled men, persistent and ever ascending.
2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: Every once in a while with Twitter, you find something that breaks through the bilge and recrimination. Or, sometimes something finds you. One night, “The Mechanics of History” found me. It’s an art installation by Yoann Bourgeois that sat in a daylit rotunda at the Panthéon, in Paris. And for a long while in late fall, I found myself mesmerized by a video of it, starring men spinning off a staircase and onto a trampoline.

2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: The true way to experience improvised music is live. More than in most other art forms, jazz’s big discoveries and developments have historically happened onstage: The music’s creation depends on an engaged, participating audience. With that in mind, we’re starting this column, recapping the most outstanding live jazz performances I’ve seen over the past month. I’m hoping that it will offer some clues as to where jazz is headed these days — and maybe even encourage you to go out and hear it for yourself.
2017-12-31.headline_main: The Month in Live Jazz: 5 Standout Shows

2017-12-31.abstract: Two Times media reporters analyze why 2017, despite powerful foes like Netflix and the fallout of harassment scandals, was the year TV roared back.
2017-12-31.snippet: Two Times media reporters analyze why 2017, despite powerful foes like Netflix and the fallout of harassment scandals, was the year TV roared back.
2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: A cable-news-obsessed president turned TV journalists into household names. A nationwide reckoning on sexual harassment ended the careers of some of television’s best-known personalities. And Americans, seeking clarity amid the noise, turned to networks like Fox News and MSNBC in record numbers. Two New York Times media reporters analyze 2017, the year when TV roared back.
2017-12-31.headline_main: From Trump to #MeToo: A Dizzying Year in TV News

2017-12-31.abstract: The nonsensical catchphrase from a Bud Light ad campaign has taken hold on social media, especially among sports fans.
2017-12-31.snippet: The nonsensical catchphrase from a Bud Light ad campaign has taken hold on social media, especially among sports fans.
2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: In 1995, a nation was rapt as three frogs croaked the syllables in “Budweiser.” Four years later, Budweiser prompted countless television viewers to wag their tongues and ask their friends, “Whassup?”
2017-12-31.headline_main: How Do You Turn an Ad Into a Meme? Two Words: Dilly Dilly

2017-12-31.abstract: Jacqueline Jones discusses her new biography of Lucy Parsons, a woman born into slavery who became an outspoken advocate for the working classes.
2017-12-31.snippet: Jacqueline Jones discusses her new biography of Lucy Parsons, a woman born into slavery who became an outspoken advocate for the working classes.
2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: Lucy Parsons would stand out today, so one can imagine the scene she created as a woman in the second half of the 19th century espousing anarchy for the purpose of overthrowing capitalism. An African-American born into slavery, Parsons grew up to fashion a story about herself, claiming to be the daughter of Mexican and Native American parents. In her new biography, “Goddess of Anarchy,” Jacqueline Jones writes that Parsons “rejected a personal historical or ethnic identity in favor of presenting herself as the champion of the laboring classes; that, she thought, was all that people needed to know about her.” Ms. Jones, who won the Bancroft Prize in 1986 for her book “Labor of Love, Labor of Sorrow: Black Women, Work, and the Family, from Slavery to the Present,” teaches in the history department at the University of Texas at Austin. Below, she talks about the new information she unearthed about Parsons, the way Parsons captivated crowds and much more.
2017-12-31.headline_main: Tell Us 5 Things About Your Book: ‘Goddess of Anarchy’

2017-12-31.abstract: At a public forum with Times readers, survivors reconnect to discuss if and how they can “find the humanity.”
2017-12-31.snippet: At a public forum with Times readers, survivors reconnect to discuss if and how they can “find the humanity.”
2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: The Reader Center is one way we in the newsroom are trying to connect with you, by highlighting your perspectives and experiences and offering insight into how we work.
2017-12-31.headline_main: How a Reporter and Victims’ Families Went ‘Beyond the Horror’ of 2 Kansas Hate Crimes

2017-12-31.abstract: The earthquake of sexual misconduct allegations has taken down powerful men without regard to politics, but as it shakes Washington, accusations are taking on a partisan tint.
2017-12-31.snippet: The earthquake of sexual misconduct allegations has taken down powerful men without regard to politics, but as it shakes Washington, accusations are taking on a partisan tint.
2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As the #MeToo movement to expose sexual harassment roils the nation’s capital, political partisans are exploiting the moment, raising hundreds of thousands of dollars to support accusers who come forward with charges against President Trump and members of Congress, even amid questions about their motivation.
2017-12-31.headline_main: Partisans, Wielding Money, Begin Seeking to Exploit Harassment Claims

2017-12-31.abstract: As midnight struck from East to West, revelers welcomed 2018 with fireworks, festivities, food, drinks and dancing. (And hundreds of weddings.)
2017-12-31.snippet: As midnight struck from East to West, revelers welcomed 2018 with fireworks, festivities, food, drinks and dancing. (And hundreds of weddings.)
2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: In Sydney, rainbow fireworks sparkled off the Harbour Bridge in celebration of Australia’s recent legalization of gay marriage. (Sydney was among the first major cities to celebrate with fireworks at the stroke of midnight.)
2017-12-31.headline_main: The World Celebrates New Year’s Eve

2017-12-31.snippet: Artificial intelligence is making it possible for Street Views to be mined for insights about the economy, politics and human behavior — just as text mining has done for years.

2017-12-31.abstract: Matthew Sewell and our editors start our solving year by setting it on fire.
2017-12-31.snippet: Matthew Sewell and our editors start our solving year by setting it on fire.
2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: MONDAY PUZZLE — Some of you will be reading this before the New Year, and some of you will be reading this when it’s 2018. This post is always tricky to pin down for everyone, so let me pre-emptively and retroactively wish you all a Happy New Year. I hope that no matter how you plan to or did celebrate, fun will be or was had by all, at the time it was actually had.
2017-12-31.headline_main: Torch Song Pentalogy

2017-12-31.abstract: In his year-end report on the state of the federal judiciary, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. addressed reports of sexual misconduct by an appeals court judge.
2017-12-31.snippet: In his year-end report on the state of the federal judiciary, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. addressed reports of sexual misconduct by an appeals court judge.
2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Responding to the retirement of a prominent appeals court judge accused of sexual harassment, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. said the federal court system must do more to protect law clerks and other employees from abusive conduct.
2017-12-31.headline_main: Courts Must Better Police Themselves on Harassment, Chief Justice Says

2017-12-31.abstract: A fake report of a hostage situation led to the death of an innocent man at the hands of the police. Who bears responsibility?
2017-12-31.snippet: A fake report of a hostage situation led to the death of an innocent man at the hands of the police. Who bears responsibility?
2017-12-31.lead_paragraph: When the police surrounded a house in Wichita, Kan., late Thursday, they expected to find a gunman who told a 911 dispatcher that he was holding his mother and brother at gunpoint after shooting his father in the head.
2017-12-31.headline_main: Fatal ‘Swatting’ Episode in Kansas Raises Quandary: Who Is to Blame?
